Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great central location”
Reviews.Author: Amandatravels7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location for exploring Rome on foot. Five to ten minute walk to Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon. Staff recommended excellent restaurants and quickly sorted out getting us into the correct room because they originally put us in a single when we'd booked a double. Beds were very comfortable and rooms were large by European standards. Excellent breakfast provided (included in our room rate). I will stay here again when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Roma, Roma, Roma!!”
Reviews.Author: garnet8
Reviews.Content: This was the last leg of our Italian vacation and the hotel was beautiful. The room was a good size, there was ample room for us to put our belongings, the bed was very comfortable, the shower was fantastic. The breakfast buffet was superb, the choice of food was excellent. The gentlemen at the front desk were super helpful, they gave us a map and we used it, often. The location of the hotel is awesome. We walked about a block and were wondering where exactly the colesseum was and we looked up from the map and could see it down the street a ways, this hotel was pretty much in the middle of everything. We walked most everywhere except for the night of the game between Roma and Genoa, we took a tram, what a wonderful public transportation system they have, no shortage of transportations. I ate paninnis and pizza till I couldn't anymore and well gelato...I never knew how much I really liked it. I tried alot of flavors. We did a walking night tour around the city that turned out to be very interesting, hit most of the must see attractions. If I were to go back to Rome, I would stay at this hotel and I would recommend it to anyone who asked if I knew where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Karam J
Reviews.Content: the location is insane...the price for this location is even better. yes this is not a true 4 star room-wise, and yes the wi-fi is weird (can only be accessed in the lobby and you have to pay extra for it, 10 euros for 12 hours of total use) however the breakfast was great, and the front desk service was too. the heater was not working the night me and my cousin got in so we froze however the next day we complained and they got it fixed instantly. the beds in this room were facing opposite directions which was weird but honestly, your in rome, why the hell would you wanna be sitting in your hotel room when you can walk to the colloseum in 10 minutes? or 5 minutes to the trevi fountain? in fact we walked ALL over rome from there, and it was the coldest winter they had, and we still enjoyed it because of this hotels location! i would definitely try to visit this place again! oh and the girls in training at the front desk were very cute :P especially the one who was trying to pronounce my name in her italian accent hahaha

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Barfly-guy
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. Right beside Piazza Venetia, it is a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum, 5 minutes to Trevi Fountain, but best of all...there is an express bus right outside that takes you to the Vatican at one end, and the Termini at the other. For only 1 euro, the bus is the only way to travel. Even took the bus to the Stadio Olimpico for a soccer match. The room was just a room but clean and functional. The buffet breakfast was the same each day, but more than sufficient. The concierges were always friendly and helpful in booking tours. We never ate at the restaurant, although the prices seemed quite good. Don't go looking for a North American 4 star, this would be a 3 star at best. There is also a rooftop terrace with a nice view. There is a great restaurant around the corner called Melo's. Not as expensive as the ones near the Trevi, and the service is exceptional. Sit across from the Piazza at one of the patios and enjoy the hustle and bustle of Rome. Watching the traffic cops navigate the mess is enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “location ideal”
Reviews.Author: cheryl24
Reviews.Content: a co worker and i stayed at the cosmopolita March 22-26,2012 and the best thing about this hotel is the location...good breakfast, and nice roof patio. Chris checked us in and he was very polite and helpful. The other 2 receptionists were on the rude side.. but, just to note..we were in room 514 and there is an elevator but you must climb another 10-15 steps to the rooms..so if you are impaired.this could be a problem. The bathroom was clean and in good shape, with a very small shower, an obese person would struggle. the rooms are a narrow rectangle shape. A mini fridge ( items cost and are tracked) no air, but a nice window....but note, the front of the hotel is under construction, however we never heard any noise. The police station is next door and again never heard noise. The beds were firm and comfortable, but again a n obese person would struggle. We had a room with 2 single beds. Price averaged about 115.00 usd per night and there is a Rome tax to be paid in euro's at check out.(about 3 euro per night.) The glass bar is located at the hotel on the first floor..nice ,but alittle price-y. Resurants are close by. We had the hotel arrange our taxi to the airport and the taxi was on time and direct. I would stay here again, but request a larger room for the money. easy walking distance to colosseum and other sights.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Logan2585
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel very close to all of the great attractions in Rome. My wife and I walked everywhere and didn't spend a dime on Taxis. Pros We had a free breakfast that was pretty good. Hot food and fresh fruits. Helpful Concierge Perfect Location Bathrooms were clean and our rooms was well kept Decent Size Rooms - We had the Double Superior Size Cons Beds were a firm feel - Not "hard" just on the firm side Walls are thin - But overall it was a quiet stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Dedalus54
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Rome during a bus and Metro strike and, with a massive queue at the taxi rank, decided to walk fron Termini to the hotel (around 1km). Thankfully I had checked out the hotel on Google Streets or I might not have been able to find it as the street was not listed on the map I had. The hotel is modern, clean and bright, reception and bar staff are helpful and friendly, the breakfast is ample and although the room was on the small side it was clean, comfortable and quiet with a good shower. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: Dan l
Reviews.Content: Smaller modern hotel located very central adjacent to Piazza Venizia. Good, clean hotel off of main drag and hustle bustle of main Piazza. Rooms were small but very comfortable. Clean with no issues whatsoever. AC, Heat, shower all functioned normally. Staff friendly and helpful. Internet avail in lobby. Cant recall about internet in room. Didn't have computer with me so no problem. Location is good for travel to Forum, Palatine Hill and Colloseum. Short taxi ride to St Peters. Walk to Navona, Campo Di Fiore, and Spanish Steps. Would stay here again. Breakfast normal fare eggs, meats, breads, fruit, cereal. Have been to Rome half a dozen times and give this hotel thumbs up. It is off the main street but it is still in a very busy part of town. If you are looking for a quiet residential neighborhood this is not the hotel for you. Overall though I have nothing to be critical of this hotel about. Have a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, BEST location”
Reviews.Author: TravelMamaNY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in April 2009 and we picked it because one of the other travel sites recommended it. We were not disappointed. The hotel itself is very nice, and the room was nice too. The room was a decent size and it was clean. The bathroom in our particular room was very small and the shower wasn't great. But, everything was certainly acceptable. The BEST part of this hotel is the location. It is close to EVERYTHING in Rome. You can walk to all the major sites from here. We did not take a cab the entire time in Rome because we were so centrally located. If you are looking for a moderate hotel in a great location, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ian S
Reviews.Content: My wife booked us a 4 day break in rome. This hotel was perfectly located close to piazza venezia. Coliseum was 5-10 minute walk, trevi fountain 2-3 minutes walk. Superb location, could not recommend it more highly. The hotel itself was good. Clean, tidy, very, very good. Not sure it would warrant a 5-star rating, but definitely a 4+, Staff were friendly and helpful, food was good, rooms comfortable - my wife said the bed was hard, Didn't eat in the restaurant in the evening, but it looked good and other guests said it was very good. No hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All about location”
Reviews.Author: clouds111
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about the location. A 5/10 minute walk to the Colloseum, Roman forums and the Jewish quarter, 10/15 to the Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, 20 to the Spanish Steps and about 30 to the Vatican. The room was tiny and very dark as it overlooked a central light well but it was clean and quiet. Shower was lovely. Breakfast was what you should expect from a standard city hotel - scrabbled egg, sausage, bacon, selection of cereals, yoghurt, fruit. We also tried dinner at the restaurant and the food was good. Service though was odd and at times entertaining (poor waitress got a right earful at one point). There are some small things that let this hotel down which I often wouldn't bother to point out normally but feel like that it will explain my 3 stars. The pillows were rock hard which didn't make for a comfy sleep, no tea/coffee facilities in the room, the 2 English channels (CNN and BBC World news) had really bad reception making it difficult to watch. No I definitely do not go on holiday to watch tv but we both were quite ill the first couple of nights so was stuck in the room longer than we would have liked. No wifi in the room (but was available in reception for €6 3 hours). I'm not a fussy person (see my other reviews) but these few things irritated me a little, but I could put that down to feeling unwell. In any event I would probably stay at this hotel again because the location and price is too good to pass up.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and great location...just nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: PJ02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cosmpolita for one night. The hotel is in a great location and close to all the key sites you'd want to see while in Rome. The room was a generous size and spotlessly clean. Can't fault the hotel at all. Comfy bed and a great night's sleep. We've stayed in Rome several times and this place is good value for money. I'd give the restaurant a miss though.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; pleasant staff; small room; terrific restaurant”
Reviews.Author: 347NY
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights there at end of January in a "double for a single person" room. The room and bath were extremely small, even by European standards, and the pillows were too flat for my taste and the bed was too firm. I don't know about the sizes of other rooms. Leave your WiFi devices at home because, like most Rome hotels, they'll charge an arm and a leg for connection. I didn't bother, so I can't testify about how well it works. But the location is excellent, the staff are friendly and professional, and they all seem to speak at least a little English. Breakfast was plentiful, although you might want to steer clear of the poor scrambled eggs, the fatty bacon and what appeared to be hot dogs cut up. This is Italy, so eat like the Italians: a cornetto (croissant) with your coffee, and save your appetite for lunch. If you must, there's plenty of salami and ham, cheese, cereal, fruit, yogurt and cakes as well. I don't normally eat in hotel restaurants but one night I was sore and tired from walking and decided to try their E40 seafood prix fixe dinner. It was excellent! And the waiter, who was very nice as well as professional, kept pouring me very good wines (included in the price). Maybe this was because I was letting him practice his English while I practiced my Italian, or maybe it was because there were only a couple of other tables occupied, but still, it was a pleasant surprise to have such a good and plentiful meal for that price, and in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Rome trip - 31st Jan-3rd Feb”
Reviews.Author: Rachel N
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated between all of the sites, and the train station is only 20 minutes walk away. The staff were helpful, and friendly. Our room was incredibly quiet, perfect for a great nights sleep in a busy city. It was warm and clean. Only downside is that there were no tea and coffee making facilities, which during the winter would've been welcome as it was so cold outside. Ideal hotel for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmopolita - Rome”
Reviews.Author: JohnMulroy40
Reviews.Content: I was worried about the guy on reception having read some reviews but all I can say to those critics, having met him is, lighten up. The guy has a sense of humour is all. Can you imagine how dull it must be sat behind that desk all day. He was charming and helpful. More specifically, in my room they had to use a little too much bleach as the drains did smell quite a bit and the toilet handle was broken. These are basic things that should be fixed and not just left for guest after guest to put up with. It wasn't the most exciting breakfast in the world but them I'm veggie - I suspect the meat eaters were happier. I agree with some other reviews that the 4* star status is overly generous, but I guess having a restaurant attached explains this. I think a decent 3* is a better description for this hotel but it was comfortable, convenient and I wouldn't object to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but not to expected four star standard”
Reviews.Author: AliDLimerick
Reviews.Content: Very nice room (small), location spectacular. Close to everything (i mean everything). On the doorstep of all major sights. Bathroom products of high standard. Excellent air conditioning system. Marble stairs and lovely rooftop terrace. Not allowed to bring food to the room. Got a lovely quiet room with balcony. Staff good. Breakfast decent. Bar and restaurant on premises but expensive. Expected pool and room service in a four star hotel. As with most European hotels, no tea/coffee making facility in room.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon trip”
Reviews.Author: fezray
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is what makes it. Staff were mostly friendly and helpful when needed. We mentioned on booking that this was our honeymoon, but this wasn't acknowledged, which was a shame. The room was spacious and clean, and good to relax in after a long day out exploring. The breakfast was good - plenty to choose from. I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for a better location!”
Reviews.Author: DaveRock
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location (we were even able to walk to the Vatican from here!). The rooms are comfortable and pleasant. We had a room on the top floor and the views were fantastic. The staff were very accommodating and friendly. They were able to provide information that we requested and always had a smile when we passed. The breakfast was great, the scrambled eggs were out of this world! It maybe isn't the most luxurious hotel in Rome but you will struggle to find one in such a great location at such a reasonable price. Don't listen to the moaners who want 5 star accommodation for the price of 3 star! We plan to return to Rome with our six year old boys and we will be using the hotel again. The hotel is secure, comfortable and clean!

Reviews.Title: “Old Furniture , Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: a7_mad1991
Reviews.Content: When i read the reviews about Cosmopolita , i was tricked into thinking this was a rerspectable 4 star hotel !! This couldnt be further from the truth ! Reception staff is very unhelpful and grim. the room furniture is in bad condition and just an eye sore. (looks like the same furniture used since 1971 !!!) The bathroom was so small and compressed that i kept bumping into the counter !!! The shower had a very dangerous slope (i almost tripped and broke my neck TWICE !!) The breakfast buffet was mediocre at best. the location :Well , the location is at the very beginning of Via Del Corso which is the best shopping street ... There are much better hotels than this one so spend your money else where !!! (The hotel is like 3 stars not 4 !!)

Reviews.Title: “Rome City Break”
Reviews.Author: Oscar028
Reviews.Content: Nice city centre hotel, excellent location - within easy walking distance of all major tourist attractions. Pleasant staff and good continental breakfast. Superb value for money. Had fantastic trip and will definitely book again for my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: trent s
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and a very good value. Exceeded my expectations, the rooms were very nice, high ceilings, wood floors. Great location, every major site is within walking distance. No complaints, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: traveller759
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this hotel is in a great location, really central to everything, we walked from the train station (about 20mins) and to all the tourist locations, the furthest being the vatican (about 30 mins). Our room was good, albeit greeted very coldly by the reception staff. He proceeded to show us the hotel location on the map whilst looking over our shoulders the whole time. We booked a superior room to ensure we had a larger room, and indeed it was spacious. the bathroom was tiny but perfectly formed and very clean. The double bed was 2 singles locked together, and the matress and pillows were very hard, but surprisingly this lead to a very good firsts nights sleep! It was only on our second night (a friday) we noticed that it was much noisier at night time. We had requested a quiet room, and had been given a room at the end of the corridor, on the 4th floor, which was not on the road side. But until the early hours of the morning we could hear loud bangs, we assumed it was the terrace restaurant on the top floor, the furniture being moved etc, but it managed to keep us awake! Then on the Saturday evening we could hear loud music, we think it must have been a nearby dicso, as it was the bass that we could hear. Also, everytime our neighbours pulled the toilet chain it made a very loud clang! So the quiet room turned out to be not so quiet!! But, we can appreciate the hotel is very central and this comes hand in hand with noise. The breakfast was average, there was good choice, and the restaurant is clean and tidy. We had enjoyed our stay on the whole until it was time to check out. It seemed the whole hotel was trying to check out at the same time and the reception desk was chaos. There was one guy manning it, and the queue was as orderly as Italian queues get! We finally reached the front and the reception guy explained our charges, we were prepared for the city tax (3 euro per day per person) and wanted to pay in cash. This apparetly upset the man and he told us he didn't have time to sort the cash, he kept flinging his arms the the air and saying 'no'. We insisted and eventually he accepted the 18 euros! We just found his reaction completely inappropriate and over the top and made our lasting impression of the hotel a bad one. I would receommed it for the location and convenience, but be prepared for the less than friendly reception staff and average rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location!”
Reviews.Author: JoeMc96
Reviews.Content: After researching Rome we chose this area as we thought it would be within good walking distance of everything and it was. (After travelling to central Rome on the train we then made the mistake of taking a taxi from the station which was not far and cost a fortune - would not make this mistake again!) So we were glad of not having to rely on transport. We walked to the Vatican too - this is a long walk, but definately possible. Our room was well equipped, although the television was very basic and no wifi, but we dont go on a break to watch tv and go on net so we coped! It was clean and nicely decorated. We ate in the hotel a lot, breakfast, which was good and also in the bar and restaurant. Staff were helpful when we needed anything. Rome is definately worth a visit, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Mxyptlyk
Reviews.Content: Came for five nights mid-November 2011. Weather was beautiful, Hotel was excellent. Good room, right on the corner of the hotel, overlooking the busy street. Noisy when window open, but almost silent when shut. Good breakfast, absolutely nothing to complain about, apart from the price in the hotel bar - 8 Euros for one small glass of wine. Dined out from then on near the Trevi fountain and bought a litre of excellent house-white for 8 Euros. Hotel is in a very good position - walked everywhere, Colosseum, Trevi, Parthenon, Piazza Navona, Vatican City museums, St Peter's Basilica - no need for a taxi. Would visit Rome and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best is the location.”
Reviews.Author: Denyson
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a few bad things like the TV (reallyhard to operate and with no channel variety) and no internet wifi on the rooms (this is just unbelieveble nowadays). Breakfast is included and good. The location close to piazza venezia is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great intro to Rome”
Reviews.Author: NYS_traveller
Reviews.Content: We did an overnight at the Cosmopolita at the beginning of a Mediterranean cruise, our first visit to Rome. The place was long on European sophistication and centrally located around the corner from the Piazza Venezia, in the midst of many great shops and restaurants. Though our room was small (which we expected) and the bed a little hard (not a terrible thing), everything was clean and the staff were friendly and very helpful. There was also a very good cafe/bar downstairs. And a special thanks to Max at the front desk, who answered our myriad emails prior to our arrival. All in all, it was a great introduction to Rome and would we would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “G&T 6pm sharp on the terrace over looking the city”
Reviews.Author: Natalie B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is central, the breakfast is great, the staff are friendly and terrace is fantastic. Overlooking all of the roofs across the amazing city. I did notice that the double beds are a little on the small side, larger people will struggle to sleep together in a small double. Good value for money. This is definately somewhere I would return to and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: kim0503
Reviews.Content: The hotel has to be the best location in Rome for a city break, if you want to explore the city stay here. A little pricey but then it is the capital. Ample breakfast compared to a lot of other hotels in Rome that I looked at. No tea/coffee in room so take a travel kettle if you like an early coffee while getting ready! There are 3 levels of room basic, superior and deluxe. We stayed in a superior....I would definitely recommend this as the basic is smaller with a much smaller bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: garden1958
Reviews.Content: My hubby and myself were not impressed with the breakfast and there is an odor near the elevator but everything else was excellent. The front desk was very helpful as to what bus to take where, check in and out was quick, the rooms were spacious and quiet. The best thing was the location, you could fall out of bed and be at the colloseum. The bus was a half a block away, and a ton of great restaurants within 3-4 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better location!!!”
Reviews.Author: re1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in the heart of the historical centre of Rome, literally 5-10 minutes from all of the essential sights in the Eternal City including the Colloseum and the amazing Trevi Fountain. The staff were very helpful and attentive and the reception staff were extremlely knowledgable. The room was very wel decorated and spacious considering its location and the fact that rooms in hotels in Rome do tend to be smaller than most places. It was always clean and well presented. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the restaurant was a nice place to eat. If you're looking to go to Rome, look no further than the Hotel Cosmopolita. And don't forget to buy your Roma card at the airport!!!

Reviews.Title: “Front desk”
Reviews.Author: Ellen T
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice with excellent breakfast and great location. Gentlemen at front desk, Bruno & Danillo were outstanding with recommendations and arranging for a last minute car service when we were in dire need. Thank you, Ellen & Marie

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally well placed”
Reviews.Author: HomethenAway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I weren't really expecting much as the price for this hotel was so reasonable compared to others in the area. We were very pleasantly surprised our room was great it was a good size, clean, bright and modern given it is such an old building our view was to the main road, but considering the amount of traffic going by very quiet. Not sure that this would be the case if you had to open the window, we didn't so no problem. The only room gripe would be that the shower would not be suitable for anyone of size. Breakfast was buffet style each morning and was plentiful and varied. The hotel itself is perfectly placed to walk to almost all the major attractions and the front desk staff very helpful in pointing you in the right direction. Small tip do book a guided tour of the Vatican more expensive than purchasing tickets on the day, but so much more convenient than waiting for hours in queues you also have the advantage of having someone who knows the details on so many little things to look out for. We had booked the shuttle bus from the airport to the station (£14 ea) and then caught a taxi from the station to the hotel (9 euro) also did this going home, no major hassles with either journey. There is a little pizzaria across the road from the hotel Ceasar's the owner is a gem made food for us even though it was well pass closing time (after midnight) had a set three course meal for 10 euro ea and the food was fab, well worth dropping in for a bite when your tired out from a days walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good bed, awesome roof view!”
Reviews.Author: DetroitH
Reviews.Content: We got to this hotel for our first stay in Rome, and we were really happy with it! We ended up getting the taxi service direct from the airport instead of using the train and walking, which was a bit pricey (50 Euro) BUT worth it for a vacation of no aggravation! Taxi pulls right up to the hotel, which is on a nice little off shoot of a main street. Our room was great, we had a double bed and normal bathroom for 2 people. We were on the main street side but the windows are super and we could not hear anything (except the occasional ambulance) when they were shut. The bathroom was fine- you aren't staying in the bathroom anyways! big enough for two people to brush their teeth and ours had a little shelving unit on wheels that was handy. Beds were great, not home but best version of a queen/king/two twins together we had the whole trip, which is important! Closet space was fine- plenty of hangers for clothes. I didn't like the hotel's wireless policy- go to the lobby and pay for usage- most places give it to you for free for at least 24 hours... that is the one downfall of this hotel. Breakfast was great though- buffet style to make sure you are fueled for the walking you will do! A coffee/capu/cafe machine, so no waiting for a person to get you whatever hot beverage you want. There is also a rooftop seating area that is outdoors and indoors, whatever you want, with a great view of Rome during the day and night. First come first serve on seating, and for some reason the hotel staff didn't tell us about it, but it was open and super nice! relaxing and no crazy street traffic like other outside seating. The hotel has a great map of the area for attractions, so don't waste money on a streetwise map like we did for staying in the heart of Rome. The hotel map is color and also paper, much easier to fold up and not look like such a tourist with huge map, blocking sidewalk traffic.... :) All attractions are within reasonable walking distance for a normal person. Roman Forum ruins are just down the street to see at night and during the day. Restaurant across main street was great (Caesars?) and there is a little market with wine, water and meats. If yu turn to the left out of the hotel doors and walk down the street a bit, one one short, stairs/street on your left there is a Farmacia (emergencies only! expensive!) but also a little sandwich shop that is awesome and cheap, and next to that gelato, which is also cheaper than elsewhere! Very handy to have around.

Reviews.Title: “Converted Rabbit holes into hotelrooms”
Reviews.Author: FOL-1003
Reviews.Content: it was easy to find and the location is its strength, but otherwise, things drop alot: - the room was so tiny, i had 40cm from doors to bed. - the wet room, is more a cell, with a loo so positioned that you have to sit at it while you brush your teeth. - reception were friendly folks, a bit arrogant, but hey, its Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good price”
Reviews.Author: Carline
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, easy walking distance to the forum, colloseum, piazza navona and trevi fountain - at the most 10 minutes (even with a 70year old in tow). The breakfast was average, but met my expectations for a continental breakfast in Italy. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Service good and you don't have to check out until noon. A good base for exploring Rome at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful visit to the eternal city!”
Reviews.Author: WillaF
Reviews.Content: For folks who are looking for a hotel that is close to everything...stop here. Cosmopolita hotel was close to everything; Trevi fountain, Roman forum, the pantheon and piazza navona, etc. The only time we got a car was to and from the airport. It's not every morning that you wake up and walk out the door and around the corner to the coliseum. Seriously, it was a amazing. The breakfast was great and the room was perfect. We could have used a little more space in the bathroom, but that's what you get in europe! The only I would suggest for the hotel would be to start offering wifi in the rooms for no charge. Overall, an excellent trip and stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “suzie chops”
Reviews.Author: SusieChops
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel booked as a suprise for my husbands 50 th birthday very central walked to all the famous sights would reccomend booking vatican tour to avoid queues we booked dark rome tours it was excellent staff in hotel very helpful and rooms very clean hope to go back soon

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, central Hotel. No free wifi in the rooms though”
Reviews.Author: DaithiJ
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Location is excellent, near the Trevi fountain, Pantheon etc. There was no free wifi in the rooms,. I wouldnt have booked if I had known this as now I make it a point not to book hotels that dont have free wifi in the rooms. And free wifi in the lobby doesnt count. Room was very nice and clean. Didnt have breakfast. The hotel is a little on the expensive side though. There are cheaper, better hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: AngloLA
Reviews.Content: Location couldn't be better to walk to the sights of Rome. Very close to Trevi fountain, easy walk to Colosseum, Forum, Piazza Navona and all the restaurants. We even walked back from the Vatican. The only thing we took a cab to was Galleria Borghese. Rooms are clean, comfortable, air conditioned, have a TV with CNN in English, Wifi connect, Neutrogena products. Includes a daily breakfast buffet and there is a bar/restaurant on site, Le Glass. There are also loads of restaurants feet away and an Irish pub, the Scholar's Lounge. Staff friendly and helpful. It may not be the Hilton but you are steps away from thousands of years of history. Oh, and you can always find your way back because there is a gigantic monument one block away in Piazza Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: streety
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and I would highly recommend it. Location fantastic, staff very friendly and rooms very clean, quiet with a great shower. Would definitely stay here again. Breakfast was very good witht the convenience of a bar on the premises. Staff met evety request made to them.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel from our trip”
Reviews.Author: Maria C
Reviews.Content: Eventhough it is well located it was not what we expected it from a four Star hotel. The staff were bitter, not helpful at all, and the hotel was horrible and old. i would never recommed this hotel to antoje who is paying and expecting a 4 Star hotel. We tried to ask for a wake up call and nobody answer the phone, our Room was really near the street so turre was a lot of noise round.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: CanadianDon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Cosmopolita Hotel for the Rome portion of our trip to Italy. We chose this hotel based on it's location and were extremely happy we did. The hotel is perfectly located for visiting most of the major tourist attractions in Rome. It is within easy walking distance to the Forum, the Colosseum, the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and the Spanish Steps. As well it is a short bus or taxi ride ( less then 10 euros ) to other major attractions like the Vatican and the Appian Way. As with most locations in Rome, there are countless restaurants, coffee bars and gelaterias within walking distance as well. The front counter staff at the hotel were outstanding and very helpful. They all spoke English so translation was not an issue. They provided accurate advice concerning restaurants and taxi costs. The room we had was small as to be expected in Rome. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. Each room has their own bathroom and ours was clean and equipped with a stand up shower. The hotel has internet available in the lobby on a hotel computer or via wifi. The charge is 3 euro per hour. The hotel has a roof top terrace that is a nice place to sit back and relax. I would recommend the Cosmopolita Hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for walking round Rome”
Reviews.Author: tdsjjd
Reviews.Content: We found this to be a clean,smart,friendly hotel.Before we got there I had arranged a car to pick us up from the airport with the front desk. We were warmly welcomed and the front desk staff were courteous and helpful. The room was clean and cool with air conditioning. (good as the temps were 30 C.) There was a fridge which was a minibar but big enough to chill your own drinks before venturing out into the heat. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a good range of foods. All the main sites were under 30 minutes walk. Colloseum 15. Trevi 12. Pantheon 20. Vatican 35.Shuttle bus back to the airport was 14 Euros each. All staff ,front desk,waiters,porters,cleaners were friendly. I have seen some bad reviews but I didnt experiance any problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: ozziwanderer
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to on public transport and easy to get anywhere else. Awesome central location. Reasonable value, polite and helpful staff. Downside of the area was you are in the middle of the tourist district which is great but its also hard to get away from and find good value food and shopping. In saying that it was a five minute walk to the forum and colluseum, 2 minutes to the pantheon, 5 to trevi wow !

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great location, Air Conditioning was a problem”
Reviews.Author: DenLor60
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, Great location, Air Conditioning was a problem and room was small but adequate. Bathroom small but was ok. Needed a better cooling system. Don't use the phones , very expensive to make calls.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dublingal29
Reviews.Content: The hotel could not have been in a better location, central to trevi fountain, colesseum and all piazza's. The hotel itself was fine, we were on the top floor the 5th floor where there was only 2 rooms and the lift only went so far. Maybe because we booked pretty late we got the last room. The staff were friendly and helped in anyway they could, the breakfast was plentiful. The bar unfortunatly closes before 9 and the roof top area was closed and this was only september. We only spent one night but on a whole I would go back for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - just right for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Italy072011
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our trip to Rome and stayed at this hotel for three nights. It was very enjoyable and so close to everything. The vatican is about a 20 minute walk away, but it takes you by some nice shopping and restaurants, so it didn't seem like it was too far. The staff here is very accomodating and helped us decide on restaurants and other places of interest. Breakfast was okay. I found it difficult to find any place that has a traditional "american" breakfast. WIFI fee charged, although not expensive. We enjoyed the Trevi Fountain (block away) and would highly recommed "Al Presidente" restaurant near the fountain for dinner! Also, suggest going to Scholar Pub (Irish) a few blocks away - realize this isn't an Italian restaurant, but it was one of our best meals. Great ceasar salads and a great pub menu! Definately would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: lorrcamp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights for my husbands 50th birthday treat. As you can imagine I wanted everything to be perfect for the surprise and we were so not disappointed... The room, the staff, the location, the breakfast were all and more... After throwing our coins in the Trevi we will be returning with our 3 teenage sons... Veni... Vidi... Vici... What A Wonderful City...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and in a great location. I would walk the trevi fountain every day. It was quiet and the staff was very friendly. The wifi wasn't very strong, but that's everywhere in Italy, so it had nothing to do with the hotel. I would stay there again when I go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Our Second time and loved it just as much.”
Reviews.Author: Joy02748096
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my husband and I stayed at the Cosmopolita Hotel in Rome and would definitely suggest it to friends and family. The location is fantastic. Being right in the center of Rome, all of the ancient ruins are just steps away. The hotel’s rooms are very clean definitely large enough for two adults, always made up early in the day and the rooms, as well as, the hallways are quiet. Our room on the fourth floor faced the main road and I was concerned about police or ambulance sirens keeping us up at night. My husband who is a light sleeper never heard a sound and we both slept well. My only complaint was the bed and pillows were a bit hard for me. I am used to soft bedding which is not found in most European hotels. We had some difficulty with our in-room Internet but the front desk staff was extremely helpful and informative. It is not WIFI. If you are staying in Rome and plan to spend a lot of time on the Internet you may want to consider a different hotel. At 6 Euros an hour it can be quite expensive, but we were there to see Rome and only used our computer for contacting family members and watching movies on DVDs. If you enjoy some TV time in the room it is a great idea to bring a laptop to Europe with your own movies/shows downloaded. Watching CNN or British news can become boring very quickly. I must admit the breakfast served is not the best but it is adequate. Not being much of a breakfast person a pastry with English Breakfast Tea fit my needs. My husband had the scrambled eggs with some type of sliced cold cut and their coffee, which was not gourmet but eatable. It does take sometime to use the coffee machine. With only one dispenser for coffee and hot water you may have to wait awhile for your turn. Breakfast is included in the price, as in most Rome hotels. In comparison with the other hotel prices, I believe Cosmopolita is within reason for the quality and service. First - each room has a small refrigerator. Across the street is a shop that sells bottled water, sodas and pastry at a reasonable price. We would use the refrigerator to store our goodies, which saved a lot of money, since the room items were quite expensive. Second – the room is comfortably air-conditioned although being there in May it is hard to judge how it would be in summer. Third - the front staff was always helpful. There were some friendlier than others, but no one ever made us feel uncomfortable. The map they gave us came in very handy and if we weren’t sure which way to go – a staff member was always there to show us the way. The staff in the breakfast room was also courteous and conveniently stayed out of the way – not hovering and making you feel rushed. Fourth - you can walk to the Coliseum, Forum, Pantheon and Trevi fountain all in less than 15 minutes. A cab to the Vatican cost 10 Euros and to the airport it was 50 Euros. You can also walk to the Vatican within a half hour, if you are not in a rush to meet a tour. There are numerous restaurants in the area, a cabstand around the corner and ruins just outside the hotel. A nice hotel in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Horrible everything else”
Reviews.Author: DGoldberg
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel as part of a family vacation, the location of this hotel is five star as it is walking distance to every tourist spot in center rome. With this said My experience of the hotel, the staff and every other aspect of the hotel was that they seem to believe due to the location of the hotel they can forgo all other norms of a hotel. the front staff was highly rude, disrespectful and not helpful at all. Our room was not ready in time, the wrong room was given to us, and half of a 4 day get away to Rome was wasted dealing with hotel management. My advice would be get a hotel a little farther and not deal with the headache of dealing with the service at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Average, won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Niniaa
Reviews.Content: Although the location couldn't be better, the rooms are very small and the hotel is very average (although the pictures we looked at before we booked were very nice). Internet didn't work in the room, and somehow the hotel technician wasn't able to fix it. I won't come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “I will be staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: MrsWillis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to EVERYTHING and a bus ride away from the Vatican! The staff told me how to get around the city and it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located/more advantages than disadvantages.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleME
Reviews.Content: The advantages: We could see ancient ruins from the window. You can walk to most attractions in under 15 minutes. There is a busy street on one side with cabs, stores and ATM's. This hotel is in an older building that has been updated and transformed from offices. The rooms are nicely decorated and comfortable. The windows have heavy curtains for naps or sleeping late. The amenities are Neutrogena. Some disadvantages: The rooms had to conform to the curves, angles and uneven floors of the building. Of the 4 bathrooms we used, only one was exceptional. The showers are narrow and the shower baths tend to be a bit difficult to get into. One tub had an uneven floor with a built in seat contour that made it really tough to stand up in to use the shower. The hotel has a tiny elevator accessed by a key card sliding glass door. We do not travel light, so getting luggage up all the stairs, through the maze and into the elevator took some planning and muscle. The air conditioning was just barely acceptable. We travel with a thermometer and never got the temp below 75deg. or the humidity under 70% The internet is available for 12 euros for 12 hours. Don' t pay for the additional lobby internet unless you need to print something. There is a restaurant on site. Don't pay to sit at a table if you don't mind being at the bar. Table service is double the price. The morning breakfast is adequate but nothing special. The staff was efficient and business like with only minor language misunderstandings. Rome currently has a quirky tax scheme that requires you to settle your bill and then give the desk a few additional euros "in cash" in addition to the room charges so save some euros for check out. We would stay here again if it were not in the heat of summer.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: gjleo049
Reviews.Content: I agree with others here that the location is marvelous. The rooms and bathrooms were a bit tight, and the floors were very dusty, but we lived with that in trade for it proximity to the various sights. The staff was perfectly friendly, we thought. Our only major complaint was the breakfasts that were included. The eggs were watery, none if it was of good quality and they had a cappuccino machine that gave out basically instant coffee. We walked down the street eachmorning and bought breakfast instead. We were a little disappointed that we got inside rooms - rooms with views of only other inside rooms, but later were sort of glad because they were quieter than the stree view rooms would have been. On top they have a roof top garden that guests can use....it would be great if it were a tended bar, but we brought up our own hootch and enjoyed the views each evening. We would stay there again. Hopefully they will learn to dust between now and then!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kenguru_11
Reviews.Content: Short walking distance to all the attractions! God continental breakfast! Recomended!

Reviews.Title: “Ok accommadation, sensational location, disagreeable reception staff, very bad taste on leaving.”
Reviews.Author: italofiling
Reviews.Content: It's hard to imagine a better LOCATED place to stay. Rooms are fine if nothing special. We enjoyed our time mainly because we could easily walk to everything and we spent most of our time doing that, returning to sleep. This trip is our honeymoon and when I left a bottle of quite good wine in the room when we left, intended to share with my wife when the occasion presents, I fully expected to get it back without demur. I realised the mistake within a couple of hours, phoned, was told the cleaning staff might have put it in lost property but would not be back till morning. Next morning I attended in person. The unhelpful men on reception dissembled, evaded, told me about a 'hotel rule' that all food and drink must be thrown out (an unopened, sealed bottle of good wine in Italy?? ie, treated me like a fool). When I said I had been told to ask about lost property on the phone, he made a farcical show of calling someone to speak on the phone in Italian. Amazingly that person apparently confirmed 'it must have been thrown out'. I bought this wine in southern France in a store where you can get very good wine indeed for 10 Euros. It paid over 35 Euros for something special to share with my wife. I am certain they drank or purloined it and lied to me immediately after we spent a little over 500 Euros in their hotel. I am instinctively sure it was NOT the cleaning staff responsible, just by the dodgy, evasive concierge behaviour. The man did not once meet my eyes throughout this farcical exchange. Totally at odds with all of our other experiences of Italy. These two 'gentlemen' do great disservice to their hotel and their country's tourism industry. Stay there if you like but, as Byron said; 'Read your bible sir, And mind your purse.' I never will again. I hope the wine was corked.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful!”
Reviews.Author: yellowkipling
Reviews.Content: We were here in Easter and to say this place is centrally located is an understatement! You can almost see the wedding cake from the window - its simply amazing! So close the everything in the city - 5 minutes walk from the trevi fountains. was beautiful to walk around at night! Everything about this hotel was superb! The breakfast was lovely and the sleep quality was brilliant. Rooms were pretty and spacious!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: sojourner0516
Reviews.Content: This is in a fantastic location in the city and we felt like we had a reasonable price for the room. Alessandro one of the men at the front desk was always extremely helpful and friendly. We traveled during Easter and Pope's Beatification and Alessandro was very helpful in suggesting times for us to depart and estimate travel time with the crowds. The hotel has a shuttle bus that can bring guests (or pick them up) from the airport for 14 euros (about the cost of a train ticket from FCO to Termini). Alternatively they have a car service for 50 euros (less than a taxi from hotel to FCO) that was very reliable. Nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Position, able to walk easily with 9 year old to all areas of interest.”
Reviews.Author: karenagough
Reviews.Content: We would stay at the Cosmopolita Hotel again but really only because it's in such a good position. The twin room was clean & comfortable but very basic and quite small. The shower was good but there was no bath. The room was cleaned daily and fresh bedlinen put on the beds and clean towels supplied. It was quite cold as the air conditioning didnt seem to adjust so we just turned it off for the second night's stay.The hotel reception staff were unfriendly and the hotel bar extremely expensive. We were able to leave our bags upon check out though which was very usefull as we had an evening flight. The breakfast was good though, buffet style, again a bit basic but sufficiant and the dining room lovely and bright and never busy. All in all we enjoyed our stay as we were hardly at the hotel. I'm not sure I would class it as a 4 star hotel...more of a 3 1/2 star.

Reviews.Title: “5 or 10 minute walk to most sights”
Reviews.Author: DavePatti
Reviews.Content: Small but very clean room. Excellent location. Good security and pleasant staff. Good breakfast with hot food items.

Reviews.Title: “Good, very central positioned hotel in downtown Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tjalling_1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before on business reasons and chose the hotel for the location and quality. Right next to Piazza Venezia means that you're well positioned in walking distance to all the interesting sites. Only negative thing I could mention is that the coffee in the breakfast room is not top notch but if you take one (standing at the bar and dead cheap) in the cafe on the ground floor, that's not a real issue. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Centrally sited.”
Reviews.Author: mcardleyeovil
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and easy walking distance to the famous sites. Also very close to taxi rank and buses. Plenty of inexpensive restaurants and a Scottish Pub selling good food across the road.. The hotel was rather noisy and could do with carpeting or carpet runners on the tiled corridors. The room was a reasonable size with a good bathroom but certainly could do with a bit of refurbishment. There was one power point in the room by the small table but no mirror over it for make up, hairstyling etc. A hospitality tray would have been welcomed. Hotel food and drinks were rather expensive, but there is a mini bar in the room for your own 'supplies'. The breakfast both hot food and continental was excellent with a full range of hot beverages. The roof garden is a good picnicing spot.The staff were welcoming, friendly and very efficient. Most spoke very good English. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Central to sights, rooftop garden, tidy...”
Reviews.Author: passive649
Reviews.Content: It's location is a convenient mid-way point between Colosseum, Roman Forum, Panthenon and other landmarks. The area is a bit soul-less and barren for dining options though. Room was a standard size for a European hotel and the queen bed, while slightly on the hard side, but comfortable enough. Bathroom however was tiny. Found the shower to be very small and cramped. Might be major problem if we were bigger people. Breakfast, which was included in Expedia packakge - seemed well stocked, although we ate early most days. Good range of pastries, cold meats etc. Aircon - limited fan and temperature settings available. I'd imagine in a heatwave you'd be struggling. Staff: staff in restaurant for breakfast where fairly friendly and efficient, but front desk staff were a bit surly and didn't really invite you to approach them. Tips: there's a fairly nice rooftop garden, good for winding down after a long day of sightseeing. Also, they offer a shuttle service from the airport, which wasn't apparent when we booked through Expedia, and would have saved us a 60 euro cab drive with a prospective formula one driver.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but ! disappointment”
Reviews.Author: plasticpaddyharrow
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, perfectly situated for getting around, its near the Coliseum and the Trevi foundtain and great for shopping. The room was lovely, comfortable, clean and had a good bathroom. The restaurant did a good lunch/dinner menu and the staff were very good my only disappointment was the breakfast - I don't expect to get coffee in Rome/Italy from a coffee machine it was pretty dismal and tinned fruit for breakfast when they have fresh fruit on the menu was a let down. Not everyone wants cake for breakfast. But this is my only grip and it could be a British thing. The staff were so helpful and friendly and the bar/coffee shop is definitely worth a visit the barman introduced us to a very nice Italian wine we will be checking out here also.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: CharleyWood
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in December 2010 and I really liked it there. You could walk to most of the main tourist attractions in Rome (with the help of the free map provided by reception) and it was really clean there. I liked the fact that it wasn't one of those unfriendly, mass produced hotels. I went there by myself (I'm female and felt safe the entire time) so I didn't find the room small. The shower is a little on the small side but i couldn't help but giggle everytime I turned around in the shower and my tummy turned it off! lol. All in all, this is a fantasic place and I would recommend that anyone go there.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms too small and not value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dreamstealer
Reviews.Content: Booked through Expedia and "upgraded" to a "superior" room. Room was very small, too small in fact to sit at the desk as there was insufficient room between the desk and the bed for a chair! Breakfast was OK, not good, but OK. Bathroom small but functional Good central location but I paid over £150 per night whereas it was only woth £70-80

Reviews.Title: “Great location and not value for money like all Rome hotels and rooms a bit small”
Reviews.Author: LondonFet
Reviews.Content: Ok it's not worth the money and not four star but this is the same for every hotel I've ever stayed at in Rome..always bit dear but it's part of the deal in staying in such a popular and old city if you want to stay in city centre. I thought the front desk staff were efficient and friendly, only one member of staff bad, the guy welcoming guests at breakfast, so awful I thought I was in Paris! Breakfast was fine, usual cereal, eggs, juice. Ok, expresso coffee was awful but what do you expect from a coffee/tea machine? Get an americano for breakfast and get a great coffee at a local place later. Room was very small and only a shower. One big bug bear apart from breakfast waiter...eleven euros to watch a film, four euros to listen to a CD? Come on, you charge enough already! Location is superb though.

Reviews.Title: “Rude front desk guy”
Reviews.Author: Worldtour27
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel expecting a good start to our vacation. I had booked the hotel/air package through expedia and expedia booked the hotel reservation for only 1 adult. The hotel staff would not let my wife enter the room without me paying an extra 30 euros per day for 6 days. I asked politely whether they could waive this charge because we did not realize that the reservation had to be for two adults and the room was big enough. The front desk guy Danilo started yelling at us like an italian mafia guy. He flat out said that we should go somewhere else if we did not want to pay the extra fee per person. I understand if you disagree with someone but use some diplomacy and tact. I ended up paying the extra 30 eurors per day but it was not worth it because the room was dark and the bathroom extremely tiny. Avoid this hotel and the rude front desk staff. The only thing that lured me to this place was the breakfast included but the manager of this place needs to teach his front desk people about customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location.”
Reviews.Author: Simon0965
Reviews.Content: The hotel must be in one of the best areas of Rome. It literally is 5 minutes from the Trevi fountain. The furthest main tourist destination is the Vatican,but there are so many buses going to the Vatican from Piazza Venezia.Bedroom,breakfast,bathrooms,main reception areas all excellent. Take advantage of the taxi service back to Fiumicino only 14 euros at time of writing.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: loriellenm
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because virtually every sight rated it as four stars. If I could give it 2.5 stars I would. First, the positive things about this hotel. The location is superb, right near the Forum so it's within walking distance of pretty much everything. It's very neat & clean and the breakfasts are okay...mostly since they are included. If I'd had to pay separately, I wouldn't give them a good review either. There was only one person who worked the front desk that was civil. During our stay we interacted with four different employees and with the exception of the youngest man were all rude & surly. No matter what you asked, it was a curt answer and they were of no help. The one young man (I wish I had gotten his name) was friendly & helpful and suited for his job. The rest of the men should not be working a front desk! We expected the room to be small, and knew we were getting twin beds. I, however, didn't expect the room or the beds to be that small. Truly, the smallest twin bed I've ever slept on...hard as a rock too. Our room was too warm, we turned the heat off completely & still had to leave the window open at night. If the room was small, the bathroom was tiny. Probably 4x5 with a sink, toilet, bidet & corner shower unit in it. The shower was the low point of this bathroom. As I said, corner unit, with the door opening at the corner. The doors slid open down each side...about 10 inches! Seriously, the opening to get through the doors could not have been more than 10 inches! Plus the shower was raised about 8 inches above the regular floor. So not only did you not have any space to get in the shower, but you had to reach & grab the top rail to pull yourself up into it. My husband is 6 ft tall & weighs 225. If you're bigger than that, don't pick this hotel as you will not be able to shower. I would never pay this price to stay in this hotel again. I've been to Rome before so I was aware of what to expect, but this was a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: 356PorscheGirl
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this hotel. We stayed six nights in a nice, clean triple room. Comfortable beds, quiet, double pane windows that open. Modern bathroom, tv, radio, phone, lift, A/C. Great bar and very good restaurant. The included breakfast was unbelievable with scrambled eggs, bacon, yogurt, cereals, nice assortment of breads, meats, cheeses and much more. To top it off, there is a "make your own" coffee machine that makes cappucino, espresso, latte, chocolate, and good old Cafe American!! Tables with great views of the main street below. We were a 5 minute wall from Trevi Fountain, Trajans market & column.....ten minute walk from the Colisseum, the Forum & the Spanish Steps. We actually walked from the Vatican to the hotel in 25 minutes. We were about 15-20 minutes from the Borghese Gardens. You could not ask for a more centrally located hotel for most of the top tourist attractions Rome has to offer. Many nice/fun restaurants within 5 minutes including Hostaria Corte Del Grillo which is an upper end fish establishment.....a little pricey but well worth it. Allessandro, the front desk clerk recommended this restaurant and others to us. We found his advice to be right on! Allesandro was always cheerful and helpful and made our stay very enjoyable. There is a rooftop restaurant where you can enjoy the views of Rome or a cocktail. Parking is at a premium in Rome (impossible!). However, the hotel will unload your vehicle and park it off-site and return it to you on the morning of your departure. At first we thought it was outrageously priced (30 Euro per day) but found it to be worth every dollar we paid!! If you are driving in Rome (or Italy in general), be sure to rent a navigation GPS system. It is worth it's weight in gold! This is a fairly expensive hotel but you can't beat it for the location, convenience and helpful front desk. Without hesitation, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location! Good service.”
Reviews.Author: fab00966
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, easy walk to the Coliseum, Spanish steps, etc. Hotel staff is friendly, full breakfast is included. Room was pretty big for a 3 persons room in Italy. Highly recommended for the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: miam_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an excellent location. We were able to walk to almost everything that we wanted to see. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, with a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ame054
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in this hotel. Very quiet, nice size room and bathroom, with great terrace on the roof. The breakfast, included, was very satisfactory and good choice. The bar/coffee/restaurant downstairs, GLASS, was good and the staff friendly. Always full of locals. This hotel is smack in the middle of everything, Piazza Venezia. Could walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Adaquate”
Reviews.Author: gingerelis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay for four nights during our honeymoon. The hotel was.... adaquate. The location was wondeful... we only had to take public transportation to the Vatican, but we walked back., and our jr. suite was large, the breakfast was good (I loved their eggs) BUT... the bathrooms were small, the hallways were very loud, the staff was pretty unhelpful, AND when we asked about our coplimentary wine (that was promised when we made the early reservation, we were given the runaround twice. Overall for the money, you could probably find something better.

Reviews.Title: “Rude unhelpful desk staff”
Reviews.Author: GreenBay_WIKathy
Reviews.Content: After a long night flight to Rome, we arrived at the Cosmopolita Hotel which we had already paid for 9 nights over a month previously through expedia and I had called 2 days before and reconfirmed our reservation and was told it was all in place. We were greeted by a non-smiling curt older man named Hani who first could not at first find our reservation and then when he found it, he told us with no explanation or apology that we would have to go to a different hotel for the first 2 days of our stay as they did not have a room for us! When I realized he really was not joking, I calmly but firmly stated this was unacceptable and we were not leaving and amazingly they were able to come up with our room then. From that time on he and most of the rest of the deskstaff were unhelpful and unfriendly during our 9 day stay so we gave up asking them for any help. The hotel has good location but otherwise the continental breakfast is mediocre with runny scrambled eggs, undercooked bacon and ? cut up hot dogs. Rooms are small and showers are tiny and if you cannot do steps, there are 5 steps to any room even with use of lift and whole flight of steps to breakfast area. I would encourage you to look elsewhere in the area and not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: minnieschubert
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Cosmopolita using Lastminute to book. As it was 4 star and in Rome and I paid £1500 for the package for 3 I hoped for good things. I was taking my elderly parents away so wanted to really treat them to something special. Although it was a nice hotel and it was comfortable, it didn't have any wow factor and in places needed updating and bit of t.l.c. The rooms we were allocated 301 and 302 were a single and twin. Both were cramped and badly laid out. Simple things about the hotel had been done without thought. Flooring in the halls is hard so every person leaving early in the morning or coming in late at night WILL wake you up with their wheely cases and heels. There were no door hooks anywhere meaning the bathroom and bedrooms quickly became cluttered and messy once wet towels were in the equation. The shower cubicles were tiny. I'm a size 10-12 and found it cramped. My mother who is larger didn't even try to get in. So the good : Location. You are in the heart of everything - a short walk ( 5-10 minutes) to lots of sights. But this is a double edged sword. I hadn't expected October to be SO busy. It was overwhelming, so if you want something a little out of the way with a quieter feeling and gentler charm, this hotel is not for you. Road noise was not a problem, just that you stepped straight out into full- on bustle. It's like Piccadilly circus. Also good - Breakfast - which is GREAT. You couldn't get a better selection of pastries, cake, fruit, yoghurt, sausages, bacon,GOOD coffee, and the first decent scrambled eggs I have EVER had in a hotel - ie not cooked to death so they resemble polystyrene. These were creamy and great! Waiting staff were friendly and quick. The Glass bar attached to the hotel is nice and pleasant to have a drink in, before venturing out for the night and the front desk were helpful. We didn't experince the roof terrace as it was booked out for a private conference which was a shame. But they don't serve drinks up there which is missing a trick I think...Danilo on reception kindly booked us onto a Ciao Roma bus tour on day one. These were a good way of getting around with older people, but the tours were so oversubscribed we only got a seat once in 48 hours of using the tickets! One tip for eating is book ahead for any recommended in lonely planet etc. And be aware that on Mondays lots of places close. Our best meal was at a restaurant called Giggetto in the jewish qtr. Knockout meal, great price, lovely service ( v supportive of my attempts to speak in Italian ) and true Jewish Roman flavours. Great courgette flowers and oxtail with celery, deep fried artichokes etc. Avoid eating anywhere near Trevi - had appaling meal there. Roma is a great city but like any that is popular I think you need to go out of season, get away from the main sights and wander. Overall the hotel was good, but it needed some updating. My expectations of 4 star Rome may have been too high, or maybe we just got their tired looking small rooms because we bought through "Lastminute".

Reviews.Title: “Ok Location, unprofessional staff and management”
Reviews.Author: justoneraj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife on our honeymoon trip to Europe recently. When we got in, they gave us a free upgrade to a Junior suite which was located right next to their roof garden. This was very nice of them, and we thought we had picked a great place. I'll go through our experience after: LOCATION The location is ok, though I am not sure why some folks are gushing over it. You can walk to a few places, but you are by no means living in the middle of anything resembling a shopping/restaurant/sight seeing location. Having travelled to Europe a fair number of times, the cities are old and historic enough that you will be close to something or another no matter where you live. I saw someone write below that they walked to the Trevi fountain frequently. We did this walk and it was about a 15-20 minute walk at night without having to wait for too much traffic. The Colloseum was about 10 minutes which is nice. The point is that, Yes, you can walk to a few locations, but you pretty much HAVE to. There is no restaurants/bars/shopping area right where the hotel is. ROOMS: Well, we were upgraded to the Junior Suite, but every night we came back, the bathroom smelled strongly of cigarette smoke. We told the hotel about it, and they sent someone up to spray air freshener. We left the doors and windows open, and it aired out which was fine. It might an issue with their ventilation system. Very odd. BATHROOM: The water temperature kept fluctuating, and it got worse later in the evening. You would either get blasts of very cold or very hot water. It was not a comfortable shower. SERVICE: This was perhaps the worst part of it. We signed up for their wi-fi service, at about 10 Euros for 12 hours, but it never worked on our floor. When I let the hotel staff know about it, the person and the front desk recommended using it in their lobby while they fix it by the next day. The wifi was never fixed, and when I talked to the front desk about it, they said they couldn't do anything about it, and they would NOT refund the money. I have never experienced that at any hotel. FRONT DESK RECOMMENDATIONS We asked the front desk for a restaurant recommendation, and what they described us a traditional Italian restaurant frequented by locals ended up being a modern designed, sparse restaurant, with nothing but tourists carrying other hotels' recommendation cards. Makes me wonder if there is a commision involved. They also recommended the Ciao Roma bus tour, and said, "We have a special partnership with the best tour in Rome." This was by far the worst double decker tour bus we had ever been on. The busses came so infrequently, that at one of the stops, a small mob of angry clients, that had been waiting for a full hour, jumped on the bus and would not let it leave. The bus itself, was rusty, and dirty. Is the condition of the bus service the hotel's fault? NO. However, it IS their fault that they recommend it as the best service. I suppossed their "Special Partnership" has more to do with the commission. When we mentioned this to the front desk, they asked us to call the bus tour and take it up with them. Hoenstly, we are shocked that this hotel has received glowing reviews from others. Even before all the service issues, I would have given them 3 stars based on the smells in the bathrooms. I wonder about the validity of some of the other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: arpa45
Reviews.Content: everything in walking distance, what a postion!! Very near capitol hill you cant get any better than that

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd want in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bolze
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the desk was able to fulfill my requests and provide me with the correct information I needed to make our visit to Rome a great experience. Though the room may have been small by American standards, it had all the amenities travelers need. The room was clean, quiet, well-decorated and serviced with step-in shower. The hot and cold freshly-prepared breakfast buffet made a great start to the day and the variety of nearby restaurants and trattorias made it easy to end the day without worrying about where or when to eat. The location is steps away from the Forum and walking distance to the best sights in Rome with corner access to buses and cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: andy_pink
Reviews.Content: We consider this a 3 star hotel. It is ideally situated for sightseeing in Rome. The Trevi fountain being some 10 minutes walk. The Pantheon where ideal restaurants can be found is some 15 minutes walk away. We would particularly recommend one called “Night and Day” where the staff are very friendly and helpful especially Brendusha and Kanchan. Other places such as the Piazza Navona, where a wealth of more expensive restaurants are situated is also some 15 minutes walk. The Colosseum is about 15 minutes in the other direction. The Vatican is around 25 minutes walk. The Hotel does not match up to the photographs shown on the website, it is not possible to purchase food, or drink after 8:30 at night and the roof terrace bar was closed. However, the breakfast was good, the rooms were clean , shower always hot, towels changed every day and it was relatively quiet considering it is on a main road. When choosing where to eat, look for places that advertise no service or cover charge, otherwise there will be a charge added to your bill automatically. Bread is also charged for unless they advertise that it is not. If you wish to eat at lunchtime the best bet is to find one of the many places that sell slices of pizza and a drink for an all in price. There are plenty of nice places to sit and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: niknaks23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days with my husband on our first visit to Rome. The room was on 4 th floor with great views across Rome. The bed was comfortable, the room clean, furnishings fine, although a soft easy chair in the room would have been nice. Shower room was small but fine. Breakfasts were adequate with the same choices every day, all self service. We thought the location was great. You can walk everywhere from here pretty much. There is a roof terrace where we sat in the afternoon after sightseeing reading our books in the sunshine, very pleasant. The cafe on the ground floor does great cappuccino only one euro per cup which is MUCH cheaper than anywhere else we visited in Rome. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The streets felt very safe both day and night and everyone seems very friendly. Loved our visit, will go back and will stay at the Cosmopolita again as it was good value and well placed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in perfect location- nearest restaurants very poor value”
Reviews.Author: taylorclan5
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel with friendly helpful staff especially cheeky Danilo. Easy to visit Collisseum, Trevi Fountain, etc, all within walking distance. head to trevi fountain for your evening stroll. DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES EAT IN RESTAURANTS within 50-100m-they have no competition and do not display prices of drinks- A glass of wine will be Eu10. At APOSTOLI- he will coax you into having things off the Menu like olives EU10- Avoid Avoid-much better value around Trevi fountain which is no more than 300-400m away

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location...”
Reviews.Author: PSH1ckey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellently located for a visit to many of the Central City sites. It is a quick walk to many of the prime attractions. Unfortunately, you have to travel a little further out to get to restaurants worth eating at... But, if you don't mind an evening stroll to get to them, it is perfectly fine. The hotel itself is about 5 stories and has a roof-top lounge. 1/2 of the lounge is in the open air, 1/2 is housed by a roof and clear, heavy vinyl "windows". We have stayed here 2 times. On our earlier stay, we could buy drinkgs at the roof-top lounge. On this trip, the bar was shut down and the staff wasn't willing to retract the heavy vinyl clear dividers to allow the cooling breeze of Rome entirely across the roof-top lounge. The rooms are big enough, but all of the storage you will get is a armoire with limited drawers and few hangers. Each room we have had has a small fridge, but don't expect it to get very cold. The TV in the room gets about 3 English-speaking channels. The beds are hard and the linen is rough, but my wife and I didn't have an issue with that. The pillows were made of foam - again, perfectly fine. My daughter's bed was really a fold-out chair/single bed combo. Besides its location in the room, she didn't have a problem sleeping on it. The bathroom is small but the shower had good pressure. What I don't get about Italian showers is that they often consist of a tub with a moveable half-glass wall. When taking a standing shower, you can get water all over the room. The breakfasts were part of our package and they were passable: eggs, bacon/sausages, breads, salamis, cheese, fruit, preserves, yogurts, cereals, espressos... Nothing that will make you dream of an Italian breakfast when you are back home, but enough to get your day moving. Most of the staff at the front desk speak English fluently, and the others that don't are passable at it. They were helpful when in a pinch, but I often felt that they would rather be doing something else than help me. The restaurant suggestion that I got from them landed me a cute place but with the least favorite of the 4 evening meals we had in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , good choice.”
Reviews.Author: RamboNWAlberta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with two other couples for 5 days after picking the hotel through trip advisor. As in other posts, I can say that this hotel is superbly located. If you don't mind short walks, up to a half hour, you can literally walk everywhere in this great city. We did buy a 48 hour hour pass on the Roma hop on/hop off bus and that was good to add to the site seeing. Really though, distances aren't great for the sites and we did way more walking than riding. The hotel is a good choice for the money with Rome being pricey. We all had small, clean and comfortable rooms. Never heard a noise at night which is always a plus when you've had bad experiences in chain hotels with party crowds. The only issue we had was with air conditioning. We hit Rome in the heat of August and it appeared the air units in the rooms couldn't keep up. They worked but could only cool the room, not get it cold enough for all of our tastes. It wasn't unbearable, only uncomfortable somewhat but not to the point where I would complain about it. I would expect that at most times it works fine when it's not +35 celcius.
