Front desk staff were okay, middle of the road. They are helpful, some more than others. we had no issues and service was good. They gave us a few restaurant ideas and we tried a couple. One was very good, just a block and a half away. It's called Le Lanterne.We ate there twice and were very pleased with the food quality, service and price. You can sit on the patio or inside. The pasta was very good and we would go back. Another restaurant we found on our own that was very good was just across the main street from the hotel and up a half block beside a Scottish Pub. It was called Pastarito. We ate there twice and it was excellent. The place is large, all indoor seating with great A/C. Pastas and pizzas were very good and prices were extremely reasonble for larger portions than most places we saw. The hotel never recommended it to us but we sure would recommend it as a close place to have a great dinner. Lastly, just down the street, Euphemia, only two very short blocks is a street to the left that has a large set of steps going up to the main road. On these steps are located three smaller shops/stores/pizzarias. We used them a lot for cheap beer,wine, ice cream, pizza slices,etc. Here you can get all of this for a fraction of the price you pay at the steet car vendors a block away that are in front off all attractions. You learn fast to grab a beer for 1.50 instead of 5.00.If you go, check them out day one and you'll save yourself lots of Euro. The breakfast in the hotel was provided and very adeqaute for our tastes. Saved us time and money and a good start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “I've been to rome a few times and can honestly say there no better location in the city”
Reviews.Author: sarler
Reviews.Content: Of course no place is perfect, but if you intend to do sightseeing of the historic centre then this hotel has an unbeatable location and is a comfortable stay. We were five minutes walk from the forum and the coleseum, Ten minutes from piazza novona and about 8 minutes from the pantheon. The spanish steps were about 15 minutes away - oh and i walk everywhere slowly. No matter where we were we felt it was easy to walk back to our room so we didn't need to worry about working out the buses or take taxis. We had a standard double room which i actually expected to be a little more basic than it was. Good sized beds (for europeans, Americans would still find them small compared to what you get in the US). Tv, mini bar, enough hanging space and a good clean bathroom. Our room only came with a shower but it was a good one. I head read on trip advisor about the breakfasts and yes they are great. We did what others had recommended and had huge breakfasts and an icecream and drinks through the day and then went out for a proper dinner. It was a good way to survive the Italian prices. I did find everyone in the hotel friendly although had a couple of problems at reception, like them telling out tour guide we had gone when we were sitting in reception waiting for them. But that isn't enough for me to tell anyone not to go there - i will be back there (i know that as i threw coins in the trevi fountain).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: curiousmold
Reviews.Content: This place was in a great location - we walked everywhere from the hotel. I thought the staff was great. Our room was very small, but when you're in a place like Rome a small hotel room is the last place you're going to be spending your time - so I didn't care. It was clean and comfortable, and that's all that mattered. The late night front desk attendant was a little grumpy, but that only added to the charm. I found it amusing! I felt very safe and comfortable in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cara89
Reviews.Content: While the hotel enjoys a good location in Rome and is accessible to all the major attractions, I wouldn´t recommend it. The staff are rude and unaccommodating, and the rooms are incredibly small. In particular the bathroom is tiny- you need to open the door to turn around in there! I was travelling with my family at the time and requested a triple room when booking. We were given a small double room with a fold out roller bed! When we complained the manager was extremely rude and offered us no other option but to pay an extra 500 euros for another triple room- which is what we had booked. There are definitely better places to stay in Rome that provide better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great location - A good choice”
Reviews.Author: donandkat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cosmopolita Hotel based on the TripAdvisor rating and comments and so we must add our voice to the choir. This hotel works perfectly for tourists who want a nice place to stay that feels secure and well managed but it does not break the bank. The staff were professional. The room was clean. The breakfast buffet was complete and the bar off the lobby even had a nightly happy hour that was great value. We would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JUXPrague
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights there. The hotel is very nice, clean, in an excellent location (15 minutes walking distance to both Fontana di Trevi and Colosseum). The rooms are smaller, but very well equipped. The hotel is different to the international hotel chains, looks more like family-run. The staff was ok, not rude, but wouldn't say friendly neither. The breakfast was better than average. The main pros are location and affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel, some staff rude”
Reviews.Author: SNOOPY123Uk
Reviews.Content: Hotels in a great location for all the major sights. Lots of restaurants, shops bars nearby. The rooms were clean and good selection at breakfast. However we booked two triple rooms and arrived to find they only had one available! Some staff were great very friendly others quite rude and unhelpful. Because we were not offered compensation for the room mix up we would not stay here again or recommend this hotel. My parents paid for a triple room for four nights and got a small double instead! Even though we clearly stated the extra bed was necessary for my mother due to her ill health when booking the triple room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LJM1985
Reviews.Content: The perfect location for seeing all the main sights; you can walk everywhere. Staff were very friendly and helpful (especially Max). We had a triple room for just two of us, so was nice and spacious and didn't cost too much more (we booked with expedia). We were on the fourth floor and could hear the traffic from the Piazza Venezia but, as Londoners, didn't affect our sleep, but I can see how others used to peace and quiet might be disturbed. I ate far too much at breakfast, with hot and cold things, cereals, fruit... the criossants were delicious. The staff in the breakfast room were also very friendly and welcoming. The location is the best thing about the hotel, less than five minutes' walk to the Trevi fountain, less than ten minutes' walk to the Colosseum, and a bus stop just across the road to go to the Vatican (max. ten minutes). I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location-steps from everything!”
Reviews.Author: drewmania
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our "babymoon" last summer-if you are anything like I am, you probably have read every single review on here, so I won't repeat what everyone else has said. Here's the root of it. You are in Rome. If you have come to Rome to relax in your hotel room, this isn't your hotel. If you need a nice, clean hotel with a great location and a great breakfast for a decent rate, this is your hotel! If you want to look out of your window onto something romantic/fun/touristy, this isn't your hotel. But if you want to be 3 minutes from Trevi Fountain, Piazza Venezia, Campodoglio and 5 minutes from the Colosseum and Domus Area, stay here! The breakfast is so good-the espresso alone is worth booking this place for. And yes, the front desk staff is rude. Europe isn't about good service, and they don't care if you are in a hurry. If you can come to grips with that, then you'll be fine! If you have any questions, please feel free to message me. FYI-we didn't book the entry level room-we paid the extra $10 a night and got the nicer room-I think that keeps you from the really small rooms many people complain about. We ended up on the 4th floor, and it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tbrooksjr
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolita Hotel was very comfortable and was in a great location. We were able to walk all over Rome (we even walked back from the Vatican and Borghesi Gardens - although we took a cab there, as it was very early). The hotel staff was a little gruff, but the rooms were comfortable (typical European) and the breakfast was good. We really had no complaints and would stay there again if we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: the100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March for 4 nights and it was very pleasant. Yes some of the rooms are small, but it is Rome, all the hotels are crammed into old buildings, doubt if you would get a modern hotel with large rooms anywhere in the central city. However, it was very clean, comfortable and a fantastic location to explore Rome, and besides you are only in the room to sleep as there is so much to do and see in Rome. There have been lots of people complaining about the reception staff, we found them to be very pleasant, maybe it is those complaining that have attitude in the first place!!! Besides you don't go to a hotel to hang out with the Reception staff, you see them for 10 mins check in at most. Anyway ours found us a nice restaurant for my boyfirend's birthday and helped us out quickly when the hotel bus got stranded in a protest, and we were due to go back to the airport. Breakfast was fabulous and the bar area is nice as well. We came home one night to find a bottle of chilled champagne, nibbles and a letter from the management to say Happy Birthday to my Boyfriend and thank you for choosing them for our stay in Rome. Very nice touch, we have never had that before and we have stayed in some nice hotels before for his birthday. They must have checked his passport at check in. Would certainly stay here again should we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Judyrn
Reviews.Content: It was with some trepidation that we checked into the Hotel Cosmopolita in May for a few days before our cruise of the Eastern Mediterranean, after reading the negative reviews here. Our first room was tiny but, after a long trip from the states, all we wanted was a few hours sleep and the next day we were given a large double room. The service was very good and the desk clerks were so helpful........esp Alessandro! Breakfast was very good and substantial enough to carry us through the days as we explored lovely Rome. We walked all over and even had a casual stroll to St Peter's Square. I heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You CAN do much better than this place!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce1225
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff is not friendly at all and seems to look upon questions as an imposition. The location is terrific which is about all this hotel has going for it....but then again, there are several hotels in the area. As mentioned in other reviews, some of the rooms are so small, it's a joke. And I don't mean just small, I mean you can't get your luggage through the front door! We asked that we be moved and were told the hotel was "full". Then we threatened to leave and out of nowhere, another larger room became available. Gee, what luck! Anyway, I wouldn't stay here if I were you. My wife and I have been all over Europe and we are not just some disgruntled or spoiled travelers. All we ask for is a decent room with a decent staff and this hotel did not fit the bill. You can and should do much better in Rome...especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: geronimo248
Reviews.Content: Very poor front desk behavior..this was consistant w every employee & at any hour. All men & all rude. It actually became somewhat amusing because of the consitancy & bluntness of it. The room was small, it was a 2 room suite but somewhat dreay w v little furnishings. The window opened up to the courtyard where the sanitation trucks would come right & eraly to empty the dumpster. Overall the room was not that bad but certainly not what you would expect gr the price. The Location was pretty good but now that I know my way around rome again, I would not choose this location again. By italy standards, the breakfast buffet was one of the best Ive had in Italy. Workers in the breakfast room were extremely friendly & accomodating. The same room is used as their dinner restaurant (can't rem the name) which turned out to be one of the best dinners we had on our trip. Great atmosphere too because this room is elevated above the street level w all glass windows.. it was very reasonable as well. Too bad the hotel quality, esp the front desk, does not equal the restaurant. Later in the trip we stayed at a place near the vatican which was fabulous. Note-i would not stay near the spanish steps as many do..this is a very touristy area. Nice to see, its close to trevi fountain as well, but after that youre ready to move on. Regardless of what area you stay in your going to have to do some traveling to get to a few sites. No location is ideal unless you love ALOT of walking. For us, metered taxi stands were everwhere being the fastest & most practical way to get around.,plus we still did our share of walking. Staying near the vatican makes sense as that immediate area has the most sites to see. ps:campo di fiori is v nice..we had dinner there, also Piazza di Spagna is nice for luch.. both are v interesting w many restaurants to choose from.. taxi stands at both. Any questions feel free to email me The LoRusso's

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a nicer hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: jptravelergirl
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Rome was incredible and we felt as if Hotel Cosmopolita was our home while we were there. The hotel staff met our every need. The room was spotless, the bathroom was spacious. The shower was small but no problems in getting clean! The bathrooms are in the room which is a plus in Europe. The breakfast was yummy, the internet affordable and easy to use. Every room has a blow dryer. They helped us celebrate our anniversary with a complimentary bottle of wine a candle and some corn nuts. :) The location was one of the best parts of this hotel. It is so convenient to every main attraction. This was our 3rd trip to Rome. Second time staying at this hotel. This trip was very low key and we did things like find markets where only the Romans go and we went to the movie theater. If the movie as the letters v.o. (version original) next to it then the language is in its original version..example: .Alice in wonderland v.o. is in English. Rick Steve's book did not let us down one time. Every restaurant recommended by him was excellent. If you go to Rome and do exactly what that man tells you to do, you will not be disappointed. My only complaint about the hotel is because the floors are all hardwood, noise carries. We ended up having to turn the tv on a white noise station and putting a blanket over the front of it to keep the light out and the sound going. After we did that, we slept great. We took our own pillows in a carry-on and were very glad that we did! Other than that, it is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with well equipped clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Foodiechick75
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, right by bus stops which take you all over Rome. It is also just a few minutes walk from the Forum and Colloseum. The room was not as small as we had feared from other reviews, but then my partner had upgraded us to a king size which may be the reason for the good sized room. The bathroom was also spacious enough for two, with a nice deep bath and shower. The thing to watch with the showers is that they go from hot (very) to cold in a second presumably depending upon hot/cold water usage elsewhere in the other rooms. It makes for a less enjoyable shower than is ideal! Also the walls are paper thin, we could hear every word of the couple's conversation in the room next to us. The bed was large and comfy and we had a nice view from our room. Breakfast was good, we discovered the best idea was to have the breakfast pastries - delicious. That's what all the locals were having and after sampling the scrambled eggs (which just tased very sour and not nice) and the limp anaemic bacon - we could see why! Also the fresh bread with cheese and ham was very tasty. The staff were helpful, letting us check in 3 hours before the due time and holding our bags until we left on the day of departure and were ready to collect them in the evening. The only bad thing about our stay was the awful group of young people staying the rooms next to ours. They were shouting and yelling all evening whilst we got ready to go out for dinner (7-8pm ish) and then spent between 3am and 5am then next morning banging loudly on the doors and shouting very loudly, which kept us awake and very tired for our sight seeing the next day. We hadn't put the deadlock on our door and they were banging so hard on the door next to our that our door was jarred open at 3.30am. They were just as loud at breakfast the next day, although it has to be said looking suitable hung over and rough - not that I wished them any suffering after what'd they'd done to us!! The glass bar, which is also open to the public in the hotel is not cheap but a nice place to go for a pre-dinner drink.

Reviews.Title: “WORTH A STAY AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: 117PeteAnn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally located for the tourist attractions eg. The Colleseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and a bus stop just outside the front which took you to the other side of Rome to the Vatican area. Bus Tickets cost one Euro and last for 75 minutes, the only downside is that you have to purchase your bus ticket from a tabacconist shop if you are not using the Roma Pass. The central location adjacent to the Via De Corsa which is the shopping area makes the hotel a perfect choice for sight seeing and shopping. We walked everywhere apart from taking the bus to the Vatican City area. We checked in without any problems and found the staff extremely helpful in advising us where the various sights we wished to visit were located and how to get there. The whole of the hotel was spotlessly clean and well maintained, Our bedroom was a double room, spacious and with a well sized bathroom. The shower pressure was excellent in comparision to many other hotels which we have stayed at. The linen and towels were changed every day during our four day. The breakfast was mainly continental but bacon, scrambled eggs, boiled eggs and sausage were also served and these were hot. The continental selection was comprehensive and plentiful and you could help your self to as much as you liked. There were no tea making facilities in the rooms but it did have a fridge/minibar. Overall an excellent hotel with good location well worth patronising. Would recommend The Scholars Arms Bar (Irish Bar),Via Del Plebiscito off the Piazza Venezia and about 5 minitues walk from the hotel. Excellent food, plentiful, varied menu, good prices. The staff were very attentive,great atmoshere, live music and a very popular pub with ages and nationalities and definitely worth a visit

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great location but not totally Disabled friendly!”
Reviews.Author: RomeJuliet
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for 3 nights, the staff were brilliant and breakfast excellent! I am disabled with limited walking and using a walking stick, there were 2 steps up to the lift and the lift didn't go as far as the roof garden. The way to the breakfast room was to come down in the lift to ground floor, and then climb quite a lot of stairs, we were given the choice of sitting in a room downstairs on our own! but with a great deal of effort my husband helped me to climb the stairs! Not suitable for someone in a wheelchair, but great location and very helpful and friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Below Average Rooms, otherwise just OK”
Reviews.Author: soormay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in Feb for a vacation to rome. It was probably the most expensive hotel we stayed ( other cities in this trip were venice and florence). The location is pretty decent and the entrance does give you a decent impression at first look. There is a glass bar on the left when you enter the hotel and the reception seems to have been upgraded with some contemporary furniture. Check in was OK, the staff was neither too happy or rude, but we didnt get a very warm reception from them. The entrance to the rooms are very odd. On your way to the rooms there is a tiny computer (only one) for internet use ( u have to pay for that). It is followed by a small alley with steps. The alley had the most horrible smell coming from it, seems like it is connected to the dumpster below and which was partitoned by a plastic sheet!. The elevator is small and can fit max 4-5ppl ( without luggage). Our room was on the 5th (top) and we had to take about 7 steps to reach the hallway with the rooms. There seemed to be another flight of steps for 2 more rooms on the same floor. The room was very small, barely fitting a double bed and some walking space. There was a locker in the room, which we found out later that we had to go get the key from the reception ( they made us sign for it and needless to say, the reception did not tell us about it when we were checking in, so it required another trip down the stenchy alley). The bathroom was OK, tiny though, shower was barely big for one person. No iron was provided and the manager said it was not available, so laundry service was the only option. The breakfast was decent, we did get bored of it after 3 days, still had warm food and an expresso machine. I would say that breakfast was the best part of the stay as the b'fast room was pretty nice and with new furniture. I think its a regular restaurant during the day. Overall, Location and breakfast is good, rest are average to below average at best.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: JAC53Scotland
Reviews.Content: On arrival at check-in, I was informed by the manager that I ahd to look him in the face whilst checking-in! He then proceeded to take a telephone call whilst dealing with me. The room was tiny, the shower cubicle was so narrow that both my friend and I had problems getting in and out - and neither of us is very big! There was a hair in one of the beds. We could hear the conversation in the next room, and heard everyone who passed outside the room. The room was extremely hot and the AC was not working. We reported this but nothing was done. Breakfast was inedible - the scrambled egg tasted as if it had been made with sour milk, and the bread was stale and hard.

Reviews.Title: “Location A+”
Reviews.Author: travaille2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for New Year's 2010 and had a wonderful time. LOCATION - The hotel is so close to all major sites of Rome, excluding the Vatican. We could easily walk in 10 minutes to the Colesseum, Forum, Spanish Steps, and the nicer shopping areas. The Vatican was not bad either, as the bus taking us there picked us up about 2 blocks away from the hotel entrance (same goes for the bus taking you to Termini to catch all the trains). We rented a car service (Rome Cabs) from the airport to the hotel only because we were unfamiliar with Rome -- if we did it again, public transportation is very easy. HOTEL - Rooms are small, but clean and in good shape (size is normal for Europe IMO). The previous reviewers are correct that the bathroom is small, but honestly -- how much time do you need to spend in the bathroom? I am 5'7" and did not have any issues taking a shower or anything else. It was clean and looked like it was new or recently renovated. My wife could use the mirror outside to do anything with her hair, if she needed more space. They actually had a built in converter in the bathroom for US plugs, so you did not need a converter for your hair dryer, etc. Had your basics -- queen size bed, tv, work table, minibar, and dresser. Room overlooked the street below, but was relatively quiet. Internet was only 3 Euro for an hour or something like that. Not bad considering how much you spend in Italy! We brought our laptop to Skype and had no problems with the connection. The reaturant/bar is a bit expensive ($10-$17 for a drink), but we found that "normal" prices were $8-$12 anyways. Maybe that was cue to stick with house wine! The free breakfast buffet was good and had everything from cereal to breads/cheeses to hot items like bacon/potatoes/eggs/ham. Coffee and cafés were also included. SERVICE - Generally good service for a larger hotel. They took the time to show us where to go and how to get around with public transportation. Most staff members (at least front desk) spoke English and could communicate well. Checking out was a breeze and we were never ignored and always attended to when we had questions. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a comfortable room to sleep in and to be in the middle of all the sites. I think most other hotels nearby were charging almost double or more than what we spent on our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: superalpi
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome for the New Year 2010. We booked this hotel because quite by chance found their special offer on one of the booking sites. The price was twice lower than the average price for the hotels of the same class in Rome for the New Year holiday. We are not disappointed at all. The location is excellent. It is adjustent to Piazza Venezia, which is a central square and a good starting point to explore Rome. The check-in was fast. The breakfast was good. The only problem was the small size of the room, though the room was well decorated and furnished. The worst thing was the shower cabin (no bath tub), which was so narrow that it was really inconvenient to take shower. We are both slim but we could imagine the problems that anyone even slightly bigger than us would have in this shower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.. excellent location”
Reviews.Author: beckbee33
Reviews.Content: This hotel was literally 10 mins walk from the collisium, the staff were friendly, rooms small but perfectly adequate, breakfast yummy and price exceptional.. (we went through expedia) Would def stay here again

Reviews.Title: “outstanding restaurant recommendation”
Reviews.Author: portscot
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, high ceilings, but too warm/stuffy for November - opening windows eventually solved problem. Outstanding location, particularly for walking to sights such as Victor Emmauneul at night. Real winner, however, was recommendation from front desk to eat at Santa Cristina at Quirinale, around the corner and up some steep steps. Mozzarella and proscuito; gorgonzola gnocchi were memorable. Thanks, Max!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, if you don't need sleep or good service”
Reviews.Author: L0nd0nBlue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in November 2009. The hotel itself is nice enough and it is in a great location. The rooms are very small though and the cistern for the bathroom in the room next door was right next to the bedhead in our room. The result being that everytime the occupants of the room next door used the bathroom (basin, shower or toilet) we were woken by the incredibly loud noise of the cistern right next to our ear. We did ask to change rooms but to say that the management were less than helpful would be an understatement. Needless to say we did not sleep much for the four days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not stay here - awful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JustinPalmer
Reviews.Content: First the good things about the Cosmopolita, it is quite central and the bar area is relatively well stocked and comfortable. That's it! We were put in the smallest room I have ever had the misfortune to stay in and our friend's room was even smaller! The rooms were so small you could not open the door fully as it hit the bed. This brings me on to the bed which was basically a large single bed for 2 people, none of our party of 4 got a good nights sleep over the 3 nights we stayed. There were no plug points in the room and the wardrobe was so slim that only 4 hangers could hang in there, the television made a loud buzzing sound whenever it was switched on which basically made it unwatchable (obviously we were not there to watch TV but when you are in a hotel room it is nice to watch tv if you choose), there was no storage space whatsoever which meant that we had to have our cases by the entrance door and then lift them on to the bed when we needed to exit the room. Perhaps the size of the room and the bed would have been bearable had the room not have been filthy as well, there were sprays of what I hope was mud up the walls and the floor was dusty. What little sleep we did have in this room was interuppted by a phantom phone that would ring once every half an hour throughout the night and at one stage when attempting an afternoon nap, despite putting a "Do not disturb" sign on the door we were disturbed twice by cleaners asking if we wanted our rooms made up, what is a do not disturb sign for if it does not stop people from knocking on your door??? The breakfast was of reasonable quality however once a tray of food was empty it took 2-3 requests or 10-15 mins before it was refilled which is very frustrating when you are paying EUR15 per head. As well as the other complaints the internet speed was a joke in the rooms despite being EUR9 per day and the reception desk got our bills wrong when we went to check out. This is one of the worst hotels I have stayed in and was not cheap it is such a shame that such a wonderful historic and cultured city has a terrible hotel as this representing it. The trevi hotel by the Trevi fountain is just as central, cheaper and much much more comfortable and clean, please stay there or anywhere other than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkpidgin
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it's location which is wonderful. Rome is easy to tour on foot and even easier if with the Cosmopolita as a base since you can pop back to use the bathroom or put your feet up between sights. There are numerous restuarants within a few minute's walk and all the major sights are on the doorstep. The furthest we went was the Vatican which was a 30 min walk straight down Corso Vittorio Emanuel II and the Villa Borghese whihc is again about 30 mins down Via del Corso. Rooms are basic but clean and comfy if a little hot. We had a twin room which would be small by American standards but perectly fine for Europeans. It is certainly not a luxury hotel but has all you need for a good base to stay. The bathroom had a good shower and a hairdryer. The mini bar was well stocked but had space for you to put your own drinks in if needed. The windows are double or triple glazed and shut out street noise very well. Breakfast was very good with something for most people - fruit, pastries, eggs, bacon, yoghurts, cereal, breads, cheese and ham as well as a good reange of hot drinks. Despite being busy nothing ran out as the buffet was frequently replenished. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and speak excellent English and French but are also happy to chat in Italian if you want to practice! They are also happy to give recommendations for restaurants etc, give directions and look after your luggage after checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel514
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights at the end of our 12 day honeymoon. Location was fabulous - easy walking distance to all of the major sites, good food and several ATM choices are nearby; bus stop is just around the corner; it is also less than 10 minutes from the train station which equals a cheap (about 10 euro) taxi ride (for those leaving for FCO from the hotel it is about a 30 min taxi ride). It was a fabulous value for us but I think we may have booked when they had special rates... we stayed in the Double Superior room - it was small but very clean with high ceilings and hardwood floors. The bed was reasonably comfortable but the pillows were horrible - very hard and overstuffed. The bathroom was clean but very, very small and it had the tiniest shower I have ever experienced in my life - great water pressure though. The room had a strange step down into the room and then you had to step up into the bathroom; the walls were very thin as well (we could hear people arguing on the other side of us) - I brought a fan for background noise, so my husband and I slept fine, but it would have been hard to sleep if I hadn't... Breakfast was very good (though the only thing "American" about it was the scrambled eggs) - it had a nice selection of pastries and meats and good coffee. The hallway and the elevator had a very bad smell the whole time we were there, but otherwise the hotel was clean and nice looking - nothing especially interesting but more than adequate since we didn't want to spend much time in the hotel anyway. The rooftop bar/restaurant is really more of a patio - you cannot order anything up there, but you can bring your own drinks or food up and sit and enjoy the view. Staff was polite but often looked annoyed when we had questions and many of them did not speak English as well as we had hoped - we had one guy that we always looked for when we walked by and only asked him questions after trying to speak with two others that were hard to communicate with... overall it was an average hotel that met our basic needs but nothing special - I would still recommend this hotel based on the location though - it was easy to go back to the hotel to rest for a little while between sights (which was important near the end of a 12 day trip).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl9499
Reviews.Content: This is truly the first time I've ever written a review of a hotel, but I wanted to share my experience I had with the Hotel Cosmopolita. As most know, finding a decent hotel in Rome is hit or miss. I relied on others' reviews of this hotel on Trip Advisor and they were right! This is a great hotel!! Phenomenal location, you can walk to everything. Very clean rooms and good size. My 2 kids and I shared a triple, and my parents stayed in a double. Our room faced the street, but you'd never know it! The breakfast was pretty good and a cost savings if anything else. When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly front desk staff that was very helpful in navigating us around the hotel, took care of our luggage, gave great recommendations for nearby restaurants and they helped us phone our tour guides to confirm our tours. Only 2 negatives--at times in the hallway by the elevator and then again in our bathroom we could smell the sewer gas--smelly but tolerable. Second--there are 2 front desk guys that are a bit ornery--not as people-friendly. Otherwise everything else was great! I very much recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tandkDE
Reviews.Content: Great location midway between Trevi and Colosseo. Breakfasts were delicious and Max, at the front desk, was very helpful (some of the other front desk staff, however, were a little stuffy). Max's recommendation to eat at nearby Ristorante Santa Cristina was spot on ... a delightful, small place with great food. Only negative was noisy Nags Head Scottish pub across the street on Via 4 Novembre. Would definitely ask for a room facing quieter Via di Santa Eufemia next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: agzterlina
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to all the positive reviews we had read before deciding to stay here. Unique, clean, great location, beautiful recently renovated bathroom, friendly staff, tasty breakfast with excellent cappuccino machine, etc. We stayed in room 410, which was a superior double with very high ceiling and an internal courtyard view of nearby church cupolas and Victor Emmanuel monument beyond. The rooftop deck was the only feature that we wished we had taken the time to enjoy more. It is a perfect place to share a bottle of wine after a long day of sightseeing. We highly recommend the Cosmo!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: cressyUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel had absolutely everything it claimed. From a perfectly central location visitors can get to all parts of Rome which are equal distances from the hotel. The staff are absolutely focussed on providing a first class service whilst being friendly and totally accomodating. The staff are like perfect policemen always around when you need them but otherwise inconspicuous. A special mention for 'Deborah' who cleaned our room to perfection. The whole hotel was spotless from the reception right through to the fantastic roof terrace where you could become Roman and enjoy a drink or quiet time at your leisure. We had a super visit in Rome which is a breathtakingly beautiful city which was enhanced by staying at the 'Cosmopolita' thank you!

Reviews.Title: “There couldn't be a better location!”
Reviews.Author: Missatruck
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel in downtown Rome, close to everything! If you're there on a Friday be sure to attend the Friday night wine tasting at their restaurant The Glass, the restaurant staff is fantastic. The rooms are a bit small, but very clean and the A/C works great.

Reviews.Title: “Location. Location. Location!”
Reviews.Author: AnneMemphis42
Reviews.Content: Right where you want to be to see all the highlights of Rome. Walking distance to all except the Vatican, unless, of course, you're young and in great shape for the walk. Our romm was charming, old world and decent size for Europe. The breakfast buffet had a great variety and plenty of it. The rooftop was delightful. The drinks in the bar were exceptionally well made and the tapas for just a little bit more were tasty and filling. Shopping and wonderful restaurants quite handy. What more can one ask for?.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: men264
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, hardwood floors throughout, had A/C, free breakfast every morning which was adequate - included eggs, yogurt, ham, toast, pastries, cappucino, juice, etc...., provided in-room safe and was great for its location. It was close to nothing but was within a 5 minute walking distance to just about everything. The 40 express bus that takes you to the train startion and the Vatican stops right across from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room in great central location”
Reviews.Author: FayBSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: Great location!!! Walked to all the main attractions, however there are numerous buses just a few minutes walk from the hotel. The room was quite small however very clean and the bathroom was new and clean (although shower very small). Good/fresh continental breakfast. Would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good by Roman standards”
Reviews.Author: Heathiem
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 5 to 7 September. This was our second visit to Rome and was a much better hotel than we stayed at last time. Because we knew Rome to some degree we knew this was an excellent location, on this fact alone I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting the city who wants to be walking distance from all the major attractions, the Vatican is the only locality which is a lengthy walk but you could get a hop on/off bus to get it if you didn't want to walk. I have now stayed in a number of hotels around Italy and seen what is available in Rome and for me this was a very good quality hotel. Breakfast was good, the bar was modern, the room had everything we needed, it was clean, has had modern fit out in recent years and the service was good, but above all it is in a brilliant location. If you want a hotel with a modern feel which lives up to its 4 star rating this is a good choice. Oh, we did book one of the larger rooms for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: jackie26747
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and on arrival , the room was dark, small and lacking that certain something, despite the fact we brought a superior room!!!. The bathroom is very small, no bath and a very small single shower cubicle. The room was cleaned on a daily basis, although we had to ask for toilet roll. There was only one towel per person which was weird. Nice central location and the buses were very good value. The Nags head pub opposite is the best value for money, altough still 5 euro a pint. Beware of scouts trying to get you to pay extra for getting in front of the line at attractions! They fail to give you the tickets you need so it is a scam! Museums are free the last Sunday of the month which could have saved a lot of money had we known!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing value for money”
Reviews.Author: Zarek
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for a business meeting. The good points were that the hotel has a convenient central location and the room was very clean. Our business meeting was in a rooftop room which was pleasantly bright and had a good view, although the noise of the air conditioning systems was intrusive. On the downsides, my room was extremely small, dark and lacking in any character - a stay of more than one night would have been very claustraphobic. Breakfast was reasonable quality food but the breakfast room was strangely arranged with a congested bottleneck corridor to the buffet area. The bar area was adequate but again lacking in character. I know that central Rome hotels tend to be cramped. However I felt the room rate of 143 Euro represented disappointing value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: DenaKennedy
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were sent to a beauitiful room. We had been traveling, so we took a quick shower and hit the bar. When we returned to the room, we noticed the air conditioning wasn't working. We asked to have it fixed. We were told it couldn't be. We asked for a different room and were told the hotel was full. We asked for a discount and were told no. We simultaneously learned that our debit hard had a hold on it of close to $2000, when our room rate for the four nights was only $850. Our money was tied up and they couldn't get it released. We were on our own as far as finding a place to stay with air conditioning (it was very hot and humid during this time). We were offered nothing for our inconvenience and had to wait four days for the bank to release the hold on our funds.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: LondonAmw
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was the location. Nearly everything (apart from maybe the vatican) was in walking distance. The hotel is just down the road from the colosseum and the roman forum. Its beautiful just walking back to the hotel. I would definately make sure i stayed central in rome becasue its so much easier to see everything and you can do it all foot. The room was small and it was meant to be a superior double! However it didnt feel like you were boxed in and was perfectly comfortable for two people. So that didnt bother us. The room was very clean and they made it spotless everyday, the whole hotel was well kept and extremely clean and perfectly quiet. The air conditioning was an absolute joy after a day in the sun (make sure you definately get air con in your room). I did miss tea making facilities a little but apart from that it was pretty perfect. As for breakfast, i was a little dissapointed because I had read somewhere you could eat it on the rooftop terrace but it was served in the restaurant. However the restaurant is very modern and plesant. The breakfast had a huge spread, atleast for a continental breakfast, with cooked food too like scrambled egg and bacon. as well as fresh bread fruit cereals and pastries. I was very impressed with the spread. All in all the hotel was lovely, really clean, fwith riendly staff, comfortable and right in the heart of Rome. I would definately reccomend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the middle of all the monuments!!”
Reviews.Author: SamJ0hns
Reviews.Content: Open top buses are a great way to see where everything is and you can hop on and off when ever you want!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you want a twin room!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cruiky
Reviews.Content: Harry Potter's cupboard under the stairs was more spacious than room 114 allocated to us in the Cosmopolita. The room is so small the beds are placed headboard to headboard along the wall, you then have aprox 1 foot of space at the side to get past. When we arrived the air conditioning wasn't working, which took a couple of hours to fix after pestering reception. In the meantime we opened the windows, that open out onto a flat roof, which judging by the amount of rat droppings - is infested. The reception and staircase smelt like a sewer. All in all I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: April7California
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to the Cosmopolita hotel we were able to check in right away even though it was only about 12 in the afternoon. The feel of this hotel is more business like in the lobby. We found out that you have to pay to use the internet which was a change from where we stayed in Paris. The room was spacious but, the beds were pretty hard and not really that comfortable. The shower and bathroom was small but adequate for us. We had a big window that opened up to the street below. The only real complaint we had was that the air conditioning in the room did not work very well. It was in the low 90's F while we were there so it did get a little uncomfortable at times. The buffet breakfast was a nice way to start the day with an espresso machine, cereals, fruit, yogurt, pastries, eggs and bacon. The most fantasitc attribute of this hotel is it's location. We were a 10 minute walk to the Colusseum, where you walk through Augustus Forum and such along the way. Piazza Venezia is just around the corner, the Capitolini museum is right behind Piazza Venezia. Stores and shops are right down the street and to the right. You can walk to the Pantheon, Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain, Terme de Carcalla. We actually rode a bus to the Vatican but you could walk there it would take about 20 min. We had a four year old with us and she walked to all of these places as well. There are many gelato places around. One of our favorites restaurants to eat at was the Imperio Forum which is right down the street from the Coluseum, they have home made pasta mmmm.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but overrated and overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Noseah
Reviews.Content: Though we took what was billed as a "superior" room, it was hardly luxurious. It was only slightly bigger than a room we visited in a hotel literally around the corner, where the price was 20% less. Contrary to the misleading pictures on the hotel's website which show a room with a couch, two arm-chairs, and a view overlooking some piazza, this room had no couch and no arm-chairs. Besides the bed and one straight-backed chair, there was no place to sit. After three days of begging, we finally got a second straight-backed chair. The window did not face a piazza, but the small space between the back of the hotel and the next building. At least the wall opposite our window was mostly blank, so our privacy was not much impaired. Though this was disappointing, considering the pictures on the website, it was actually a blessing. Had the window faced the street the room would have been intolerably noisy. We had the good fortune of having a tiny balcony, useless for sitting or looking out from, but pefect for hanging laundry. (You can have your clothes laundered by room service at prices such as 6 euros for one t-shirt.) The place seems to have had a recent remodelling, so things like doors, light-switches, bathroom facilities were all in excellent shape. We did not hear our neighbors at all. The location is fine, but not as special as other reviewers have written. The cluster of hotels of which this a part is the nearest to the ancient Forum Romanum, if that is what you are looking for, but not necessarily to other sites. Rome is so packed with things to see and visit, that nearly anywhere in the large "Historical Center" -- such as the areas near the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Campo di Fiori, Spanish Steps, Termini, Vatican, and much more -- can be said to be ideally located. A drawback of the immediate location of this hotel is that being surrounded by business and government buildings and the vast emptiness of the ancient Forum approaches, there is no residential "hinterland." The nearest place to buy so much as a cucumber or a band-aid is a ten-minute walk away . (An excellent and friendly supermarket on the Corso Vittorio Emanuelle just before the Largo Argentina.) To say that the front desk staff was unhelpful in finding this would be a great understatement. The breakfast room is quite pleasant, but not the spectacular place pictured on the website. Breakfast included a fine array of cereals, fruit, coffees, and the like. The worst part was the attitude of the front desk personnel. The front desk is understaffed, so that even if the people there were inclined to be friendly, they probably could not be. There was no evidence that they (with one exception) were inclined to be friendly. For the dati traveler: The doors operate by electronic key cards, which presents a shabbat problem. However to our pleasant surprise, the porters were quite cheerful in escorting us to our rooms, and are apprently accustomed to dealing with this matter. There was in the room one lamp which we could put on a timer we brought. The old Ghetto, with its synagogues, restaurants and superb bakery, is a seven to ten minute walk from the hotel. There probably is not a closer hotel of this class.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the city centre; Clean place; but cold service”
Reviews.Author: KKLeung
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Rome in the morning. According to the instruction given by the hotel before we travelled, we're advised either to take a taxi from the railway station, or to take the metro for 2 or 3 stops to get to the hotel. Two or three stops looked simple to us, so we decided to take the metro. Although the hotel had sent me a map before, it was rather difficult to locate the hotel. Fifteen minutes' walk was really 15 minutes, and it was very hard to walk under a hot sun. We needed to ask 5 passers-by for direction, although only two of them clearly knew the direction. Except this, the location was actually close to the city centre and major attractions. On arrival, we're pleased that we were allowed to check in early. I don't know if it was because the room was reserved by the travel agent in my country together with the air-tickets. We were arranged to stay in Room 446, and the room was very extremely small indeed. Well, but everything was clean and tidy. Sleep was sound. I think that the most uncomfortable thing was the cold and stern attitude of the staff. There was a gentleman who looked like a manager working at the reception desk. We tried to ask him for some information about hot water and direction to the railway station on two occasions, we were faced with blank face, blunt voice and of course lack of eye-contact. And in a morning when we went to the hotel's restaurant for buffet breakfast, we were led to a table. Then after we'd returned to the table after taking the food, the table was occupied. The staff there did not seem to know what had happened, but asked rather impolitely, "what's the problem of you?" Well, I explained, and he apologised, and asked us to move to another table. But I didn't feel comfortable anyway with the attitude. As the first stop of my trip in Italy, this hotel was rather disappointing in view of attitude of the staff. And I started to wonder if there was any discrimination to Asian travellers in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Anon75Cork
Reviews.Content: Small, clean hotel in a perfect location. You can easily walk to Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Pantheon and other attractions. We got a bus straight across the road to the Vatican but ended up walking back to the hotel as it was not very far. Staff are helpful and have good English. Breakfast is more than adequate with a good choice of cereals, fruit, yoghurt, bread and beverages. The only negative I would say is that the "double" bed is 2 single beds pushed together but that seemed to be the case with many others hotels in Rome judging from the reviews. I would stay here again.Booked it through hotels.com as they seemed to be the cheapest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. I will definately return.”
Reviews.Author: nbwat1
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel! The location is perfect! It is located in the middle of Rome and there is absolutely no need to catch the subway, bus or taxi. I walked to the Colosseum, Vatican, Termini etc. The rooms are very nice and clean and the bathroom is a great size too. It would have been better to have the tb at eye level instead of in the top corner of the wall/ceiling but I was in Rome to sightsee as most people are. The breakfast room is very nice and light. The selection is excellent - cereals, toast, brioches, cheese, ham, yogurt, fruit etc. I appreciated they had a coffee machine where I could make a cappaccino as opposed to most hotels which just serve black coffee/american coffee. There is also a bar attached to the hotel which is a really nice place to have a drink before heading out to dinner. The rooftop terrace is very nice also where you can take your drinks and enjoy a nice view of Rome. Staff at reception were friendly and helpful, some more than others. I will definately stay here when I return to Rome. I thought the hotel was excellent considering the price I paid on hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mendoza_25R
Reviews.Content: As so many people have stated, the location is fantastic. You can easily walk to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona etc. No Metro stops nearby, so buying the Roman Pass just for this, could be a waste of money, but the main public bus stops across the road. Front desk were very helpful. I even returned to the room to find a nice chilled bottle of bubble on my birthday, which no-one had prompted them for. Breakfast more than adequate, with good coffee and breads, as well as some hot items. Breakfast room also a nice setting. Rooms clean and functional, if a little small. But in response to the moaners on here about showers - I'm 6'2" and not exactly slender and I managed fine in the showers. They're not the biggest, but you can cope. My biggest issue was the strength of the external door lock on the room. On our first room I could open the locked door with a firm tap from the heel of my hand. They sent someone to fix it, but when we returned 6 hours later it was no better. In the end we had to change rooms. My advice is to give your rooms a good check once you've closed the door. Also - collect your safe key upon check-in, to save you going downstairs for it later. In summary, location and the room rate (try Hotels.com) sets it apart from some others in it's class or in the area. But what you make up for in location you lose in room space - but it's Rome and you can't see it from your hotel now, can you?!

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly clean and a great location which I would like to come back to”
Reviews.Author: BobbytScotland
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of days here after a Royal Carribean cruise. Hotel was excellent. Only small quibble might be that the shower is quite small but as neither my wife nor I are very 'large', this was not a problem for us. Very clean, friendly, courteous staff, nice breakfast . Bar and bar staff very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located, very clean”
Reviews.Author: couplefromFlorida
Reviews.Content: Spent three days here with spouse. Very nice location, could see all the sights! The rooms and hotel were kept very clean, breakfast was good - and the staff friendly and spoke english. My only complaint is that the roof terrace/garden was not "open" - you could go up, but it wasn't attended to, and seemed like a wasted opportunity for the hotel since the view was beautiful. Over all a good hotel, not a bargain, but not over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel to Begin Our Honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: Wahoo73
Reviews.Content: Although the Cosmopolita's location is unquestionably its best asset, there are other reasons to recommend it. Yes, the rooms and bathrooms are small by American standards, but they are nicely decorated and well furnished. Although the hotel is located just a few feet from one of Rome's busiest and is near the very noisy Piazza Venezia, our room, which faced an inner courtyard, was quite quiet. The breakfast, which was included in the price of the room, was quite sumptuous. Rome was the first stop on our honeymoon trip and we arrived at the hotel about 10AM. We asked for an early check-in and the desk clerk, Alessandro, informed us our room would not be ready until noon. We checked our luggage with him and went to explore the neighborhood. When we returned promptly at noon, our bags had already been taken up to our room. During our four day stay, we also had occasion to make other requests of the staff. All were attended to courteously and promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but if that's a 4 star hotel, what are the 3 star places like?”
Reviews.Author: wellwhynot
Reviews.Content: If you only want to use the hotel as somewhere to sleep and take a shower, it's a great location - 10 minutes to the Trevi Fountain, 5 minutes to the Forum and 10 mins to the Colosseum. But it certainly ain't luxurious!! And the staff are a bit grim. And the rooms are compact - to say the least. The bathrooms are basic, if a little old fashioned, but clean. And we had to ask for more towels every day. But overall, for me the location outweighed other disadvantages. It's possible to walk almost everywhere from the hotel. But it's not a good hotel for anyone with mobility issues as there are lots of stairs - there was even a step in our bedroom The hop on hop off buses stop round the corner near the Vittorio Emmanuel memorial - so it's worth getting a ticket to get a tour of the city - and it will take you to the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel if you weigh more than 130 pounds. The showers are beyond small as are the rooms and the service sucks”
Reviews.Author: traveleroccasionally
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival on May 18 we asked if we could be accomodated earlier than the check-in time because of having traveled over night from the states. It was 11:30 a.m. We were sent to a room (402--avoid this one) within 20 minutes (good). The shower was so small that one of regular girth would have had to squeeze in sideways. The A/C was not working. After numerous unanswered complaints we finally settled into another nearby hotel about 11 p.m. The front desk staff member actually stood in front of the air conditioning unit and argued that it was working while I and my travelling companion were off to the side dripped perspiration. We stayed at another hotel that evening thanks to a much more reasonable young (Asian descent) front desk clerk who made these arrangements. We returned to Cosmopolita the next day and were assigned to room 336. Now we were met with bottles dropping about 11:30 each night and linen carts rolling around the courtyard beneath our window at about 4:30 a.m. The breakfast consisted of some very tasty fair if you like ice cold (powered, I'm sure) scrambled eggs. I actually thought perhaps this was the way Italians ate this dish until the next hotel in Florence where the eggs were "real" and hot. The first desk clerk is about late 40's early 50's, salt and pepper hair and grouchy as can be and totally impolite. He apparently was never informed as to who actually pays his salary. All this for about $200/night. What a JOKE!! And I think the same owners also own the Mariott in Rome--perhaps this should be avoided as well. BJS

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetsgirl
Reviews.Content: The location is the best aspect of this hotel. This hotel was voted by Expedia as being in the top 1%--but due to the staff, I consider that a bit generous. The front desk person that checked us in seemed to think he was working at the Waldorf in NYC with his less than welcoming attitude. However, I am willing to give him the benefit of having a bad day--as he mellowed out the last day of our four day stay. One really awesome selling point was they allowed us to check in early. We were tired, dirty, shell shocked from the drive over in our death-cab and in desperate need of a cool room. Thankfully, our AC worked very well. We had an INCREDIBLE view out of our bathroom windown of the Colliseum, the Wedding Cake building (I never could figure out the official name) and the Piazza nearby. We were very close to a bus tour line, the regular bus line and the Termini (three stops over on the 40). The internet worked intermittantly, which really sucked, as we paid for twelve hours and only used about eight. Many times, we just couldn't get a connection to start up, but perhaps that was due to usage overload. Overall, nice hotel, awesome location, very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/value”
Reviews.Author: FromFLtoItaly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, 10-15 minute walk to the Colosseum. The only downside to the location is it is 10-15 minute walk to the nearest subway station (Colosseum or Via Cavor). Service was excellent, room was big enough, shower was small but that seems to be normal based on what I've read. The hotel has a bar inside and a restaurant (The Glass) upstairs where the free breakfast is. Surprisingly, The Glass is an amazing restaurant and definitely worth at least one dinner (we ate there two out of six nights).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and value”
Reviews.Author: komrad
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel with a really good location. It's very centrally located and most sites in the city center and easily walkable. The breakfast was very nice and got us a good start

Reviews.Title: “superb all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: DarwenRover
Reviews.Content: Comfortable 4* hotel with a great location one minute stroll from the historical sights of the Via dei Fore Imperiali and the spectacular view down to the Coloseum. Would recommend upgrade to a Superior room in order to take advantage of a larger room size. Spotlessly clean throughout with a modern bar area - The Glass Bar, used by locals and guests alike, offering good value for money buffet including drink for just 10 Euros. Lift available to all floors but still a few steps to navigate. Overlooks busy road but double glazed windows keep most noise out guaranteeing a good nights sleep after a hard days sightseeing. Air conditioned and daily maid service. Buffet breakfast in the Glass restaurant on the mezzanine level provides a good choice to start the day. All the sights of Rome are walkable from here, 5 minutes to the Trevi Fountain,10 minute stroll to the Colosseum, 25 minutes to the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel at 2 star price, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Nimo88
Reviews.Content: The hotel location (Piazza Venecia) could not get any better. Walking distance to Colloseum, Roman Forums, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Forno Di Campo, Spanish Steps. The room size is above average compared to European standards. My only complaint was getting into the shower stall (I'm big boned) took a little getting to use to. The included American style buffet was quite satisfying for most ethnicities. The staff are professional, polite, and english speaking. Tips: right up the street around the corner, is a small affordable snack store where you can pick up some necessities like bottled water, chips, candies. If your not up for walking to sights, there is hop on/hop off tour "110 tour" red double decker bus near by.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, good rate, great wine pairing dinner on Fridays”
Reviews.Author: ArleneHolland_NY_USA
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been more pleased with the Cosmopolitan Hotel. We had booked 30 days in advance directly on their website and received a great rate. We booked a standard twin and the size was typical for a European hotel. The location was very safe and convenient: we were able to walk to the Forum, Colisseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon and Piazza Navonna. We tooked the bus (bus stop is just around the corner from the hotel) to the Termini Station and to St. Peter's. The Friday night wine and food pairing dinner for 25 euro was wonderful. A four course buffet was served with a selection of ten wines that complimented the different courses, including the dessert course. Two sommaliers were on hand to provide information on the wines. The breakfast (included in the room rate) was better than most; creamy scrambled eggs, bacon, plus the usual meats, pastries, muesli, yogurt, fruit, cheese, etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmopolita in the middle of everything!”
Reviews.Author: MariNorway
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, didn't use taxi or public transport the whole weekend trough:-) Room 440 had plenty of space, big bathroom and nice view. Breakfast could have been better, and they could have filled the trays more often. Bread was delicious, though! Hotel had it's own driver, who brought us back too the airport(14€ ). Perfect for a romantic easter weekend in Rome :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly central hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MaryWUk
Reviews.Content: We (family of four with two teenage boys) very much enjoyed our stay here. The staff were very friendly and helpful, breakfast was generous (enough for large boy's appetites!), location could not be better, we could easily walk to any of the major city centre areas, and there were lots of restaurants we liked in easy reach. The hotel is near the Piazza Venezia so near many bus routes if you wanted to take a bus but our rooms overlooked a quiet side street.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel lived up to previous reviews, very good”
Reviews.Author: Westercraigs
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Rome having stayed at the Cosmopolita Hotel. It is in a great location. The hotel staff are excellent and the rooms are spotless. Pillows could be a wee bit softer, but that could be just me, The hotel restaurant The Glass was not so good, food pretty poor. The breakfast was very simple, its an area that could be improved upon. I found the bar very noisy and was unable to use it as the level of the music was to high, it was also disturbing at breakfast, again that could be me, I like quitenes in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice and clean hotel- recommended”
Reviews.Author: nipo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the center of the historical part of Rome, you can walk to all major attractions in half an hour or less. The room was small but spotless clean and very comfortable. breakfast was very good, full buffet with all you need in the morning to keep you walking till noon. It is recommended to have a drink in the glass coffee shop in the hotel and look at the view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Recoleta
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat for Rome's main tourist attractions. The rooms are nice and clean. Minor downsides: no wireless in the room, no hot water pot in the room. Keys didn't like working :) Still very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location- perfect for a weekend break..”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter087
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cosmopolita is in a fantastic location if you want to explore Rome on foot. We went for a weekend and couldnt have asked to be more central. The staff were friendly and helpful and even reccomended and booked us a great restaurant for dinner ( Ristorante Clemente near the Pantheon) which is easy walking distance.. The rooms were basic and clean and the breakfasts were typically continental (simple and good). The hotel is perfect for a weekend away and there is even a very cool bar next door if you fancy a mean mojito after you wandered the city! Thanks to the staff for a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Cosmopolita Hotel - Center of Rome - Great in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: 1011traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and helpful and provides great service. The breakfast offers something for everyone - from yogurt to sausage, and the food in their restaurant through the day is fantastic. The onion soup is extraordinary as is the cheese/honey appetizer, and the pastas and wine! Rooms are clean, well decorated, and supplied - no irons. It is situated near everything necessary. We walked past Trevi Fountain nearly everyday and were in walking distance of Colosseum, Forum,Parthenon, Largo Argentina, shopping, restaurants, subways, tour bus stops, buses, and taxis. ROME IS A WONDERFUL CITY!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and room, but some shady practices...”
Reviews.Author: Arilisanne
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews, we decided to stay at the Cosmopolitana despite the fact that it was a little bit more than we'd wanted to spend. But after researching hotels in Rome I found 150 Euros a night was fairly reasonable. And the location was definitely great. But you have to be so careful in Rome because it seems sometimes like everyone is trying to scam you in some way and this hotel was no exception, unfortunately. Upon arriving at the hotel we were pleased to see it was very clean, modern and upscale. But when I was checking in, the man at the desk seemed to hesitate a bit as he looked at my reservation. Then I saw him cross out the room I was originally given and change it to another room number. He then gave our room key DIRECTLY to the bellman, not even telling us the room number or giving us the option of taking the luggage ourselves, which was a bit unnerving. I was also a little unnerved that the security system not only requires a key card to get into the main part of the hotel, but also to get out, which seems scary in the event of an emergency. Anyway it was somewhat convenient to have the bellman since the hotel is somewhat oddly shaped and even when you take the lift, you usually have to take some more stairs to get to your room. When we reached our "room," (#114) it was essentially a long, narrow hallway with 2 single beds lined up, one behind the other with a bedstand between them. The bathroom was tiny, the whole shape was unnerving, as it looked sort of like a dormitory hallway. Since it said very clearly on my reservation form through expedia that I had booked a room with a QUEEN BED, I called the front desk and complained. He immediately said it would be no problem to switch and that he would send the bellman up to move us (again, he didn't even give me the option of getting the new key myself, and we were forced to wait until the bellman was able to come up and move us). The upshot was the new room was lovely, with no problems. Personally I believe what happened was that the man at the desk saw that we were 2 females traveling together and thought perhaps he could get away with giving us this crappier room, saving the queen room in case a "couple" came in not realizing we too were a couple. BUt even if I had been with just a friend, I wouldn't have wanted this room - it was too weird and creepy. Anyway, the new room, as I said, was quite satisfactory, and we had no further problems with the hotel, but that experience definitely tainted us a bit, especially since we'd had good experiences with all our other hotels in Italy. The breakfast is good, and they had a beautiful restaurant though we didn't eat there, and apparently a rooftop balcony though it was too cold when we were there to take advantage of that. Everything was clean and it was in a great location to explore Rome. They also were able to provide a car service to take us to the airport for a flat rate of 50 Euros, about the same price as a taxi. I don't think this is a bad hotel, and probably most people wouldn't have the experience we had, but if it speaks to the way they operate, I can't wholeheartedly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Dog_2000
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome the first week in November and had an amazing time. Rome is a very easy city to navigate and everything is within a reasonable walking distance. After all of the stories I've heard of pick-pockets and roving Gypsies I was a bit concerned. Of course like in any big city you should always be cautious of your surroundings, but I felt very safe walking around even at night. There was always alot of people out and about and so many people looking at maps that you won't feel like the "only" tourist trying to figure out where you're at. We stayed at Hotel Cosmopolita for 4 nights. It is located close to the Colosseum, Palatine Hill, Capitoline Museum. This was my first visit to Rome so being centrally located made it very easy for us to walk everywhere which made the experience so much richer as every square inch of Rome is a magnificent work of art not to be missed. The area around the hotel seemed very safe. From Fiumincino Airport we took an "official" taxi from the cue just outside the doors. We were solicited by many "unofficial" taxis, but ignored them. The cab cost flat rate of 40€ + 2.50€ for each bag + tip. Hotel Cosmopolita offered a limosine service for 50€ from the airport, same as a cab ride which is a great alternative if you plan ahead. I payed $160USD per night for Hotel Cosmopolita through European Destinations, which I thought was a very reasonable price for the quality and location of the hotel. The hotel staff was courteous and very accommodating. We arrived at about 8:30 a.m. and were allowed to check in early at no extra cost which was really nice since we were fatigued after a very long flight. A very nice young man carried our luggage to our room and would not accept a tip. We had a to use a key card to get into the area where the rooms were and of course a keycard to get into the room, which made us feel very safe. The room was not very big, but met our needs...a place to sleep and take a shower. The room was kept very clean as was the entire hotel. The bed and the pillows were a bit firm for my taste, but that seems to be the norm in Italy. In the room there was an armoire that locked and a safe inside of that...very nice to store larger valuables. The hotel is located on a side street so it was very quiet in our room, which was nice because we had the windows open as it was rather warm during our stay. The bathroom was a bit of a tight squeeze, especially the shower. I am small could barely turn around. But there was always plenty of hot water and the water pressure was powerful so I certainly wouldn't base my decision to stay here on that minor inconvenience. A hairdryer was provided and nice little amenities like Q-tips, kleenex, nail file, shampoo, soap, shower cap, etc. In the evening the chambermaid left us candies and turned down our bed. A delicious buffet breakfast was included in the price of the room and served from 7:30 - 9:30 a.m. Eggs, meats, cheese, croissants, muffins, breads, spreads, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, juice, coffee. It was plenty to keep us filled for our long treks around the city. We did try hotel restaurant one evening when we were too tired to trek out for dinner. It was reasonably priced and the food was pretty good. You'd have a hard time eating a bad meal in Italy. There was an excellent restaurant just round the corner from the hotel,Trattoria Melo, a small family owned place. The grilled squid was delicious and the owner was quite charming. Would have definitely gone back if we had more time. The hotel had a really cool rooftop terrace with an awesome view of the city where you could sit and have a drink. It was closed for the season, but I'm sure it's a really cool place to hang in the summer. If you need to stay connected to the internet the lobby has wi-fi hotspot or for a few bucks you could use a computer located in the lobby. Additionally each room had internet connection via the television for $9, which came in handy when I had an emergency situation that I needed to take care of. The staff at the front desk provided us with a map of the city that included all the city streets making it really easy to find our way around. They were very helpful in providing directions or advice. When it was time for us to leave, they called us a cab and told us exactly how much it would cost to the train station. It cost 10€ and was worth it as it would have been quite a trek with luggage. Overall Hotel Cosmopolita is a very nice hotel for a very reasonable price, great staff, great location, clean rooms, good breakfast. I would definitely stay there again and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: GoLo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the city center (next to Piazza Venezia) Walking distance to all the attractions. I stayed there for business for one night and the staff was very helpful and gave me good recommendations in regards to what to see and where to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: lisamol
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful trip to Rome and the Hotel Cosmopolita. We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights and booked it from their website, which was the best deal I found (included 15% off if staying > 3 nights). Location: The hotel is centrally located in the heart of Rome basically across the street from the Victor Emmanuel monument/Capitol Hill directly behind Trajan's column. It is about a 10 minute walk from the Colosseum and Metro B, one block from a major bus stop (Piazza Venezia and Corso), 15 minute walk from the Spanish Steps, 5-10 minutes from the Trevi fountain and Pantheon. Room: The room is larger than other rooms we have stayed in Europe and well decorated. The beds were firm but comfortable. There is a safe in the room (you must get a key from the front desk). The bathroom is large and included a bidet. Con: The bathtub is very high and would be difficult to get in and out for older individuals. The maid service was excellent. **Note: Although shampoo/soap was provided, there was no conditioner or lotion.... so you will have to bring your own. Services: The front desk was very helpful, especially Bruno.
