They sent up a bottle of Prosecco to our room with a nice note stating happy anniversary, as I had mentioned this in an e-mail to them as the reason for our visit to Rome... very nice touch! Breakfast: Very good breakfast which consisted of both hot and cold items, coffee (excellent capuccino!), and juices. Examples of offered items include scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, various pastries and breads, cereals, meats and cheeses, and fruit. Getting there: Taxi: Cabs from the airport are approximately 40 euros. We didn't take a cab because of everything I heard/read about unscrupulous cab drivers. Train: Leonardo Express from the airport to Termini (11 euros each; leaves every 30 minutes) then Metro Line B towards Laurentina and stop at Colesseo. It is about a 10 minute walk from the Colosseum. Bus: (easiest) Take Leonardo Express as above to Termini. A number of buses go to Piazza Venezia including #40 (which we took because it is an express bus), H, and 64. The hotel is a block from the bus stop on Santa Eufemia. Look for the Glass restaurant and bar (part of hotel). Hints for Rome: 1. We used Rick Steves' Rome 2009 which more than paid for itself! I highly recommend it to everyone! 2. Buy a Roma Pass from the airport (Terminal C at the Tourist Information Desk or TI) or Termini station for 20 euros. It contains a card you can use at different sites for free admission, including the Colosseum/Roman Forum/Palatine Hill and National Museum of Rome. Also included is a 3 day Metro Pass that you can use for any bus or Metro (but not Leonardo Express). The Metro pass alone is worth 11 euros. 3. Beware of pickpockets! We used a money belt (NOT fanny pack), worn under my husband's shirt... and I used a pouch worn around my neck and placed under my top. Do not put anything of value in your pockets. 4. Wear sturdy shoes as the cobblestoned streets are very rough on your feet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Mr0wl
Reviews.Content: If you are endlessly searching for a solid hotel, you should consider Cosmopolita as a top contender. The first two nights of our trip we stayed at a hotel close to the Vatican, but switched to the Cosmopolita for the remaining five days to be in the city center. As many other reviews have noted, the location of the hotel is superb--within 10-15 minutes walking distance to Trevi Fountain, the Forum, Palatine Hill, Capitol Hill, Colloseum, and the Pantheon, and other nearby ruins. Other sights are also within walking distance, but I highlight these sights as they are among the most popular in Rome. It was wonderful to stroll nearby our hotel and see all these sites lit up at night. Conversely, if you do not want to walk, Piazza Venezia--where virtually all buses stop and taxi stands are located--is only two blocks away. During our stay, the hotel itself was solid--comfortable and exceptionally clean. The area around the hotel also felt very safe, as it is located next to a municipal building that has a constant police presence. The concierges were helpful and booked restaurant reservations for us on three occasions. We noticed throughout our stay the concierges helping guests in English, German, French and Italian. Since our flight did not leave until 2330 on our last day, the hotel accommodated our request for a late check-out (2030) so that we could shower and change after a day of sightseeing (cost 100 Euros for late check-out). Since this was just a quick get away, my boyfriend and I were looking for a good hotel (clean and comparable to a standard Hilton or Omni hotel in the US) to enjoy a leisurely paced vacation that was easily accessible to sights and/or transportation. Without saying, you will of course find a more luxurious hotel in Rome, but this is a great hotel and served all of our purposes. TIP: Arriving Hotel from Airport: Although we stayed at a different hotel upon arriving in Rome, this tip still applies. For 13 Euros, take a shuttle from the airport train station to your hotel. It's worth the money, time, and hassle since a train ticket from the airport to the Termini train station in the city costs 11 Euros and then you would have to take a cab/subway/walk to your hotel from Termini. A taxi from the airport would cost you roughly 40 Euros. Departing Hotel to Airport: Most buses located half a block from the Cosmopolita go to Termini train station (in three stops or less). The bus costs 1 Euro. From Termini, you can take the express train to the airport for 11 more Euros. We Loved: --The Scavi tour (Vatican Necroplis). Reservations required; --Riding bikes and seeing archeological sites along the Appian Way; --Our "Through Eternity Cultural Association" tour of the Colosseum, Palatine Hill, and the Forum (in our opinion, this was substantially better than our Vatican tour from Presto Tours); --Chianti Wine Bar and Restaurant near Trevi Fountain; and --That Prada (at the bottom of the Spanish Steps) was cheaper on the Euro than buying on the American market.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: travellerlondon10
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on trip advisor we were happy to book at Cosmopolita Hotel and were not disappointed. An easy trip by taxi from the airport, great location to all the sights, clean rooms, friendly staff and air conditioned (very important for coping in the August heat). We had a double and a triple room adjacent, the triple room having a larger shower, and even though we overlooked an Irish pub that was crowded and open till 3am we did not hear it once the windows were shut. We were disappointed that the roof top bar was closed but were able to buy drinks at the ground floor bar and take them up to the roof. The only thing they could improve on is at breakfast the coffee isn't that good (especially for Italy) and they don't serve toast (which our 2 year old lives on). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our Italian holiday”
Reviews.Author: OzfamilyAdelaide
Reviews.Content: After agonising over a choice of hotel and probably looking at 100 different options we stretched our budget and chose the Cosmopolita. We decided the location, airconditioning and quiet rooms were worth the extra money and along with the discount for staying extra days it was well worth it. We had 2 adjacent rooms that were very clean, spacious and comfortable. Excellent aircon and the noise with the window closed is minimal.(we were on the side street which meant we had the window open alot to get fresh air also) The Bathroom is not large but is well appointed although larger people might struggle in the small shower. The location is superb. We walked everywhere, even the Vatican which was hard work but justified all the wonderful gelatis and pizzas we ate. It was nice to be able to pop down to the Forum and the Colesseum for a stroll after dinner to view with lights. The area around felt safe and the security of the hotel was excellent. We really enjoyed the roof garden. Spending an hour or so up there in the late afternoon after a busy day was enjoyed by all, even the teenage girls. The view was good and the drinks pleasant (bar prices not cheap but then you are in Rome!) The "serenity" after the hectic pace of the streets was most welcome. Breakfast was one of the best we experienced in Europe and all the staff we encountered were excellent with most having very good English. We booked direct with the hotel and were happy with the price. We definately would stay there again and despite not being particularly interested in Rome before we went we had an excellent experience of the city and would love to go back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Jyoren
Reviews.Content: My wife, teenage daughter and me stayed at the Hotel Cosmopolita for three nights in early July 2008. We had booked a triple room and were very happy with the room given to us on the 5th Floor. The room was of good size and so was the bathroom. The cleanliness was good and the linen and towels etc were changed regularly. The reception staff was very helpful and the language was no problem . The redeeming feature of this hotel is the Location. As has been repeatedly mentioned in the other reviews, the hotel is located within easy walking distance of all major tourist attractions in Rome, except for the Vatican. Every other attraction is within an easy 10-15 minutes walk. We had asked the Hotel to send a car to pick us up at the Airport. I feel this facility was very convienient and cost 50 Euro. All in all a very enjoyable stay and we will certainly at the same Hotel on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy to major Roman attractions.”
Reviews.Author: SmithyNZ
Reviews.Content: Our family of four, including 2 late teenage boys stayed here in early July. It was very handily located to the Colloseum, Forum etc - 5-10 mins walk, and about 10-15mins to Trevi & the underwhelming Spanish Steps in the other direction. Easy to find as virtually next door to the Piazza Venezia , one of Rome's biggies. Rooms were spacious, clean. One tip - don't open window at night - very noisy from outside, but hardly hear anything with window closed. Front desk people very helpful and English is spoken. Pleasant breakfast restaurant. Handy to eateries ranging from traditional trattoria to a Scottish pub (of all things) across the road. Very nice ice creams just down the road on the edge of the major traffic intersection which was very entertaining as no traffic signals to control the hordes. Would happily stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay at this perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mane
Reviews.Content: This is our second Rome trip in 2 years and once again we stayed at the Cosmopolita hotel. Once again we booked a superior double room, but this time also an adjacent double (single use) for our grown up son. Got a good deal for this 4 star hotel with 15% discount for staying over 3 days. Worked out to 125 euro per night for each room. The hotel maintains its excellent standards and the front desk service is even better than before. Thank you all front desk staff! You were all very helpful. It makes all the difference. The excellent breakfast with bacon,eggs and sausages is exactly what we needed before a hard day of walking to & fro. Also good cappucino. The location is very central and perfect for walking to most attractions. A taxi from here to most sights is about 6-7 Euro only. Plenty of eating places nearby. Elevators to all floors. Pleasant roof garden to relax. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Air con works silently and well. Plenty of cupboard space. Abosrbent bath towels, and shampoo . Powerful shower, just what we needed at the end of a sweaty day outdoors. Booked rooms on the top floors and these were very quiet at night. Maid service was perfect and toilets immaculately clean. Safe box in room which was important for us. Security was tight with no access to the residential floors without a swipe card. There is also computer access in the lounge for 3 Euro per hour. Used it for online check in for the journey back and to check our daily email . Will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Stratt0n
Reviews.Content: The location is, as everyone says, superb. The hotel is walking distance from all the sites bar the Vatican. The staff were helpful, the breakfast was good, the rooftop bar was pleasant if a little pricey. The room was clean and was pleasant enough but with few frills - but this is to a certain extent reflected in the price. Overall I'd recommend the hotel for the location if nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lmurakhovsky
Reviews.Content: We're a family of three, my husband, myself and our 18 year-old daughter. We booked a tripple room for 4 nights at the Cosmopolita. The room was large and very clean. We did find the bathroom to be small and there was only one small armoire in the room to hang up our clothes; however, we didn't find these to be an inconvinience. Our room #308 was in a very quiet location and we did have a view when we looked "up" from the window. The weather was great and it was nice to sleep with the windows wide open and just the wooden shutters closed. The staff was courtious and helpful. The rooftop bar was a great place to sit and relax, have a drink and take in the sites. The best part about the hotel was the location. In just about 10 to 15 minutes(or less)you were where you wanted to be. We saved alot of money on public transportation, because we walked everywhere. The only time we did not walk was when we visited the Vatican, but it is a doable walk if the weather is nice. Breakfast was included, and it was very good. We had a light lunch at the hotel only on the first day we arrived. Within minutes there are so many wonderful places to eat ( especially in the Roman Ghetto). However, the several Cafes across the way are very overpriced and not that great, so try to aviod them. When I return to Rome, I would not hesitate to stay at the Cosmopolita again. It was exactly what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Small but well formed”
Reviews.Author: Joshsdad
Reviews.Content: We (4 adults) stayed at the Cosmopolita Hotel for 4 nights and we very happy with this small but well formed hotel. We arrived on April 30th and left May 4th. Having booked the hotel seperately from the flights, we decided to book, via the hotel directly, their mini-coach from the airport rather than try to find the hotel through trains/buses/walking. It cost 70E but is well worth it, especially if there are a few of you. Hotel reception is very clean and the staff very helpful. We arrived at about 11.30am. One of our 2 rooms was ready for us but they rushed the 2nd room through while we had a drink at the (expensive) bar which meant a quick turn around before starting to explore Rome. The rooms are quite small, but as with any major city, it is unlikely you will need to spend much time in there. Rooms are cleaned daily, are reasonably comfortable and the new sound proof windows certainly shut out the sound of the traffic from the main road outside. The bathroom is alos quiter small, especially the shower but again, it suits its needs. The breakfast is very good. Whilst it's not a traditional english breakfast, the buffet style on offer is very good, and just what is required before a hard day walking the streets. There was no English tea available but the Italians sure know how to make a good Cappucino for that initial caffine rush. The roof top terrace is a great place to see over the roof tops of Rome, and to see where many of the tourist attractions are in relation to each other and the hotel. Be warned, the bar on the terrace does not open until May 5th (a shame as we had fantastic sunshine all the time we were there). You therefore need to either buy drinks from the hotel bar (£££) and take them up to the roof, or buy from outside and take your own up. The bar staff are very helpful and most speak good English. The Bar itself is on the main street and is open to anybody for drinks and food/bar snacks. One thing i would mention is the hotel security. Whilst we never felt unsafe, we ropped the safety diposit box keys with the morning receptionist, and picked them back up from another person who had never seen us before - without him even asking for a name, passport or signature. Also, the security sliding door to get to the lift (your room key is meant to open it - was more often than not open and therefore accessible to anyone. As i said, we did not feel unsafe but be aware and mention it to the head receptionist if you are concerned. We also organised the mini-coach back to the airport and it arrived at the hotel in plenty of time. There is baggage storage if you have to leave later in the day. All in all a very nice little hotel and we will certainly use it again if and when we return to Rome - which is a beatiful city but you must use the open top bus tour early in your visit, to see where you want to go and plan a suitable route. Food there is quite cheap but drinks are not so be warned.

Reviews.Title: “great location - and rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: JeffCarter
Reviews.Content: booked through www.europeandestinations.com This hotel was very nice and the staff very friendly and cooperative. we were walking distance to the coliseum and roman forum and many just about any other place of interest. The rooms were small but very clean and updated. The wireless internet worked fine, and we took the laptop to the rooftop terrance every night to chat with family back in the usa. A bottle of wine on the rooftop to close out the day and reflect on the experiences was very cool. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends, and would return if we ever get back to rome. Our group used 3 rooms, and all 3 rooms were comparable. Sorry i dont seem to have any photos of the rooms. The included breakfast was very good and we got meet many other travelers and share ideas.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: TAD83
Reviews.Content: After a lengthy search for a hotel in Rome it was defintiely the reviews from Trip Advisor that made our minds up for us. The Cosmopolita was a great choice. Hotel was in a fantastic location, literally minutes away from the Trevi fountain and Piazza Venezia. Rooms were clean and modern, cleaned every day with clean towels and toiletries. Most reviews seemed to focus on the size of the bathroom ?? it had a shower, toilet, sink & mirror, what more do you need ??? It was spotlessly clean and in my opinion that's more important than a huge dirty bathroom !! Staff were friendly, breakfast was good. lots of choice and fab coffee! The Glass bar and restaurant which is attached to the hotel (its where you have breakfast) is really nice with good snacks and window seats for good people watching. The big parliament building around the corner from the hotel (approx 2 mins) has tour bus stops. I recommend the bright green one which runs every 15 minutes. We bought a 48 hour ticket for 23 euros, best thing we did. It gives you a chance to see where everything is so you can plan your routes, then get on and off at whichever stop you want. There's lots of walking when you get to an actual place of interest without killing yourself walking to it ! You get to see so much more on the bus and if the weather is good, so much the better. Would advise a guide at the Vatican, you whizz past the 2 hour queues and get a detailed explanation which means so much more once you see the Cistine Chapel. Ladies, keep the shoulders covered and anything else that shouldn't be on show or you won't get to see this magnificent work of art. Would defnitely stay here again and have already recommended it to a colleague.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: DR_UK79
Reviews.Content: I booked this through Expedia at fairly short notice and recieved three nights for the price of two which was a bonus. I had forgotten to take the option of a transfer when we booked but took the hotels address and map (from their website) and the taxi driver found it without any problems. We checked in with ease around 1pm and our room was ready for us. The room was larger than I had anticipated. The pictures I had seen may have been of other rooms but any concerns I had over the general sizes of hotel rooms in Rome were satisfied. Everything in the room was fine and in excellent condition. The only problem we found was that our "double bed" was actually two singles made up into a double. After a terrible first nights sleep I put it down to not being used to a smaller and harder bed and did not complain... With hindsight, I wish I had as it was awful and stopped me from getting any decent sleep! The hotel itself was very nice. The roof terrace is superb too. The roof bar wasn't open at this time of year but we were free to take drinks from the bar up, cocktails whilst watching Rome go by in the evenings were good! We ate at the hotel restaurant on our first night and this was also very good. The restaurant has a very stylish and contemporary feel to it and the food was excellent (try the Roman style veal.) The other good thing we found with the hotel was its location. It is literally 3-5 minutes walk from the Colosseum and approx 5-8 mins from the Trevi Fountain. I would happily recommend this to anyone looking for a medium level hotel and I expect to stay there again when we next visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: queenofmaps
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise this hotel enough. The location could not have been better, equal distance between the Forum, Trevi Fountain and Piazza Navona, Pantheon. There is a bus just outside to take you to the Vatican for 1 Euro. The hotel itself was excellent. We had a room right on the corner so it was smaller than the rest of the rooms but that didn't matter in the slightest. Bathroom was spotless. The staff were very pleasant, helpful and knowledgable. We booked ourselves on the hotel shuttle minibus to the airport on the way back but because it was delayed in traffic by 10 mins they got us a mercedes taxi to whizz us there pronto at no extra cost, although we were way ahead of schedule anyway. Breakfast was very good and, as another reviewer pointed out, they do like to play Michael Jackson's Thriller alot in the morning (but not so loud as to disturb your breakfast!). I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbono001
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and accomodating. Hotel is very modern and clean. Only 1 elevator but very neccessary because the stairs are spiral and tight. Italian breakfasts aren't very good in general but the buffet (on 2nd floor) was ok. GREAT location; 1 block from the forum and walking distance to everything else! I would reccommend this hotel to people who aren't travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: David-Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: In terms of quality for the price, this was as good as we could hope for in Rome. For tourists, this also has to be just about the ideal location, which is a major factor if you want to tackle all the sights. We'd read a lot of contrasting reviews of hotels in Rome but we had absolutely no complaints here. Great staff, really nice touches, comfy and quiet room. Some previous reviewers weren't too happy with their "standard" room, so we decided to pay the little extra for the upgrade. No idea what the other rooms were like but for all the difference it made to the bill, we were glad we did. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CityGirlMidlands
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband went to the Cosmopolita for 3 nights at the end of January to celebrate my birthday. The hotel is in a great location all the major sights are within a 10 to 15 minute walk except the Vatican which we got a bus too. We booked a superior double which was at the back of the hotel, a good size with a large bathroom and very quiet. On returning to our room on my birthday we had been left champagne and nibbles which was a very pleasant surprise. The breakfast buffet is nice and varied. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: mschanel
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel - It is in the best position - this was our first time in Rome and we literally walked everywhere! 5 min to Coloseum, 5 Min to Forum, 10 min to Trevi Fountain and 15 min to spanish steps and patheon! Great restaurants nearby, breakfast was included at a gorgeous room in the hotel - all very modern, yes the room was small and bathroom very small but thats europe! The room was very clean, we always felt very safe, all the designer boutiques were about 15 min walk away and we could have walked to the vatican ( about 30 mins) but were too tired and got taxi! We arrived at 8am and our room was ready at 10am! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing--everything a beat off at Cosmopolitana”
Reviews.Author: Bookishbabe
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with our five nights at this hotel. Everything seemed just a beat off. With better management, this could be a great spot, but we won't stay there again or recommend it to friends. First, the good points: The location is superb. It is walking distance to the Forum, Collesseum, Palantine, and Pantheon, and there is a bus just across the street to the Vatican and other sights. The restaurant was also superb. We had a very good dinner there one night, and the breakfasts, while not superlative, were good. But, the rooms were uncomfortable and loud, the elevator, toilet and internet was broken, and the desk clerks were either rude, overwhelmed, or both (with one exception...I wish I could remember the name of the one desk clerk who was friendly and professional). Our first room in this hotel was tiny, which was a disappointment, in view of the other reviewers here who have had good sized rooms. My advice: Don't stay here if you book the less expensive "standard" room. They are small and loud and not worth the money. The first night we were in a tiny room with a tiny bath. Part of the room next door jutted into our room, which, we were to discover, contained the bathroom of the area next door. When those guests took showers, the roar in our room from the plumbing was so loud that it actually drowned out the sound from the television. It was unbelievable and unacceptable and we asked to be moved to a new room the next morning. The hotel was very accommodating and moved our things to a new room while we were out sight-seeing. Unfortunately, this room was even smaller with an even tinier bathroom. The toilet in this room did not work, but was fixed the next day. The shower was so small we had trouble getting into it, and it was hard on knees and elbows. The room was very thin-walled and we could hear every word from the people next door. (Unfortunately, they were not very interesting conversationalists.) We needed the internet to do some business and to make reservations for the next phase of our trip, but the internet in our room (and this section of the hotel, we were told) was not working. Unlike many modern hotels, this one does not have a publice internet station. We had to borrow the hotel's laptop (they waived the customary charge), but getting access to the laptop is hit and miss, because they have only one laptop and apparently only one member of the staff who knows the password! I had to sit in the lobby for an hour doing my work. Not a big deal, but it would have been more comfortable from the room. The worst aspect of our stay was when the elevator broke. It was broken for two days. We did not enjoy climbing the five flights of stairs to our room, although we did meet several friendly guests while catching our breath on the landings. The staff also was generally unfriendly and unprofessional, except for one desk clerk and the restaurant staff, which was great. The bar staff seemed to love Michael Jackson's "Thriller," as they played it at very high volume several mornings at breakfast. All in all, this hotel has potential, but seems to need the hand of a good manager.

Reviews.Title: “Location was key to selecting the Cosmopolita”
Reviews.Author: Travelingal15644
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for only one night until our apartment on Via Giulia was ready. We decided to book something on the "other side" of town so that we could spend the day concentrating on that section of Rome. The location to explore the Forum/Palatine/Colosseo area is perfect. Lovely view from rooftop. Taxi stand right across the street - Metro at Colosseo. Common areas are very nice and room was very clean, bed great. Hairdryer, soaps, and shampoo are provided. The bathroom was a little small, but for one night - was just fine. Supposedly the larger rooms have bigger bathrooms. Breakfast was decent except for the self-serve cappucini. They also have a lovely restaurant, but we did not have the opportunity to try it this time. Staff was very pleasant and helpful and provided us with walking maps. I would definitely stay again for a short stay - not sure we would spend more than 3 or 4 nights only because we prefer other sections of Rome - nothing to do with the hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a first-timer in Roma”
Reviews.Author: ps923
Reviews.Content: Simply put, the location of the Cosmopolita Hotel is spot on! Its quiet side-street gives little away of the wonders situated just a beat behind the imposing Vittoria Emmanuelle monument. My fiancé and I were fortunate to have a large comfortable room situated on a corner plot of the top floor with a clean bathroom and tea/coffee facilities(!). Incidently, the (unmarked) button in the shower should not be pressed unless in an emergency. Curiousity got the better of me and within moments, a staff member was knocking on the door as I'd triggered the safety alarm! - I know, lesson now taught! We were celebrating my brother-in-law's birthday and a bottle of sparkling was brought up to him when we were settled in our rooms - a nice touch. We took said bubbly up to the top floor (empty) bar terrace and had a simply stunning albeit chilly toast overlooking the capital - magic! Breakfast was as per previous comments mostly and certainly prepared us for walking our socks off before we set out in the morning. Although I'm not sure how eager I would have been for the same breakfast if I had stayed for much longer. The umbrella vendors which pop up outside the hotel the moment it started to rain were particularly in demand (cheap and yet one of them is still in use back home!) I personally felt the price of this hotel was very reasonable for such a central location. I'd struggle to find somewhere of a similar standard for price where I live. I was simply dismayed to be leaving after only three days in this magnificent city - we'd barely scratched the surface... My only advice: Forget the expense, immerse yourself in the Roman way and enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the location (and it's worth it).”
Reviews.Author: Agile_Lapin
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. In the center of everything there is to see, with the exception of the Vatican and it is on the main bus line to the Vatican so that's not a problem. There's nothing wrong with the rooms, I just expected more for the price I paid. They are more modern than most in this area of Rome. The staff was pleasant, the breakfast was ok. This was the only hotel I stayed at this trip where the wi fi was not free, I was disappointed in that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: caroline_little
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolita hotel is located right in the centre of Ancient Rome. The Trevi is a 5min walk from the hotel and the Coliseum and Forum are 10 mins walk. It is the perfect location for sightseeing. The room and bathroom are small but very clean and the location more than makes up for this. Each room has A/C, TV and mini bar in the room. Breakfast is continental and is very good. A trip to the roof garden is a must; the view is amazing of St Peter's and the Victor Emmanuel II monument.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off.!”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Rover_07
Reviews.Content: Firstly I booked this hotel on the basis of the reviews I read on Trip Advisor. I was terribly disappointed with it. It's just so basic for the money that it costs. We had previously stayed in a budget hotel in Pisa and in my opinion that was more value for money. As this was our honeymoon we wanted to splash out. Big Mistake. There are only a couple of positives about this hotel. The location is super so if you're coming to Rome for a couple of nights it's a great location to be able to get around this city in a short period of time. The breakfasts were good except by Day 5 we were thoroughly bored of the selection. The porters were super and extremely pleasant and helpful in comparison to the reception staff who were inconsistent. In fact our family had tried to arrange for a bottle of champagne sent to our room, that took 3 days for them to organise. Our major issue occurred with the hotel when we were departing. Our credit card wouldn't work. We couldn't understand this as we knew there was money in the account. What we didn't know though was that during our stay the hotel had attempted on a number of occasions to take large sums of money off our credit card without our knowledge. We only found this out on our return when our credit card company telephoned us and informed us that they had blocked our card because attempts had been made by the hotel to take large amounts of cash out of our account. Amounts, in fact, which we didn't even owe the hotel. So this is why we were put in a really compromising position whilst trying to check out. To add to this, the reception staff said they only had 7 minutes to close the transaction so they needed to be paid within that time..... no pressure then!! We had to leave our luggage, run out onto the street to find a cash machine. This whole experience left us with a bad taste in mouth. The hotel not only was a rip off but it tried to rip off our credit card. Thankfully our credit card company were vigilant!!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bubba_Who_Now
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days in Rome for our Honeymoon and this hotel could not have been more perfect for us. It is located in HEART of Ancient Rome. Amazing sites like the Trevi Fountain, The Coliseum, The Forum are right around the corner. It's in a very safe neighborhood, in fact it's next door to the police station. I never felt threatened at any time of day or night. The room and bathroom were a little small but I think that is normal for Europe. Large, good clean towels provided every day. The bed was a queen bed, but was kind of hard for my tastes. A/C, heat, TV, wired internet (not free), mini bar in the room. Wifi (again not free) in the lobby. We had the breakfast once and it was just fine, but we never ate in the restaurant (The Glass) but people we spoke to said it was very good. There are a ton of good places to eat right round the corner, more than you can try in one trip. Last but not least, The Roof Deck! What a view!!! If the roof bar is not open, hit the store across the street and grab some Vino, ask for some glasses and watch the sun set over Rome, you shouldn't miss it!!! We loved our trip! Little Nightlife Hint: If you are looking for a real bar, not the Italian version which is more of a cafe, the Nags Head across the street is ok. Live music, ok beer selection. But if you want a great Irish Pub(not themed, owned and operated by Irish), ask for directions to The Thirsty Scholar. It's only about three blocks away from the hotel and they serve the best pint in Rome (that I could find). Also they show very sporting event world wide on about 20 flat screens. It was fun to watch the Red Sox in Rome, lol!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IvanhP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the last day of our honeymoon, after returning from a 10 day Med Cruise. Like many of the past reviews, I thought the location was perfect; Centrally located and not that bad to for money (for Rome). I room was spacious enough and clean, and a bottle of champagne was waiting for us upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locations, Rooms Okay”
Reviews.Author: mpbbarrett
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect spot in the city for sightseeing. We had easy access to everything and there was a city bus stop about 50 feet from the hotel door if you don't want to walk to Vatican City. I wouldn't say the rooms are as great as they look online. We started in one room and it had tile floors, no view and not such a great bathroom. We asked to switch and the staff was very accommodating. We moved into a bigger room, hardwood floors, bigger bathroom, with a view. The breakfast was average, nothing to really write about. If you are looking for location, this hotel is perfect for you. If you are looking for luxury, then I would rethink your options. It's standard, clean and both rooms that I was in were decent in size, especially for Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cosmopolita-fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: californiagirl55
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Hotel Cosmopolita. The location can't be beat. Close to everything! Breakfast is very nice, rooms are clean. I have stayed in a large room, medium sized room, and small room at this hotel and will say that in the small room, the bathroom is very, very small. However, just make sure that you don't get a room on the street side of the hotel(the side of the hotel, not the front). The first night of this trip, we were put into a room on the street side and I can truly say that it was one of the worst nights of my life. The noise from the traffic and the Scottish pub was horrendous!!!! It finally got quiet around 4:30 a.m. Went down to the desk around 7am and asked to have our room switched which they did . Our second room was inside the hotel with no view but it did not matter. Second room was very nice and bathroom was bigger. In fact, the shower was the best one that we experienced our entire trip. Staff at this hotel is excellent!! Very, very helpful with anything you ask.

Reviews.Title: “not so bad”
Reviews.Author: Annalisa81877
Reviews.Content: This was the begining of our trip. The room is tiny. You can't fot two people in the bathroom at once and the staff is a bit rude. The location is perfect. Not too bad...may stay again for location.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little gem”
Reviews.Author: giorgigirl
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel did not let my expectations down at all. The hotel was in a perfect location for seeing all the attractions, whch was a prime criteria for our holiday as I have difficulty with walking. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable even for three adults sharing one room!! The breakfast was of good standard, with plenty of choice. I would stay here again without any hesitation. Great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Just right for sight-seeing”
Reviews.Author: TheWallers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Cosmopolita. We had a triple room which consisted of two ajoining bedrooms and a bathroom big enough to dance in. All, a good standard of decoration and spotless. Quiet, efficient air-conditioning. A little dark as the window looked out onto internal courtyard but we've experienced that before in Italy. Good buffet breakfast...you could even have egg and bacon! Most of the reception staff were young, helpful but a little distant. The central location of the hotel made sight-seeing easy. We ate out each evening at Le Lanterne. (The locals ate there...a good sign?) The restaurant was not far from the hotel and on the way to the Trevi Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: The_Lewis
Reviews.Content: This hotel delivers efficiently what it promises. It is centrally located to the historic sites – Trevi Fountain, Forum, Coliseum and Pantheon are all within 20 minutes walk. The Forum is no more than 200 yards away. The rooms are well maintained and clean and the included breakfast is good. Security is tightly controlled with interior hallway cameras and card key access to the bedroom area. We stayed here in August 2007 and offer a few notes: -Don’t forget your roomcard when leaving the room – you need it to get access to the lobby. -The elevator is actually a roasting oven attached to the side of the building. It has almost no ventilation and heats up directly in the summer sun. -The television has one English channel. But did you really come to Rome to watch TV? -Do visit the rooftop lounge after a long day of sightseeing. There is a nice breeze and you can watch the sun set over Rome. -We had 3 rooms – one of which had the miniature showers discussed on these pages. So guess that it is luck of the draw. The other two showers were a good size. I would recommend this to any tourist looking for a hotel close to the major historic sites.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with A/C was a big problem”
Reviews.Author: pnl102
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days during a heat wave in Rome and found the the Air conditioning system was defective for our floor. This persisted for Sunday and Monday. The hotel said that they had called for a repair person when we complained. We had high expectations for this hotel based on other Trip Adviser ratings. The problem with the A/C and the hotel staff's rather indifferent response to our complaints about it were a big problem with our stay. For example, they could have offered us a discounted meal or free dinner in their hotel restaurant. Since we had made the reservations throught a travel agent, they said that they couldn't make a partial refund when I asked for it. When I returned to the US, I notified our travel agent who credited us with a larger partial refund that I requested.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ExecPlat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in July upon a recommendation from a friend. It was a great location, in walking distance from almost all the major attractions. The hotels breakfast was good, a large spread for all tastes. The hotel offers a shuttle to and from the airport for 12 Euro per person, which is much cheaper than taking a cab. We did not know about this service and paid 60 Euro cab ride to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to everything”
Reviews.Author: cfgoesaway
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself, is situated on a triangle like corner, just off a big piazza, in front of the wedding cake building. Which is not to be missed, by the way. The restaurant/bar called The Glass, is one of the most modern, with alternating colored lights outside, real good air conditioning, and makes real cocktails. Happy hour(from 5:30 on) gets you free little sandwiches with your drinks. And check out the roof top bar and seating area, it's pretty up there! Our room was on the 3rd floor. They are not huge, but bigger than I expected. The bathroom is small, but definitely adequate. Beds were comfortable. Ask for your room safe key on arrival, and you can lock up your passport and extra money in it. The TV gets some english channels - mostly news, you can buy access to movies, but it will cost you! The mini bar had extra room in it, so we bought some beer and sodas, and kept them in there staying cold! The breakfast was good, with some real doughnuts! And eggs, bacon, meat, cheese, juice, Amerian coffee, expresso and the like. A cab stand is around the corner, so if you need one, they are there in 5 min. We took one TO the Vatican, but found we could walk back with very little effort. There is a couple souviner shops across the street, and just down a bit (in the main square) there are several ATM's, one takes cirrus, and one Plus(one of our cards needed one, and one the other.) You can walk the main street straight down (Emmanule), and veer off to the left for Campo de Fiori (my favorite), or the right for The Pantheon and Trevi fountain. Actually hard to get lost from this location. Anyway, if you couldn't tell, we really enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmcintosh
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was very clean and well appointed. The rooms were small for American standards, but not bad at all for European standards. The bathroom was definately on the small side. This hotel is in a terrific location and is withing walking distance of practically everything. We actually ended up walking to the Vatican from here. It was a long, unintended walk, but we went to the Campo D'Fiori first, spent time there, and then ended up walking the rest of the way to the Vatican. We were very close to every thing else. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. They were very helpful with dinner reservations as well. The breakfast was certainly decent; many choices of hot and cold items. The hotel also had a nice lounge which was great for a night cap. We would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great Cosmopolita”
Reviews.Author: KIR215
Reviews.Content: Just spent 6 days in mid July at the Hotel Cosmopolita . Great little hotel & location; easy walk to the Forum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain etc. Our room was immaculate & perfect for the 2 of us. The double pane windows & soundproofing eliminated virtually all outside & adjoining room noise. The shower stall was somewhat small but who's complaining. It was still adequate & gives you some funny stories to tell. Breakfast buffet was very good. Don't forget the roof garden for a glass of port in the evening. It was never crowded while we were there so it's like your own private place. Last but not least the staff people were always helpful, courteous & professional. I highly recommend the Cosmopolita & will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: Turkey06
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in one of the best locations in Rome and we had a great holiday however the reviews made my expectations quite high for this hotel and I was a bit disappointed. The beds were very uncomfortable and we did not have a good nights sleep for the whole 6 nights of our stay - very hard beds which gave you a sore back first thing - not good when there was a lot of walking ahead each day. There were no hand towels!??? and only 2 bath towels. We had paid for a superior deluxe room and did not find it to be any different. No robes or slippers in the room as someone said and furniture could have been dusted more often, TV didn't work for first 2 days then came on. There was a lack of personal touch. The breakfast was OK, ham and cheese, yoghurts, scrambled egg and bacon, some bread and selection of sweets, cereal but no toast - nothing special. The blood orange juice was nice. The toilet and shower room was OK but had a step up to it and was a bit small although the room was large shower was managable. Not all staff spoke good english (as suggested) which made it difficult when we tried to get info on a tour - we gave up. Overall the location was worth staying in this hotel (trevi 5 mins but always really busy esp at night, 10 mins to Pantheon, 15 mins to Colleseum, 5 mins to Capitoline Hill, 20 to Aventine (worth going to the park near here and looking through the keyhole at the top for view of St Peter's dome). I would suggest a taxi to Vatican which cost 7 euros and worth it in the heat as once there there is a lot of walking in the vatican museums. I would book somewhere else if I went back, maybe near the Pantheon which was a great place for a meal at night and still central and somewhere with more comfy beds as this became annoying. We went to roof top terrace (open from 5 pm) once and no one was there which was the same with the glass bar at night time which was often empty. However Rome (which was very hot every day) makes up for everything and was one of the best hols ever.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it loved it loved it!”
Reviews.Author: nadnad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in July. It was lovely - everything very clean, well presented, the staff were all very nice. The room was a reasonable size - the bathroom which seems to be a sticking point with many other reviewers did not cause a problem - it was quite big and the shower we had was huge! We ate in the glass restaurant the first night and it was very nice. Breakfast was fine - enough to keep you goin most of the day! Location is fantastic I would stay here again no problems and would not hesitate to recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Cosmopolita”
Reviews.Author: McrTravellers3
Reviews.Content: Just had to write as we have just enjoyed a great three night stay at The Cosmopolita. The location as every one has said is excellent. The rooms are comfortable and although I know one floor had problems with the Air Con whilst we were there, it didn't detract from an excellent stay. The roof top bar was a great place to relax in the evening, after a days touring or following the long walk back from the Genesis concert at Circus Maximus. The restaurant was a real find. Excellent food, excellent price. For those who complain about the bathroom size - welcome too europe! I must admit that I spend my time visiting the city, not the smallest room ( to coin a phrase) Would recommend this hotel and will def be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel / Perfect Location - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: coloradosota
Reviews.Content: This quaint hotel is on a quiet street with wonderful staff. Bathrooms were a little tight, but it was a single room so maybe the doubles are a little bigger. Everything was wonderful and we were in walking distance to just about everything in ancient Rome. I'm going back!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Mark_WGC
Reviews.Content: This is ideally placed for your trip in the City. The Forum 5 mins Trevi Fountation 10 mins Pantheon 15 mins (+3 for Piazza Navona) Colosseum 15 mins Tiber Island 15-20 mins (lovely at dusk!) Right, that's got out of the way!!!! It is just off of Piazza Venezia where you can catch tour buses regularly. Our tip would be to go for one that does 24 hour tickets and get it about noon then a. use it as a tour then b. for the rest of the time that day and the next as transport. We used the Christian tour (for price and route). Not the best commentary but stops at all the places. I contacted this hotel via e-mail constantly before visiting and the person that responded was very courteous and helpful. She helped me arrange a limo to pick us up from the airport (50 Euros) and a chilled bottle of wine in the room on arrival. The staff at the hotel were just as friendly, helpful and courteous. The lady behind the desk made good recommendations for the best places to eat for VFM and tips on what to look for. I booked the hotel directly via their website and got a deluxe room (on a promotion) for the same price that most online people are offering for a standard. This brings me on to the only point to raise. The rooms aren't big. Even our 'deluxe' was relatively small. But the roooms and bathroom are tidy, well looked after and well stocked. The hotel is tucked in a side alley so the views are nothing and the roof top terrace it promotes is OK but nothing special. But these points are to manage your expectations. They are NO reason NOT to use the hotel. I have seen less complimentary comments from others on this site about this hotel when I was deciding which hotel to use. I can honestly say I had no problems with staff or noise which seem to hae been the main issues for others. I would definitely recommend it. Doesn't get 5 only for the size of rooms. Final Rome tip - If you are going to buy from street vendors haggle low, keep to your price and walk away if they say no... they WILL come after you and give in! Hope your trip is as good!

Reviews.Title: “creeky floors/dark room”
Reviews.Author: MeANDmyshadow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights and felt it was pricey for the room we had. The corner shower was tiny and very hard to move around in, and I am an average sized person. The location was convenient to sight seeing. The entry door was hard to close and lock which made me feel a little apprehensive. The floors squeeked and creeked. Beds were not comfortable. We would search a lot before staying here again. None of the staff told us if we opened the outside shutters, the room wasn't so dark.

Reviews.Title: “When In Rome, do as we do....”
Reviews.Author: Klextra
Reviews.Content: When in Rome, do as we do....stay at the Hotel Cosmopolita. The location is absolutely perfect. The Hotel is just off Piazza Venizia, less than a 15 minute walk to: - Colosseum - Roman Forum - Trevi Fountain, - Campo di Fiori - Pantheon - Spanish Steps (and its Metro stop) - Shops of via Del Corso _ etc. Our room was spotless, comfortably large, hardwood floors, well-furnished with a comfortable bed, good A/C, decent size bathroom and shower. We took a deluxe room, one level up from the standard room. I heard someone on the elevator say that their standard room was a bit small. The staff were courteous and very helpful with suggestions and directions. There were several decent restaurants within a block, and even better ones a short walk away. Breakfast was good, but not great. "Make it yourself" cappuccino from a machine. Some pastries were quite good, others supermarket quality. Meats and cheeses available as well as an egg dish. Excellent fresh bread. Summary - Everything was good, and the location made it great.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sinusqueen
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is centrally located- 10 minute walk to most sites (Coloseum, Forum, the "wedding cake", Trevi fountain, etc). Very helpful staff- they arranged a transport from the airport and agreed to store our luggage until check-in since our flight arrived at 8am. We booked through the corporate website (at least 60 days before arrival) and got an upgraded package- superior double room, bottle of wine, and discounted rate. Hotel has good security, clean and quiet room, good breakfast. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Poor service”
Reviews.Author: voyageurCharleston
Reviews.Content: Our three night stay at the Cosmopolita Hotel was marred by a leaking airconditioning unit that we had to report twice, in the afternoon of our arrival and during the night at around 3 A.M. The night concierge was unhelpful. The dripping water prevented us from sleeping or resting. We were switched to another room on the second day and were told to be thankful for the "upgrade". The room was a little bigger, but bathroom tiny with toilet that did not flush. Lateral move at best. Manager was unavailable to discuss the situation. The concierge desk was aloof with the exception of a nice young woman by name of Eva who was on duty in the aftenoons. She helped us secure reservations for a tour of the Vatican Museums. We do not recommend the Cosmopolita Hotel.. Jay and Helen Jacobs Charleston, SC

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: phanie12
Reviews.Content: Its all been said. This place is the best. Perfect location for sightseeing. You're right in the middle of everything. We were able to stroll around and see a lot and then the hotel staff arranged a guided tour for the afternoon to see more finished off by a 5D attraction called Time Elevator. The staff is great and very helpful. The rooms are gorgeous, clean, comfortable and quiet. All the ammenities and the restaurant, The Glass, is superb for both breakfast and dinner. AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff, enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: jimbob10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, they upgraded us to a superior room which was a nice touch! (sent them an email in advance advising them that the trip was for our wedding anniversary) A standard room would of been too small for the 2 of us and our 13month baby. Great location as we walked everywhere with a pushchair even to the vatican which is not that far (25mins max) Stayed on the 4th floor which was very nice with laminate flooring throughout and nicely decorated. If you are staying with a child or wheelchair you may get annoyed with the 2 steps you have to navigate to get to the lift area! Breakfast was very nice in a lovely restaurant on the 1st floor, (a good selection of continental breakfast with english teabags)! Staff was very friendly and helpful and would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ursie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in June with my boyfriend. Lovely hotel, very clean, lovely bar and resturant and staff were nice. Ask for big room in advance in a quiet location of hotel. Would definatey stay here again. Very central.

Reviews.Title: “The Cosmopolita was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CarlyNewYork
Reviews.Content: We loved our 5 night stay at the Cosmopolita Hotel. The room was spacious, clean and quiet. Our room had an entry way where our luggage was kept. This gave us plenty of space in the living quarters of the room. The bathroom was an adequate size but the shower was a bit small. It was pretty warm in Rome when we were there at the beginning of June, but the air condition worked great. Our room was always cool and comfortable. The staff at the front desk were extremely pleasant and helpful. We arrived in Rome before check in time but the staff quickly put our luggage in a locked room giving us freedom to walk around Rome until our room was ready. The hotel location is fantastic. We were around the corner from the Venezia Palace where you can easily get a taxi or bus. Not that you need transportation to get to the highlights in Rome, because you are within walking distance of almost everything. The Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Colliseum and numerous fantastic restaurants are only a short walk. The Vatican, Spanish Steps and the Borghese Gallery are a little further but a 4-5 Euro cab ride will get you there within minutes. We booked the hotel through Hotels.com and paid $256 a night. This was well worth it - a Hotel in the center of Rome with great service and an extensive continental breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Cosmopolita”
Reviews.Author: Robbie_Vorhaus
Reviews.Content: My 13-year-old son and I found the Hotel Cosmopolita when we tried to book another hotel that was sold out, and we were referred here. I contacted the hotel directly and after agreeing on our dates and price, I quickly received an email with all the information and a lovely note. Every contact with the hotel from that point only got better. For 50 euros a private car was arranged to pick us up at the airport, when we arrived earlier than the check-in time, the staff did everything to get us into our room, which for our jet lagged tired body was very appreciative. Our room was small by American standards, but comfortable, well appointed, very clean, and despite a very noisy street below, very quiet, thanks to heavy windows (that thankfully open, too). The breakfast, which was included in our price, was excellent with a great selection. Couple other points: the hotel's location is amazing, perfectly central to just about everything. There is wireless in the lobby and the roof, and DSL in the room. Also, every recommendation for either food, directions or an attraction were right on the money. It would be hard thinking of a reason not to return to the Cosmopolita on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly spot in Rome”
Reviews.Author: EKKColorado
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two clean, simple but elegantly decorated rooms. Overall, the rooms were quiet, for noisy Rome, except for the afternoon that the taxis were striking in the street right outside. This did cause us some consternation because the hotel staff was unsure if we would be able to catch a taxi from the hotel directly for our train out, but it turned out to be no problem. The rooms are somewhat small for what we paid, in consideration of the rest of Italy. Breakfast is good with nice pastries, cold cuts, cheeses, fruit and breads. Coffee is from one of those Nescafe machines, so its just fair, being all powdered products. The rooftop bar is wonderful and very restful after all of the hub-bub of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for our Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Diana5241
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Hotel Cosmopolita May 11-15. I booked directly via the hotel website on a "special rate" which included champagne and a deluxe room. Let me tell you, our expectations were exceeded! We arranged transportation from/to the airport directly with the hotel which worked out very nicely. The drivers were very professional and it was one less thing to worry about. (Price was comparable, too.) The front desk is extremely helpful. They understand and speak quite a bit of english and were able to supply us with an area map and made change for large euro bills at no charge. Our room was beautiful and decorated in wonderful deep red tones. Not only were we greeted with champagne but also fluffy white robes and slippers to use during our visit (which we did use...every single night!) The bed is a bit firm and the "king" is actually two twins pushed together so sleeping in the middle was somewhat out of the question. They also provide an extra blanket in the closet which I found most helpful. (Stay away from the mini bar and snacks - horribly over priced!) As for the bathroom, yes it was small, but we did not find it bothersome. They supply the usual amenities: shampoo, conditioner, soap, cotton balls - and a hairdryer, which I was VERY happy about! The only tricky part is the shower. It's pretty small and the water alternates from hot to cold throughout the shower. Our favorite part of the room was our large window which opened onto the street below. When it's closed you cannot hear any street traffic, but when it's open it's simply lovely to watch Roman life pass you by. Two or three nights on our trip we opted to bring a bottle of wine back to our room, sit on the window ledge, and watch the world go by --- breathtaking! Lastly, breakfast was quite good. It's the usual spread of food: breads, meats, eggs, cereal, etc, but it was included in the room price and of good quality. The rooftop bar was beautiful as well and a nice stop pre-dinner to give your feet a rest. Overall, this hotel is perfect; you cannot beat it's proximity. We were able to walk everywhere - from the Coloseum to the Vatican - and liked being able to "pop back" into the hotel to change shoes, etc. We will most likely stay here again on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Chicken1212
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a city break in Rome. It is so close to the Trevi Fountain, Trajan Markets, Colosseum etc that we were able to walk to every major attraction with ease (with the exception of the Vatican, which cost us 12 euros in a taxi). The whole hotel is spotlesslessly clean, the bar and restaurant very cool and trendy (though drinks a little pricey), and the staff very helpful and friendly. We loved the buffet breakfasts, which had real freshly squeezed fruit juice, good quality cereals, ham, cheese, bacon, eggs, fresh rolls and a decent coffee/tea machine. We didn't bother with the restaurant for our evening meals, as we found some great restaurants near the Trevi Fountain that were not too expensive (about 35 euros per person for 2 courses and a bottle of wine), and offered a much wider selection on the menu than the hotel. We were a party of 3 women (workmates) and we stayed for 5 nights, but were so happy with the hotel we would have loved to stay for far longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location!”
Reviews.Author: chiefsfan100
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed 3 nights at the Cosmopolita during our stay in Rome. We were very pleased with the hotel...the room was very clean and well kept. The bathroom was a reasonable size, and while the shower was not large, it was big enough to wash up...and the shower had a door, so water didn't go everywhere. The (free) breakfast is excellent with many choices of fruit, cereal, pastries, juice and coffee drinks. The location is PERFECT. It is within a <5 minute walking distance to the Forum (the ruins) and is central to most everything else. Trevi fountain is <10 minute walk, as are most other sites. To get to the Spanish Steps, we took a quick cab (we avoided busses altogether because taxis are everywhere and relatively cheap...and there is a taxi stand just around the corner from the hotel). It was great being able to come back to the hotel after half of a day for sight seeing and being able to clean up before going out for dinner. One thing to be aware of: the hotel definitely will not let you check in early. You can drop your bags off for storage, though, and come back later. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmopolita Hotel is great”
Reviews.Author: ptkc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous. In a great location near the Forum and Trevi Fountain. We walked everywhere from here except the Vatican where we took a cab. The staff was very helpful and the room was excellent and quiet. I can't say enough about the location. We were very pleased. The breakfast was great as well... the best of all the B&B's we stayed at in Italy. We booked through Venere at 280 euros a night. Tom

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: csrighter
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend at the Hotel Cosmopolita. It was a perfect hotel to stay at for a short visit to Rome. The location is awesome - we walked everywhere (yes, St. Peter's is the longest walk, about 25-30 min, but doable). We stayed in a double superior room since we could use the extra space since we had our 9 month old with us. We arrived late but his crib was already in the room - no hassling there. Buffet breakfast was a nice touch - simple but good! Croissants and pastries were great too. All hotel staff was very kind and gracious. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance - especially on the way to the Trevi Fountain. We especially enjoyed Ristorante Rosa (?) in between the Fountain and the Pantheon. We found the Italians to be very friendly and hospitable!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: TravelWarrior
Reviews.Content: A gem of a hotel, perfectly positioned for all the sights and with super-helpful staff. Our superior room was a good size for the two of us for four days and was modern, spotlessly clean and very well furnished. Yes, as others have said, the bathrooms are a bit of a challenge, especially the small shower - I just took the soap dish off in the end! The trick with the toilet is to keep pumping the button - it suddenly seems to pick up enough pressure and off it goes. I think it's actually designed that way. Oddly enough, given that I am generally a miserable old man, we found a certain charm in these things rather than being annoyed. Probably bacause the rest was so good. Reception staff were friendly and extraordinarily helpful, all speaking perfect English, but a special mention has to go to Eva who was a real pleasure and gave us some very good restaurant recommendations hidden away within a two minute walk of the hotel. The breakfast was more than adequate and included very good cooked items. Do yourself a favour and prebook the hotel's airport shuttle. It's a great price, totally reliable, will save you getting ripped off by the taxi drivers, enduring the touts and, although it looks simple and cheap, the unneccessay discomfort of humping your bags through the train stations and their long walks. By the way, when you get back to your room exhausted after a long day's sightseeing, if you hit the satellite button on the Sky handset, and work your way through the menu until you get the channel listings, you can select any of the channels with a yellow arrow for free viewing including several English language film channels. Just hit TV to get back to the preset channels. We will most certainly stay at the Cosmopolita on our next romantic trip to Rome. By the way, a small tip totally unconnected with and not near to the hotel. On the walk from the hotel to the Collosseum there is often a pregnant gypsy woman begging with a little girl. She will push a large piece of card up against you but it will be covering her other hand going through your bags/pockets underneath. If she sees you are sufficiently distracted by the scene the little girl will also circle behind your partner and be rifling any bags. She is relying on you being gentle because she is pregnant. Don't be. Knock the card away and be noisily aggressive otherwise she will continue to push her advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Bathtraveller2
Reviews.Content: What can I say a fab time was had by me & my girlfriends when we stayed in this wonderful hotel to celebrate my birthday this year. We got a great deal by booking directly through the hotel after reading other trip adviser reviews. The staff were so helpfull & polite, fantastic local knowlegde. The rooms were all done to a very high standard-TV with sky, full european bathroom, lovely linens & towels. Bath robes & slippers supplied. Breakfast was full european serviced in delightful surroundings. The bar is very funky & the bar men good at there job. The hotel is in a gret location, no more than 15 mins walk to attractions. We'd definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel! We stay every year!”
Reviews.Author: htd111
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this hotel in 2000, have returned 3 more times, and will return in August for the 5th time. We LOVE this hotel. The location is excellent. The conversion to a hotel from an old palazzo has been very charmingly done - it still retains the essential character of the old building - beautiful wooden floors, winding marble staircases, old marble topped chests and armoires in the hallways, odd levels, nicely decorated in a sophisticated burgundy color scheme. The terrace is a wonderful escape from the city, right on the roof, sipping wine while surfing the net and savoring the spectacular view and the lush tropical plants! We like picnicking there on the unbrella tables, eating prosciutto, mozzarella, and tomatoes, and basking in the glorious heat! Best of all, we love the staff. They are friendly, warm, and welcoming. When we stayed there for the second time, we arrived with my 12 year old daughter sick. The front office manager, Bruno Pasqui, was so kind and helpful! (Do you know what it is like to be in a hotel with a sick child- every parent's nightmare!) Stefania, Alessandro, Adrian, and Chris are wonderful too! Every year now, we return because that's how much we love it. To us, it is not an impersonal, characterless hotel- it is our home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: travelbs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. They had just finished renovating the hotel when we arrived and it looks great. The breakfast is excellent and enough to keep you going for the whole morning. You can ask for the italian coffee instead of the coffee from the coffee machine. Staff were very friendly and really helpful in any way. THe rooms are a decent size and it's very clean. Location is excellent because it's only 5 minutes walk to the Trevi fountain and about 10 minutes to the Colesseum. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baker24
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cosmopolita is a great base for a sight-seeing wknd in Rome. The hotel is approx a 20 - 25 min walk from Terminii station so I would recommend catching a bus to Piazza Venezia as this is where the hotel is located. The rooms were on the small side but adequate enough seeing as we were only sleeping and showering in the rooms (and must add had a great power shower). The rooms were extremely clean and although we were only there for 3 nights the bedding and towels were changed everyday. Breakfast was served from 7.30 - 10.30 and there was a great selection. So we were always nice and full ready for the long day ahead. The restaurant also serves dinner but we never ate here or even had a look at the menu so can't comment. There is also a great bar at the hotel called the Glass Bar which served alcohol/coffees and light snacks, very modern and trendy. The hotel is in a great location as it's only 5 mins walk from Trevi Fountain where you will find a handful of shops/restaurants/pizzeria's e.t.c. Then from the Trevi it's approx a further 5 mins walk to Piazza Spagna and the Spanish Steps. The Pantheon and Piazza Navona are approx a 10 min walk from the hotel and both are great areas full of delicious restaurants. The Colloseum is located about a 15 min walk behind the hotel and the Vatican approx 25 mins walk. So a great location all round. So all in all great hotel, great location and a great trip to Rome! And one word of good advice is - take good footwear as there is plenty of walking, walking and more walking to be done!!

Reviews.Title: “location !”
Reviews.Author: Pdelis50
Reviews.Content: A very fine hotel that is near the heart of many of the attractions of Rome. Right near the Via del Corso (shopping) and within 2 minutes of Trajan's column and the Piazza Venezia (ie the wedding cake as well as near the Forum, Coliseum etc). Nice restaurant on site. Spacious clean. rooms and helpful staff, also arraingements were made to take us to the airport. Would easily stay again on another trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Most excellent stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LibrarianTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cosmopolita for a week and totally enjoyed out stay. The room had a large window that opened to let in fresh air, and the view looked down on the Via Nationale. The floors were hardwood, there were beautiful curtains on the windows, and the furnishings were quality and in keeping with the style of the hotel. The staff were wonderful and the breakfast was excellent. The rooftop garden is very nice on warm evenings, and open fairly late. The location couldn't have been better for us - out the door and to the left and you're at the heart of Ancient Rome. A few blocks in the other direction get you to the Spanish Steps or the Trevi fountain. Although the hotel has only one elevator, that never seemed to be much of a problem. Hotel Cosmopolita was a little more expensive that other hotels offered by our package, but for the quality and the location, it was more than worth it. If I would warn about anything, it is that the shower in our bath was quite small, and it might be a challenge for a very large person.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless mid range centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anna O'D
Reviews.Content: For travellers wanting a mid range centrally located hotel the Cosmopolita is the answer. It is south east of the bottom end of Via Corso, and five minutes walk from the Trevi Fountain. The hotel has recently been refurbished to a high standard. The theme is modern but not stark as some new hotels can be: both bedrooms and communal areas are filled with tasteful artwork and feature comfortable sofas. Our room was on the third floor overlooking a busy street. Although initially concerned that noise may be an issue we soon realised that the industrial strength glazing does a great job of ensuring peace and quiet. We had a very decent sized room (number 320) with wooden floors. Everything was exceptionally clean and fresh and remained so throughout our stay. Bed was very comfortable and enormous. Brand new well equipped bathroom with good lighting and a hairdryer (being female I appreciate these things - it's amazing how often I'm left towel drying my hair in the semi-darkness!). Only gripe was that the shower could have been a little more powerful, however I've experienced worse and it did the job. Breakfast is served in the newly refurbished restaurant (due to have its grand opening on the night we left) on a mezzanine level above reception/the cocktail bar. There was a good selection of all the usual continental fare. The cocktail bar and mezzanine level are glass fronted, meaning that the space is very light and airy. We enjoyed lengthy breakfasts sitting at our table watching the world go by. Despite being relatively new the cocktail bar had a buzzy atmosphere in the evenings. It serves snacks and tea (try the herbal selection - best mint tea I've ever had) during the day. Unfortunately I'm not drinking at the moment so wasn't able to sample the cocktails first hand. They looked good though... All staff with whom we came into contact were incredibly helpful and friendly. We had no problems with anyone understanding English, though being in Italy throwing in the occasional ‘per favore’ and ‘grazie’ is much appreciated! There is a roof garden at the hotel but we didn't venture up (it being February) so unfortunately can't comment. Restaurant wise go off the beaten track for the best value and tastiest food. We ate on Piazza Navona on our first day and didn't repeat the mistake. For a fantastic selection of delicious Italian fare we recommend Osteria del Sostengo. A stone's from the Pantheon on Via delle Colonnelle. Go to the North East top of the Pantheon piazza and take the road leading out (Via del Pantheon). First right and you will see a large green neon sign about 10 foot up saying 'Trattoria', pointing you down a little alley. My husband said he ate the best steak he'd ever had and the puddings were incredible (I’m quite a connoisseur in this department). In fact everything we sampled (went back twice and had full 4 courses on both occasions) was delicious. Not many tourists eat here. For those of you wanting pizza head to La Focaccia on Via della Pace 11. Quite hard to find as there isn't a sign on the door. To identify that you've got the right place look for the large pizza oven as you go in. Pizzas were amazing, we also had a very tasty antipasti. I had a -- ice cream moment at Giolitti on Via delgi Uffici del Vicario 40. Cavernous place featuring wood panelling and frosted glass. Waiters wear uniforms with gold brocade and take their ice cream very seriously. Pope John Paul II used to have regular deliveries and I'm sure he knew his ice cream!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for true Roman tourism trudging”
Reviews.Author: mrjohnsondog
Reviews.Content: Mum (late 50's) and daughter (late 30's) on whirlwind tour for 3 days..... Booked directly on their website, then rang for a discount....that worked but make sure you don't end up with an inferior room because of it (we didn't but I'm in the trade and know what to say!). Rooms are clean and spacious and decoration is modern. Noise is an issue with the laminate flooring at night with people returning after a few vinos and unfortunately there was a distinct lack of drawers and cupboard space despite the size of the room! No "door hangers" for fluffy robes and wet coats etc! odd.... but still a nice base and a lovely bar (the glass) to crash into at night when your are sight weary and in need of a good stiff drink! Walking distance to Trevi (10 minutes max), Vatican (35mins) Colosseum (15 mins max)....which give you an idea of its central location. It does not serve food in the evening at the moment so venture out and visit the local restaurants.......out of hotel, turn right, cross the road and head down the little side street opposite the hotels' corner and down a dingy street you will find restaurant abruzzo.... filled with noisy, singing joyous priests tucking into lots of vino tinto and excellent roast lamb and rosemary roasted potatoes! A sight to behold! Breakfasts are good with usual continental fayre..... don't use the coffee machine though..... ask the waitress for a capuccino / espresso and they are infinately better than the machine "pods"! Within wobbling distance home from several bars too which is good! Would stay again here. Staff friendly....

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: SCAiken
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel in Rome! I booked the Cosmopolita based on the reviews at Tripadvisor and have never been so happy with a hotel.
