The location can't be beat - 5 minutes stroll to the Forum, 10 minutes to Trevi Fountain, 15 minutes to Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Colisseum. We took a taxi to St Peter's and then walked back to the hotel after our tour. We walked to the Trevi Fountain each night after dinner and "people watched". The staff were truly nice and helpful. They answered any questions always with a smile. Breakfast was excellent. Lots of selection - cereals, fruit, sliced meats, cheese, eggs, sausage, yogurt, croissants, rolls, juices and an espresso machine that let you make your own choice of caffe, american coffee, hot chocolate or tea. I loved the fluffy robes and slippers provided! The toiletries were good quality and they offered misc. items (toothbrush etc.) if you had forgotten them. There's a mini bar in the room, a bit pricey (typical) but you could keep your own drinks cool. Yes, rooms are smaller in Europe, especially in the older sections of town, but there was plenty of closet/armoir space, a comfy bed, chair and desk. It was nice to come back at the end of the day to fresh linen and chocolates on the bedside table. The price was definately very competitive for the time of year (Christmas) and I got a "special" rate by contacting the hotel directly. I asked for a quiet, non-smoking room, queen bed, possibly with a view. The room was perfect! Looked out over a quaint courtyard. We threw the shutters open every morning. The hotel is barely off the main route but quiet as if it was in the country. There's a bar downstairs that's popular mid-morning with the local businessmen for caffe, and popular in the evening for cocktails before dinner. This trip was a surprise for my husband's 50th birthday and it could not possibly have been any more perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: NCTraveller1
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at The Cosmopolita and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is located very centrally, making it easy to get almost anywhere on foot. The breakfast room had a great "continental breakfast" which included many breads, eggs, cheeses, meats, yogurt, 'you name it'. Our standard size rooms were somewhat small, yet very clean and comfortable. The staff were extremely helpful; they gave us some wonderful recommendations for local restaurants and other attractions. Overall, we'd recommend the hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Kandrew
Reviews.Content: You could not ask for a better location. Minutes walk to all of the main attractions, Trevi Fountaion, Roman Forum, Collosseum, Pantheon, Spanish steps. We walked to the Vatican which didn't take us more tha twenty five minutes. We even walked to the Termini Station to get a bus for our return flight and that only took 30 mins.The hotel itself is excellent, polite and helpful staff. They were expecting us and our room was ready. The bedroom was a good size and the shower was definitely big enough for two people! Breakfast was great, lots to choose from including sausage egg and bacon, croissants, toast, bread rolls ham and cheese, yogurt cereal, tea, coffee and juice. The only downside is that in the rooms you can hear people walking along the corridors and talking outside your room. This is probably due to the wooden linoleum floor, they would do well to invest in a carpet! Also the traffic can be very loud and we were in a back bedroom away from the main road. However, we did not find that this kept us a wake as we were always so tired after walking around Rome all day. I definitely recommend this hotel! However, shop around for the best price because apart from the location I don't think it's worth paying the hotel's official rate, we were lucky with a third night free deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: margbren
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Got upgraded after email request. Shower small but OK. In the centre of historic area - walking distance of all sites except Vatican. Good service, friendly staff. Good breakfast. Lack of restaurant not a problem as restaurants nearby. Recommend especially Ristorante Abruzzia and Marios. Very good and memorable visit to Rome. However beware the No 64 bus - a mecca for pickpockets!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: John&Tigger
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel that is within yards of historic Rome and that is clean cheerful and value for money then stay at the Cosmopolita. The rooms and bathrooms are not luxurious but are more than adequate. The immediate surroundings of The Forum, Plaza Venezia and Via Corsa give you all the faces of Rome, yet when you are tired your room is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Very central location”
Reviews.Author: Vivienne123
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from two nights in Rome at the Cosmpolita. Our room (a triple) was very clean and comfortable and the bathroom was much better than I expected after reading previous reviews. Very clean and plenty big enough. The breakfast in particular was excellent. The hotel is in an ideal location if you want to walk to all of the sights. We walked to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and the Spanish Steps. The Vatican was the furthest we walked at approx 25 - 30 minutes. - A very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good base”
Reviews.Author: MRTL
Reviews.Content: Like previous reviewers, I agree that the hotel has a great location for visiting the main sites even the Vatican. Room was a superior double and was comfortable although the beds are a bit on the hard side. Overall a bit pricey for what it was. Not sure about the escape routes in a fire which was a concern given there was construction going on downstairs. Seemed to be only one staircase and this was small and in the centre of the building. However on the plus side, the hotel is clean and the breakfast is more than adequate. Would recommend but would not be over enthusiastic about it either.

Reviews.Title: “Generally nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdimitri
Reviews.Content: Generally the hotel is nice. The best thing about the hotel is its location. Very central and everything in walking distance. Even the vatican is in walking distance. People working there are nice and helpfull. The rooms are nice but i can´t say they are that clean. If you look under the bed and corners you will see a lot of dust. Also two times the cleaning lady forgot to give us toilet paper but aftert complaining at the front desk everything was ok. Another minus of this hotel is that the corridors are made from laminate and not carpet. So when you are in your room you can hear everyone passing. That is really a problem especially in the evenings. Breakfast was ok and the view really nice from the fifth floor where the breakfast took place. Generally the rooms are large (we had double superior), small bathrooms though. For Rome i think this hotel is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dummy123
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Great location; within walking distance to all the main attractions. Requested a quiet and big room and got one of the bigger room on the top floor, next to the restaurant. Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Walk Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: eurosandy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. It's in a great location - walking distance to ALL the sights. I was with my 65 year old mother and she was just fine walking to the attractions. We even walked home from the Vatican (less than 10 Euro cab-ride on the way there...). There's a fabulous restaurant just around the corner (Le Lanterne?). The hotel staff is incredibly friendly and the hotel itself is spotless-clean. The breakfast was better than average - including (slightly runny) scrambled eggs. The only issue we had was that the cleaning staff didn't seem to understand the "do not disturb" sign. No matter what we did, they didn't seem to get that we didn't want them to clean our room. I heard someone else down the hall arguing with a staff member about this very same issue - so if you are particular about your privacy, maybe choose a different hotel. Very pleased with my stay in Rome - a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: stoshsmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a grat spot in Rome! We walked around the block and were in the Forum! Our backyard was the "wedding cake" monument - to the victory of Emmanuel, I think. We walked to the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain very easily. The Coloseum was about 7 blocks down the road; we could see it as we turned the corner to go into our hotel. The staff was nice, helpful in both English and Italian. The shower was very small - my husband needed help if he dropped the soap. The bed was hard. The room was kept very clean. The breakfast was pretty complete - even hot dogs! But it was a great experience - you don't go to Rome to spend your day in the hotel room

Reviews.Title: “Classy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lucykitkat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 wonderful nights which I bought on hotelclub.com (all I could get at the time) at a terrific rate. Cosmopolita spoilt us for anything else particularly when staying around the corner at the Pace Hotel.The rooms at the Cosmopolita were cool, clean and with timber floors and nicely decorated which was like an oasis coming in from the busy streets of Rome. Both hotels had rooftop gardens but Cosmopolita had bar service which Pace did not. Pace hotel is tired and the rooms are fairly shabby. Pace certainly did not keep up with the pace particularly when both hotels cost the same money!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Monica A
Reviews.Content: There was some construction going on in the hotel when we arrived but they were surprising quiet. The staff were most helpful with directions and other concerns we had. Rooms are on the small size with no views and small showers. Location is terrific if you want to be close to the Coliseum, ruins, Trevi and about a 15-20 minute walk to Pantheon. Rome is extremely busy and there is a lot of road construction. This was the last city we were in, after Venice and Florence, and it was the most spread out with a tremendous amount of walking. However taxi's are plentiful and not too expensive. If we did this again, I would chose a hotel with larger rooms, more views, and a tub as we really needed to relax after the walking or put Rome first on your itinerary when you have the energy.

Reviews.Title: “Smart and convenient”
Reviews.Author: BigBlueOcean
Reviews.Content: I can wholeheartedly recommend this wonderful hotel. It's smart and very clean with plenty of character. The location couldn't be better since it's right in the middle of all the main attractions. Trevi Fountain is just 5mins away, a bit further takes you to the Spanish Steps or the Pantheon. Go in the opposite direction and you can visit the Roman Forum and Colloseum in a leisurely stroll. The Vatican is a good 20-30min walk, but there is a bus and I think the metro can get you thereabouts. The hotel is situated between two very busy streets that you need to cross each time you leave the hotel on foot, but this is common in Rome, and there are plenty of crossing points. A small price to pay for being so near to everything. Once inside the hotel you don't even notice the traffic rumbling by outside, even the rooftop terrace is peaceful. This itself is like an oasis of tranquility! From 5pm each day you can choose snacks and drinks from the bar including some really good cocktails and the best coffee we had anywhere. The friendly barman knows how to make fantastic Cafe Latte and cocktails that's for sure! A great place to retreat to after a hectic day of sightseeing. Not a bad view either! The reception staff were also very welcoming, and room maids and porters were polite and cheerful. Breakfast was included in our room rate and was of good quality with plenty of choice. We particularly liked the very tasty fresh quoissants.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: SeptWeddingday
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married in Rome on Sept 15th. We stayed at Hotel Cosmopolita from 13th to 16th Sept and then returned from honeymoon for a one night stay on 28th Sept. We found the staff to me so accomodating. They helped us with everything from finding a hairdresser to the best restaurants in the local area. When we arrived back in Rome for our last night they welcomed us back like old friends and made us feel so welcome. The hotel is undergoing renovation with a new restaurant being built but we were not disturbed by any noise. The roof garden bar is wonderful for a nightcap. Our room was quite spacious, as was the bathroom so no complaints there. The location is fantastic for sightseeing. The only thing missing was a mirror in the bedroom. It was a little difficult for a bride and groom to get ready with only one mirror in the bathroom! Breakfast was fine with a good variety of fruit, cereal and breads along with bacon and scrambled eggs. Although this hotel wasn't cheap the standard was good compared to other hotels in European cities and I am happy to pay a little extra to have wonderful service like this. Thanks to all the staff who made made our stay at the the Cosmopolita so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deste
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews for this hotel and so chose this hotel based on them. It was not a bargain - I don't think that exists in Rome! However, I got a clean, smart, central hotel which was very quiet and had some nice staff. We encountered a couple of less than friendly staff members but the rest of them made up for this. We had superior rooms which were large and airy. Did experience difficulties getting into the shower - it had to be approached sideways! Hhowever my mums room had a much bigger shower so I guess it was just luck of the draw. I would stay here again because I know how hard it can be to find a half decent central hotel and I am glad we forked out the money we did. I had no problems with no noise or room size and was very happy with our choice

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rich23
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at this great hotel. The staff are first rate, especially Alessandro on reception, and can't do enough to help. The location can't be beaten. You are within 10 minutes walking distance of all Rome's major sights bar the Vatican which is probably 20-25 minutes away but the walk is well worthwhile. It was my wife's 40th birthday which I never mentioned to the hotel. When we returned to the hotel that evening they'd laid out a bottle of champagne and a letter for her to wish her Happy Birthday. They'd realised when we had checked in. That attention to detail sums the hotel up. Also the breakfast is great and sets you up well for the rest of the day. If you're thinking of going to Rome I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A plece where you would really like to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dacul
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the end of August for 5 nights. Staff was very friendly (and even offered to contact Alitalia in order to recover our lost luggage) giving whatever information we asked for. Very clean and really nice decorated room and a nice bathroom. We had a standard room (w/ a king bed). What we already knew was the small size of the room and the small shower but this is how most hotels are in Rome and generally in Europe. Room was cleaned daily and all towels and bed sheets also changed daily. The A/C was so strong that we had to increase its temperature and even to stop it over the night (although on August the outside temparature was not higher than 28C). Room was quiet and only occasionally we heard tourists from other rooms. The roof-top terrace is nice but honestly there is no breath-taking view because mostly you can see are only other roofs. The included breakfast is OK the only problem we had was in the first morning arriving 10 minutes before closing when we did not find too much left. They also have several times a day a shuttle to airport that we used being only 12 euros per person. Location is the best. All it is in Historical Center you just have to walk to see. 10 min to Colloseum, 25 min to Vatican, 15 min to Spannish Steps and 5 min to Il Gesu. Definitely we would stay there again if visiting Rome again. Unfortunately the only thing that affected our Rome holiday was Alitalia who lost in Milan our luggage and brought to us after 5 days. Hotel staff told us that this is a rule and there is no way to see it sooner than 4 days and this is not an exception, this is what Alitalia does all the time. So if you don't want to ruin your vacation do not use Alitalia unless there is a direct flight to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Cosmopolita!”
Reviews.Author: whiskeyman510
Reviews.Content: Stay here! If you want a smaller hotel with friendly faces, lots of charm, great prices for ammenities (like pay movies for just a few baucks) then this is your place! Sure the rooms are small, the double bed is 2 twins made up together, and the shower about 2 foot square. However, with a the great location (steps away from The Vittoriano, Coluseum and The Roman Forum) very inexpensive services, a great city view from the rooftop bar, an outstanding complimentary breakfast and very friendly service, you can overlook the negatives, especially as they hold true for most European hotels anyway. Do yourself a big favor and stay here. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Vacationman2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Cosmoplita for 4 nights and was very impressed with the service, rooms and, most of all, the location. All the attractions and main shops are a 10 minute walk away. Only negative point is the hotel does not provide an iron but instead, have an ironing service. 4 euros for a shirt and 6 euros for trousers. Could get quite pricey by the end of the break!! Spent most evenings either at Plaza Novana or near Pantheon - very pleasant. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Azulann
Reviews.Content: We (eight women) stayed in four rooms for five nights. The Cosmopalita is in a prefect location. It is three blocks to the Roman forum, a short walk to Trevi and lots of great sidewalk cafes nearby. The standard rooms were very nice (small by American standards) hardwood floors, tile and large windows that open, beds comfortable, good hot water in shower, hairdyer, and best of all good airconditioning. It was 99 degrees our last day in Rome. The roof top bar was a great place to watch the sunset and have a drink after a long day of walking. The breakfast buffet each morning was full of variety and included eggs and meats. The best feature of this small hotel was the staff: William, Alexandro, Adrian etc. They helped with dinner reservations at Mario's and Le Lantern. They gave us directions for driving out of Rome after we picked up our rental cars. I would high recommend staying here for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautyful hotel in top location”
Reviews.Author: dita2221
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Hotel Cosmopolita for almost a week and found it top. Staff is very friendly, our room was clean and fortunatly not facing the main street so that it also was very quiet. We never stayed in any hotel in a big city where we didn´t need either tram nor metro nor taxi. All attractions in walking distance between 5 to 30 minutes (vatican). Piazza Venezia round the corner is a fantastic point to start your tour in the morning. All buses stop in front of the hotel if someone doesn´t like to walk. But in my opinion walking is the best method to explore a city. The showers in the rooms are indeed small but it didn´t bother us. Breakfast is nice for Italian habits but a little boring after 6 days (only the same ham every morning and no salami, mortadella etc.) - this is our only small complaint. Not to forget the fantastic roof terrace with a fantastic few - even to St. Peters. Snacks and drinks are served here. We definitely do reccomend this hotel and will certainly stay there again on our next trip to this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Rome weekend”
Reviews.Author: Postcorner
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews we picked this hotel for its location with some reservations about the rooms and the hotel itself. Well, all I can say is that the hotel is just superb, hard to believe it is only a 2 star? I guess that is because is doesn't have a restaraunt but the breakfast dining area is large enough and the food itself was good and always plentiful. The bar on the roof is nice with great views and if you prefer smaller hotels with a bit of character rather than the big chains which are the same no matter where you are, then the Cosmopolita is for you. We were arriving extremely late (after midnight) courtesy of Ryanair, and so were slightly worried when checking in. We needn't have worried, they were expecting us and we were dealt with in a five star way, bags to the room and everything. The room was on the front of the hotel on the third floor. From the reviews I had my doubts, by the main street and too low etc. It was opposite what appeared to be a bar and the first night it was extremely busy. That said, with the double glazed windows closed, you can't hear much. It certainly wasn't as troublesome as some of the reviews would have you believe. Looking at the layout, we had one of the bigger rooms which had a two level floor, king size bed etc. The fittings were up to date and the orignal wooden floor and high ceilings with deep red walls gave it a great look and feel. The bathroom was small (particularly the shower) but it was clean and up to date as well. The bedtime chocolates were a nice touch as was the free bottle of wine for my birthday. The hotel is right near ancient Rome, you can virtually walk to all the sites with the longest walk being to the Vatican. The location is just great. Reception were extremely helpful with everything. We asked about Mario's restaraunt and they told us to say we were from the Cosmopolita. Wow did get the royal treatment, fantastic food (the halibut is amazing). I tthink we were in their over three hours - a great night. And a great stay in Rome. Would definately go back the Cosmopolita, no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: vming
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful! The rooms were comfortable and quiet. We had a little difficulty adjusting the a/c but we like a cold room. The bathroom had a nice shower with wonderful hot water and lots of water pressure. We could look out our window and see the Forum almost to the colliseum. The beds were a little firmer than we have at home but not uncomfortable. They have internet available and a laptop that cost $5 euro an hour. You could use it all at once or a little at a time. We were able to keep in touch with family daily. One of the best suggestions I heard from the staff was to go to trevi fountain early (6a.m.) and there would be no crowd for pictures. Great suggestion! We went in the afternoon and you couldn't see the fountain for the people. If you are planning a trip check to see when the Italian holidays are since they have many more than we do.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location !”
Reviews.Author: D4SUL
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and I) have just returned from a 4 night break in Rome, staying at the Cosmopolita Hotel (we booked this Hotel after having read other reviews). We arrived at the hotel at 1.30 am in the morning, had the usual hand-over of passports, got handed the card for our room and was pointed in the direction of the lift. The thing that did strike us after getting out of the lift was that there was no carpet on the floor, the floor is covered in some form of lino (not cheap and nasty) and this flooring continues into the bedrooms. The flooring is obviously alot easier to keep clean than carpet, but I was conscious of the noise that we must have been making trying to find our room at almost 2.00 am in the morning. Anyway, on entering the bedroom (Room 450) first impressions were quite good. The room itself was a decent size, it was clean and nicely furnished. The bathroom was again clean, the shower perhaps a tad on the small side, but was it was very powerful with plenty of hot water. The "hand towels" were actually napkins in disguise. They were made of thin, cotton material (and were pretty useless), but the bath towels were regular fluffy ones. The one disappointment was the safe in the room. We located it in the wardrobe, but were surprised to find that it wasn't at all secure i.e. it wasn't bolted down. You could basically pick it up and move it to another part of the room (or someone could pick it up and walk off with it when you had all your valuables in it !). It really defeats the object of having a safe if you can't use it. After having got to bed at nearly 3.00 am, we were wide awake again at 8.00 am .... having been woken up by the sound of loud Italian voices outside our room. Once we were up and dressed and in search of breakfast we found out why we had been woken up .... our room was virtually opposite the cleaners store cupboard !! Breakfast was a buffet consisting of scrambled eggs, sausage & bacon .... you can make your own toast and there were croissants, fruit, cake, yoghurts, boiled eggs, cold meats etc. More than enough to set you up for a day's sightseeing. The Hotel apparently has a roof terrace where they sell drinks/snacks but we didn't get to see what it was like .... too many things to see and too many places to go .... The Hotel is in a superb location. It is within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions, with the exception of the Vatican (we caught the bus ... but make sure you purchase your ticket BEFORE you get on ... the tobacco/paper shops sell them ... €4 for a day pass). This was our first time in Rome, and we will definitely go back .... and we would stay at the Cosmopolita Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: bonamak20
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, 10 min. walk to spanish steps and trevi fountain. 1 min walk to Via del Corso (all the shopping), view of the Emanuel Victor building and colleseum.....from our bathroom window!!! (ask for 5th floor) Didn't have to taka cab once in the 4 days we were there (except to airport) Nice staff, excellent buffet breakfast included. Clean room, tiny shower (That's Europe for ya!). Only bad thing I can say is uncomfortable bed. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: KEGALL
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. Excellent location & a short walk to the Forum, Trevi, Coluseum & only half an hour to the Vatican. Room was of a high standerd & clean. Staff are friendly. Breakfast had a lot of choice so it's worth filling up on that. My main complaint is there was no iron available which is astonishing for a 4 star hotel!! I was told if I wanted anything ironed I'd have to give it to the laundry service so I had a few creased shirts. That was by the by though & overall I would recomend this hotel, especially for it's location. There are a few nice restaurants in the area which are reasonably priced too. I would not recomend the Scottish bar on the main rd over the road from the hotel though as it's dingy, dirty & over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A Perfectly located hotel. Within walking distance from the colosseum and the Roman Forum. And if you don't mind walking it's pretty much within walking distance of most other attractions like the trevi fountain, Spanish Steps etc... Very clean and friendly helpful staff. Breakfast average but enough to get you going in the morning If we had one problem with the hotel it would be they never warned us to take identity with us. This created a problem when we accidently got on a bus and the driver wouldn't take our money (cos they don't) then an inspector got on and fined us €100 for not having a ticket or identity so he didn't no who we where. Unfair we thought but i wasn't going to argue and end up at a Police station. Apart from that unfortunate experience we managed to forget and enjoy the rest of our break from what was great location and base in the Cosmopolita Hotel. It's also right by the Via del Corsa which is the main shop thoroughfare. Considering when in Rome there is so much to do and see you don't really spend much time in the hotel anyway you couldn't get much better and the price is fine

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in Italy. The staff is superb and the location is safe, central, and convenient. The rooms are squeaky clean and comfortable and the delicious breakfast was a daily treat. There are stairs to climb, even with luggage, so if you are handicapped, you will want to choose another location. Otherwise, stay here! It's great!

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five day stay in Rome and can recommend the Hotel Cosmopolita which is close to Piazza Venezia. Good central location, close to buses and also close enough to Trevi, Colosseum, etc to walk. Room clean and comfortable and bathrooms excellent. Breakfast good and roof top bar welcoming - served good measures! Staff helpful and cheerful - only one problem, did not receive our 'wake-up' call on the last morning, which could have had disastrous consequences for our return flight! Enjoyed the free tour of St. Peter's on Tuesday morning with Mike (from Idaho?)and stayed with him for a very informative - and humorous - tour of the Vatican Museum and Sistine Chapel in the afternoon. Be sure to catch the papal blessing on Wednesday mornings at St. Peter's - we just got there in time to hear the English blessing. Did the Colosseum tour with Vito Corleone - interesting. Other highlights - the lasagne and tartufo at Tre Scalini on Piazza Navona and the gelato at Gelateria San Crispino was to die for! Enjoyed Rome and thought March was a good time to go - despite two downpours. Boy, did it rain!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Aiskth
Reviews.Content: The location cannot be beat, walking distance to many of the best attractions including the Coliseum, Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. Bus Stop across the street and within a few stops of vatican. The front desk staff is fantastic, very friendly and attentive. The included breakfast was actually worth getting up for. We were more than pleased with the size of the room and the amenities that it provided. Would reccomend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome. Only issue is that there is a night club next door so you may hear music until late at night (2:00 am) or so.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Aim_Tony
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location for site seeing and all the main attractions were easily in walking distance, with the colloseum and the Victoriana at the bottom of the road. All staff members were helpful and friendly, offering excellent advice on where to eat out and giving directions. Breakfast was average, but adequate. The decor and comfort of the hotel was well above our expecations, extremely clean and tidy. Altogether the perfect hotel for a weekend in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: lisampls
Reviews.Content: Stayed here our first and last night on a quick weekend trip to Italy on December 16th and 18th. The location really can't be beat - we walked to the Colosseum, Forum and Piazza Venezia in 5 minutes! It's also an easy walk to the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. The only time we took a cab was to the Vatican/St. Peter's Square - and had the weather been a bit nicer we likely would have walked. The hotel itself is your general European hotel - not our U.S. version of a 4-star, but nice nonetheless. I believe most of the rooms have been renovated - our first room was not - but by no means was it in bad shape! They were in the process of finishing the rest of the hotel, as at 8:30 in the morning the construction started - luckily we were on our way out so it didn't matter! Our last night we were put in a renovated room that was a little bit larger, had a small balcony, a lovely marble bathroom that actually had a bathtub! The nicest aspect of this hotel was the rooftop garden (which of course was a bit too chilly to enjoy!) but they do have a portion of it enclosed and they had a wine tasting and free dinner on Friday night when we got there! The bartender Adrian was great - and the rest of the staff was very helpful. Breakfast is included in the price and they had the typical European choices...breads, cereals, fruit, meats, cheeses - and eggs, which you don't always see. Also can't forget their "sausages" which are hot dogs! The breakfast room consists of three smaller rooms and they have the tables in there pretty tight so it gets warm - even when it was only 50 degrees outside! Anyway, it serves its purpose and we got enough to eat. As an FYI on how to get there...We had them hire a car for us that picked us up from the airport for a fee of $48 Euro, which I think is a great price. We took the shuttle to the airport on Monday morning and if I recall it was $12 Euro per person - can't beat that! We were the only ones on the shuttle and our driver even made a few stops for us so we could take some last minute photos! Oh, and if you go and it's a special occassion, be sure to mention it! It was my birthday on Sunday and when we got to our room they had a bottle of champagne chilling for us and a birthday letter...it was a really nice touch! We paid $180 Euro a night and we decided to pay that because we wanted something centrally located. I would defintely stay here again - especially when the temps are warmer so you can enjoy the rooftop garden!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: nyebaby
Reviews.Content: Cosmpolita Hotel is in center city Rome, about 15 minutes from the Vactican (walking) and 5 to the Colisuem. It's location is perfect if you want to see all the sites. Its located off via emmanuelle around the block from Vittorio Monument/Tomb of Unknown Soldier (they do changing of the Guards here, magnificent view of rome from the top). The hotel is very clean, the rooms are smaller, the bathrooms modern, the staff very good and well spoken. Area restaurants are mediocore unless u really know where you're going. I stayed at this hotel w/ my teenage son. Breakfast is very good, and plentiful. Taxis readily available (reception w/ call for free), and bus stop to Vatican on corner. We also arranged a tour to the Catacombs thru the hotel and it was good, Viaggi Carrinni Tours. Also arranged pickup from the airport, driver was late because of a flight # mixup on their end but ultimately he was terrific. Fast, and pointed out all the spot on the way to the hotel. I do think the walls are TOO thin in the hotel, you can hear the people next door and sometimes a little too close for comfort if u know what i mean... Other than that I would highly recommend the hotel for its cleanliness, location, breakfast and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mickrick7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel together with a group of 26 other people and we were all heartily disappointed with it. Between us, we occupied 17 rooms. The rooms were unbelievably tiny and claustrophobic. In most of the rooms there was simply nowhere to put your case. Our room was a double but it would be best described as a corridor. There were two single beds end to end and just enough room to shuffle between them and the wall which was hardly a metre wide. Our cases had to be kept on the beds during the day and stacked on top of each other on the floor blocking the entrance to the bathroom at night! The shower was so small we had trouble getting in and out of it. It was a real squeeze. There was nowhere to sit in the rooms. As one of our group said, "the rooms would be best suited to a young child." Either that or sardines! How on earth this hotel could be an accredited 4 star hotel is absolutely mystifying. It's true that "you only sleep in the room" but I think the room should offer at least be a modicum of comfort. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the roof top terrace bar etc was lovely and the hotel's location was excellent. However, these things certainly did not offset our disappointment and discomfort at the cramped conditions. I will NEVER stay at the Cosmopolita again even if I have to stay outside Rome!

Reviews.Title: “The great location is its best feature”
Reviews.Author: NissanUK
Reviews.Content: Great location. Turn left at the door and in one minute you're at Trajan's Column. In 10 minutes you're at the Pantheon or Trevi Fountain. We paid for a superior room and got a room that was not that superior - had a desk. If you're only there for a few days and not much in your room, the upgrade is probably not worth it. Breakfast good but the automatic coffee machine not too my taste - preferred to ask for an expresso and add hot water etc. Staff OK. All in all, what I'd expect for a 4 Star hotel. Incidentally, used Rome Shuttle Limousine for the transfers. The service cost €35 each way and was reliable and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Many good points”
Reviews.Author: ichiban
Reviews.Content: Great location, very nice breakfast buffet, pleasant staff, great view from the rooftop bar. As others have stated, this hotel is centrally located and you can easily walk to all of the tourist sites. We filled up on breakfast and headed out to explore the city. To relax in the evening, we had drinks and sandwiches at the rooftop bar. We also used a shuttle service (not through the hotel) and for 35 Euro were brought straight to the hotel from Ciampino. I will certainly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice yet affordable hotel in central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great, centrally located hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy, and this hotel provided us with just what we needed. All of your touristy attractions are within walking distance. The bus stops on the street close to the front door, and you buy bus tickets at the restaurant across the street. The hotel is surrounded by banks so you can easily exchange money. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful at all hours. The room itself was very nice. It is not large by American standards, but very adequate. You aren't in the room except to sleep! There is too much to see in Rome! The bathroom is a wee bit small, especially the shower, but IT WORKS FINE! Maid service is great. The breakfast buffet is very nice, fine food every morning (except for the hot dogs??!!!). All in all a very nice , convenient, well maintained lovely place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michael_PUk
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome, and after careful research (using this site) we selected the Hotel Cosmpolita. We got a very good rate of 180EURO per night for a double deluxe room. We booked directly with the hotel via email and the service was superb. As we were flying into Ciampino the hotel did not offer a shuttle service but did offer a limo at a cost of 48EURO...this may sound a lot but it saved so much hassle and we were at the hotel within an hour of landing! (Tip for any of you travelling to Ciampino after your stay: Leave in plenty of time just in case there are any hold ups traffic wise as we unfortunately encountered on the roads. Plus Ciampino was one of the most disorganised airports we have visited so leave plenty of time for that too!) The hotel has a great friendly atmosphere...the front desk staff were really helpful, spoke good English and nothing was too much trouble. The room was well furnished, very clean with TV, mini bar and a large comfortable bed. There was a huge selection for the self service breakfast: cooked, cereals, toast, juice, fruit I could go on! The location is also first class, the hotel is a stones throw from the Fori Imperiali, 10 minutes from the Forum, Colosseum and Trevi fountain, 15 from the Spanish Steps and about 25 to the Vatican. However, nothing is perfect and there are a few minor gripes. As it is central it is noisy...if you book a room make sure you stay in a 4th or 5th floor room overlooking Via di S Eufemia and not the Quatre Novembre. Our room was in the former and there was still considerable noise at night, especially if you like to have the window open. However some good earplugs can counterbalance this and work like a treat. The TV is pay TV for non-Italian channels..the only English channel is CNN. The roof top bar is very limited for food and despite the claims is not open on Mondays but you can purchase some good Grappa there! However, we loved the hotel and would definitely stay here when we return as the atmosphere was so warm and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: buggy23
Reviews.Content: A nice, clean, typical sized European hotel in the most perfect location in Rome. All the other reviews speak of how close it is to everything so I will not bore you with repeats. The breakfasts were very good compared to other hotels we have stayed in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights earlier in the month. We had a good sized room, with an adequate en-suite shower room. Very smart and clean. Good breakfasts. No restaurant, but a bar with snacks on the roof. Super location, especially for classical Roman antiquities. Trajan`s column and the Imperial Fora only about 200 yards from the door! The Coloseum, Roman Forum, Capitoline Museum, Pantheon and Trevi fountain all within 15 minutes walk at most. I would happily recommend the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Retreat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a six day family trip and were delighted. We booked by internet several weeks before the trip and asked for 2 quiet adjacent rooms and thats what we got (on the 3rd floor). Fortunately we were away from the main Novembre road - otherwise I can imagine it might have been a bit noisy. As the other reviews have indicated -it really is well located. We walked almost everywhere except for the Vatican where there's a direct bus (no.40 or 64)-tickets from the hotel desk for 1 euro single. Also the rooms were very clean though I can imagine large people would have had problems with the small showers. The attitude of the staff was pretty good all things considered. (we've known a lot worse). Restaurants around the hotel are fair, but we'd recommend the Trastevere area every time (near the Sisto bridge) which has more atmosphere and better value for money. Our only complaint was the breakfast which got very busy in the mornings at peak times - with a several minute queue for coffee etc and they often ran out of fruit but these are niggly items really.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: artstar.1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six-night stay in Rome at the Hotel Cosmopolita and want to recommend this lovely hotel to any travelers who are looking for a perfectly located, friendly, well-appointed place to stay. Our room was well furnished but small, as most European hotel rooms are, and the housekeeping staff kept it spotless and well-stocked with all the amenities. The room was right over a busy street, but very quiet with the windows closed - and nicely air conditioned. The breakfast room was large and pleasant, and the food offerings generous and varied. All the hotel staff were friendly and helpful, the front desk especially patient in finding us taxis and giving us directions. Two things about this hotel make it really great - the location is right, smack dab in the middle of Rome, making walking to see the city easy and taxi rides relatively inexpensive. The second is the wonderful rooftop lounge with terrific views out over the city, and the most wonderful staffer (his name is Ariel) who brings you wine, champagne, beer, etc. along with small salads, sandwiches, and crostini that were very tasty. The spot and Ariel were very charming and welcome after long days of seeing the sights. The hotel does not as yet have a full-service restaurant - its only shortcoming as far as we were concerned - but they are in the process of adding one. Do stay here - you will enjoy the experience. Google the hotel - they have nice website with many pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Dunn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary after reading OK reviews on Trip Advisor and getting a 'deal' direct with the hotel for a Delux room. The 'Delux' room was not very large, with a very small bathroom. However it was nicely furnished. The breakfast was average, the staff were not very helpful, they had no means for us to iron anything, no bath and no towelling robes = this is not a 4 star hotel, it's definitely 3. However the location is good, we could easily walk everywhere including the Vatican which took 25 minutes. As the hotel is on a very busy road I would avoid staying below the 5th floor - the Romans do not sleep! In terms of cost I dont think you can get much more for the money in Rome, although we would try somewhere else if we went back again. PS Rome is so amazing - our top European city

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A perfect location for all the sights. Colleseum about 10 minutes steady walk. we also walked to Vatican(20 mins) and Spanish steps (10 mins). Breakfast is great, cereals, fruit, sausage, egg etc. Very clean rooms. No noise from traffic. They also offer a taxi service to the airport at only 12 euro each. well worth it as it cost about 10 euro each if you find your own way by metro/train. a perfect hotel in a perfect location. Definately recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walking around Rome”
Reviews.Author: ErinPhoenix_AZ
Reviews.Content: Cosmopolita Hotel is in a perfect location for walking around Rome. My husband and I walked everywhere in the city, except for the Vatican, and no destinations took us over 15 minutes. The hotel is very close to Ancient Rome. Everything else about the hotel was great as well. The front desk staff was very helpful - we signed up for a tour through them and it was very good. They took care of everything for us; very easy. Rooftop bar and breakfast buffet were also very nice. We enjoyed quite a few drinks at the bar and had some fairly nice views of Rome. Other hotels we stayed at in Italy had amazing views, but this was still pretty good. Other reviews I read complained of noise; we did not have that problem at all. Our room overlooked a pretty busy road, but again, never had any noise problems. Ask for restaurant recommendations at the front desk - we did, and when we went to the restaurants they recommended; we were given very nice service! The front desk guys give you a card with their name on it, and then you pass it in at the restaurant - pretty slick operation. If you plan on walking through much of Rome, this is definitely a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Cosmopolita Hotel for 6 days and 6 nights in late June for our honeymoon. The location is exellent for exploring the many sights of Rome, with the Trevi Fountain, Forum, Coliseum, and great shopping and dining just minutes away. The staff was courteous and helpful, especially the guys working in the rooftop terrace. I would suggest eating off the property however, as you can find better food for the money. Our room was small compared to American standards, but was very clean and comfortable. The mattress was especially firm, but after long days and nights of sightseeing, it was of no issue to us. The bathroom, as previously reported in this forum, is small, but again very clean. The shower is comparable to a standard "stand-up" shower here in the U.S. Breakfast was wonderful, with bacon, eggs, bread, cereal, juice, yogurt, cheese, among other things. It was more than enough to fill my wife and I up until lunch and then some. I would recommend ordering coffee from one of the waitresses. The coffee that comes out of the machine is not very good. Overall, we were very satisfied with our stay at the Cosmopolita Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to Rome the city...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolita Hotel is ideally situated to explore the major sites of Rome. The staff were warm, friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. Our room, although quite small, was decorated to a high standard with a lovely view from the window and much needed air conditioning! The Roof Terrace offered fantastic views over the entire city and served an excellent selection of snacks and beverages. The substantial Breakfast offered everything; from traditional bacon and eggs (& boiled eggs cooked to a choice of 3, 5 or 6 minutes!) to fresh fruit, bread, cheeses and cereal. The Forum, Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Pantheon are a stone’s throw away. I am certainly hoping to go back to this hotel again in the future to explore more of the City and would highly recommend staying at the Cosmopolita.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star quality”
Reviews.Author: moomin_papa
Reviews.Content: We had 2 twin rooms at this hotel on the 1st floor. When we arrived, the rooms were not ready. Eventually, 1 room ws prepared, after probably 20 mins. The 2nd room was not ready until after 40 - 50 mins had passed. When I and my friend opened the door to the 2nd room, we were pretty taken aback. The room was very narrow. The 2 single beds were set head to head with a cabinet separating the two because the room was that narrow - 2 people couldn't pass each other without one person moving out of the way. The room was at one side of the building, explaining the layout and narrowness, but really, this room would have been more suited as a largish utility room. The bathroom was tiny - the shower cubicle was very small indeed. The window wouldn't open at different points, it would swing open all the way, meaning that you could be seen from the rooms opposite! The other room was quite compact with very little space to walk freely. The bathroom was bigger than ours, but again, the shower cubicle seemed quite small. Breakfast was very good, with a selection of hot and cold items in buffet style. The reception staff were generally friendly and helpful. If you need ATAC (public transport) tickets, I'd advise getting them from the reception to make it easier. The hotel was very clean and smart. In summary, definitely not a 4 star hotel, especially compared to some of the hotels I've stayed at in the past. I'd rate it at 3 stars. Maybe Rome, and Italy in general, has slightly different rating standards compared to elsewhere, in which case, I'd adjust my expectations if I were you. Luckily, we were not in the hotel that much as we were too busy cramming in things to do into 4 days! Go to Rome - it is amazing, but be careful about the choice of hotel and check the room sizes if this concerns you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: espruytte
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the excellent reviews I read on Tripadvisor. What a smart decision! You cannot beat the location of this hotel: Coliseum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps,... are all within a 10 minute walking distance. Vatican City is a 20 minute walk. The staff of this hotel are very friendly, which is certainly not common in Rome. The rooms and common areas are very clean and the size of our room was reasonable compared to other hotels in Rome. There is a very nice rooftop bar and terrace where you can enjoy a drink and relax after a long day: the view is fantastic! Last but certainly not least, there is a true buffet breakfast with hot and cold dishes, cereals, bread, yoghurts,... Please make sure to special order the complimentary espresso or cappucino, which are much tastier than the coffee from the machine. I will book the Cosmopolita again for my next Rome visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: claire1912
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location for all tourist attractions. Staff were friendly and the breakfast was v.good. The room was a bit small but was nicely decorated and we had a big double bed. We had requested a room at the back of the hotel due to street noise, but the hotel has wooden floors so you still hear the noise of other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic nightmare in Rome”
Reviews.Author: llcoolrd
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a special surprise for my girlfriend, knowing that high quality hotels and rooms is important for her. So, after hours and hours of searching, this one seemed to offer one of the best prices for what it was offering in terms of quality and location. As soon as I booked it, I contacted the hotel by phone and email to ask about a possible room upgrade, given the very special nature of my holiday. To my surprise the offered me the upgrade in a high floor room, in a very spacious and quality room (for Rome standards). We were blessed. The room was infact very nice, although I personally dont like the European version sleeping ie 2 single beds, rather than 1 double for a happy couple! The location for both sightseeing, ice cream shops, trevi fountain, collosseum, everyting in historic rome was there, even all the buses in the city pass just out side the hotel. my only complain about the hotel was that there was no ventilation in the room, being their winter in November/December (by London standard 20c is not winter!), hence the only air coming out of the cooling system was hot air. The evening duty staff seemed a bit unhelpful and rude ' this is our winter, we find it cold', so when we opened the window for air, it was very noisy. I would recommend a room not facing the street if you go in winter months, esp if you need cool air to sleep. Having said that, the day time hotel staff ( a blond lady) was amazingly helpful, professional and gave us best advise and poiners and maps, she always willing to help. The breakfast was also quite decent and it gave us a good start to the day. Some other city hotels had small supermarkets just outside, this one didnt, so we had to walk about 10-12 minutes to the nearest one. Mildy inconvinient but nothing to discourage anyone from visiting. Now- the only reason I call this a nightmare is because we got robbed on our way to the airport and missed our flights! we stayed in a dodgy motel near the ciampino airport and nearly missed the flight on the next day again, since Rome public transport outside the city (ie to aiports) is really terrible. Be careful with wallets, bags, camerca cos the thiefs can rob you ans you wont even notice anything. This is no reflection on the hotel, as we had already checked out of the hotel anyway- but no body gives you a warning, that there is so so much pick pocketing is Rome, so maybe the hotel should be a good starting point for such info. Bottom line- a good hotel , central location and a good memory of a specail trip.
